Reviews.Title: “The Dana hotel is a very clean, chic hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie B
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel and would have given it 5 stars but we didn't know there was construction going on in the building (March 2012) and there is only ONE ice machine. Other than that I have no complaints. The room was very clean, chic and modern. The floor to ceiling windows lend a great view of the city. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I loved the location. We didn't need a car rental which was great seeing as it costs $40/day to park there. If I ever get to Chicago again I would definitely stay at the Dana.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Dana”
Reviews.Author: dn9999
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and within walking distance of a lot of things to do. We got an awesome rate on the room so we decided to upgrade to a corner king, def. recommend doing so if it's in your budget, you get a lot of great views of the city. The staff was super helpful and friendly, any questions or needs you may have the staff was there to help. We were able to squeeze in some time for the spa, I thought my facial was just ok but my husband said his massage was amazing. It was pretty pricey but I sort of expected that. The thing I didn't love about this hotel was the bathroom, I felt it could have been cleaner and hated the fact that the privacy curtain for the shower was on the outside of the bathroom. But besides that we had a wonderful time and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique-style hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: PointsAddict
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Dana recently and was very impressed...rooms are laid out well and bathrooms are nice and large. Furniture in rooms is modern but comfortable...and the food...yum! I would recommend the Aja Oreos....not your standard oreos by any means! The rooftop lounge is also very cool....only a few minute walk from Michigan Ave...overall great hotel

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PinayExplorer
Reviews.Content: Great location.. Everything is within walking distance.. Quiet neighborhood.. The rooms are spacious, clean, comfy, and modern.. Most of all very affordable!

Reviews.Title: “Loud! Great place to stay if you like feeling like you are sleeping on the street!”
Reviews.Author: Bos2nTraveler01
Reviews.Content: Granted, I was there the Thursday night before St Patrick's Day through the day after but still, with single-paned floor-to-celing, windows, I heard every whistle, horn beeping and voice. And the light blocking shades still let a fair amount of light in Got a great group rate of 129/night or so, staff was friendly and attentive and the restaurant was really good, but I was there for a multi-day nonprofit board meeting and was thoroughly exhausted from not being able to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but party hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikeheaven
Reviews.Content: We were impressed by our room at this hotel. Wood and carpeting, rain shower, reasonably priced minibar, large windows, ipod dock sound system, plasma tv, hyper comfy sheets, so perfect but... Saturday night arrived and the party started. They have a very popular nightspot at this hotel and clients that go there during their stay. So they have to guard the elevators on saturday night because there is a lot of people wanting to cut the line outside and use the inside hotel elevators. And i think that the hotel's clients can go back to their room from inside...so there was noise all night in our corridor, culminating at 3:30 am ( we went to bed at 1am) when a group of people arrived and spent 10 minutes in the corridor shouting and laughing. At some point i went to open and close my door with a bang to make them realize they were in a hotel. They shouted insanities at us through our door and continued their noise for 15 minutes then came back to knock violently at our door. Earlier in the day another client complained to us in the elevator that the night before two men came out of the elevator at the same time he did and followed him to his room..cautioning us to be careful. I am sorry to think and say that this hotel management's want to make money and be hip with a trendy nightspot at the expense of the comfort and security of their hotel customers. I will not go back to the dana for that reason only

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in town (so far); go with a corner room (really!)”
Reviews.Author: uskern
Reviews.Content: I spent about 3 weeks in Chicago this year, in many different hotels. I liked Dana a lot. Although quite expensive (only an online deal made it an affordable option for us, too), it was definitely worth the price. The rooms are beautifully designed, everything was taken care of. The windows are just huge; and it makes it even better if you get a corner (king) room. We loved the views; I think we have never ever spent so much time indoors; you almost don't want to leave. Internet is free (which is great), beverages in the fridge are nice (but too expensive, same to the candy prices; check out Whole Foods right around the hotel's corner instead). The Gym comes with some fancy machines - but we missed simple (and effective) things like pilates mats or therabands. With almost no more money left, there was no way for us to check out the SPA (guess what, its not a bargain). Parking is about 40 bucks a night (outdoors, right next to the hotel). When we asked for "the" manager (because of an IT issue), staff seemed a little bit confused (it looked like there are many different people responsible for only their own area and nobody overlooking everything?!). Anyway, staff was very friendly, professional and obliging.

Reviews.Title: “Location is perfect, upscale, modern”
Reviews.Author: allygirl60
Reviews.Content: We got a room at Dana Hotel and Spa off priceline; hadn't heard of this spot before but loved it. The location was second to none, easy access to all the places you'd want to go on Michigan Ave, nice walk to Millennium park (have to go to Intelligentsia coffee down there) and such. The room is nicely laid out, on the small side, but that isn't an issue here. The most comfy bed...great rain shower...floor to ceiling windows. Friendly desk staff and valet attendants. Loved the place and can't wait to go back-hope we can get a great rate!!

Reviews.Title: “My go-to hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: beentheredonethat56
Reviews.Content: With a wealth of hotels to choose from in the Chi area, I have sampled from the best. Many of them have been quite good, but for the past couple of years, I've opted for the Dana. Location-wise, it's just off the Magnificent Mile in the midst of everything that particular stretch has to offer. Room-wise, it's got everything I need -- they're relatively spacious, have floor to ceiling windows/Juliet balconies that afford you a great view or if it's a balcony, just some fresh air (a great alternative to air conditioning), to-die-for bathrooms situated in the middle of the room (with glass-enclosed showers that let you see out while you shower if you desire, or shades if it's privacy you want), wonderful bath amenities, and -- something I've never had at any other hotel -- hand-made chocolates/candies in their honor bar in lieu of the usual M&Ms etc. Plush bathrobes and slippers too. Room service is good (in terms of offerings and timeliness) and the food is fine. The gym is just OK, unfortunately. Rather small & cramped, there is only 1 workout bench and only a couple of machines. Earlier this week I was there with 4 other (unrelated) guests and we were falling over each other and jealously watching as soon as someone finished his/her reps or workout so we could grab the equipment before anyone else. Dana management -- this is an easy fix -- please expand. The restaurant (Aja, pronounced like the continent) is pretty good too. I've only eaten there once (there are so many choices in this neck of the woods), but when I did, the menu was varied and unusual, and the service good -- even a bit over the top (I lost count of the number of people who checked in with us to make sure everything was OK); I almost expected the chef to be next! Unless my company changes its travel policy, I expect to continue to stay here, esp if they expand the gym.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great views, well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Amanda S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two night of our honeymoon at the Dana Hotel. The floor to ceiling windows held capitvating views of the city. The accomodations were very comfortable and well worth the money we spent. After using the spa inspired shower, my normal shower back at home was just not the same! The location could not be beat! We were able to walk to neary everything we wanted. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Love the dana.”
Reviews.Author: codyadalyn
Reviews.Content: I adored staying at this hotel when I was able to get a good rate for a mid-week business stay. The room had an amazing view (26th floor) and was so well appointed. The media center in the room was a great touch and let me plug in my ipod and relax to my own music. I loved the room furnishings and how it was layed out (even the glass wall in the shower that seperated the bed from the bathroom). The staff was helpful - if not a little bit snooty. Overall, I would LOVE to stay here for a weekend in the city, if I could figure out when this hotel would fit my budget on a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: DJC1968
Reviews.Content: I'll write this review assuming those going to Chicago are familiar with the River North/Maginficent Mile part of town, just north of the Chicago River. The hotel was very nice. There lounge/bar on the 43rd floor (Vertigo) is very popular. Constant lines form outside the hotel for this place. One of the more popular clubs in town. The room was half wood floor, half commercial carpet. The bathroom had a rain showerhead and was very modern. There's an Ipod docking station with speakers next to the flat screen TV. Ice was on the 5th floor. They have a spa and weightroom on the 4th floor. I love the steam room in the men's locker room. Nice way to relax and relieve stress. We brought booze and mix...as we always do...and inevitably spilled some on the floor. I was pleased to see that that maid actually moppoed the wood portion of the floor. They really did a good job with the cleaning. I'd recommend to anybody staying in the River North/Mag. Mile area of Chicago. I saw one review on here and the lady didn't have anything nice to say. She obviously didn't stay there. If I were a business owner, I'm guessing this is precisely the type of patron whose business I would NOT want - just seems like this is someone who can't be pleased no matter what. In fairness to her, I didn't eat at Aja, their in-hotel restaurant, but I find it hard to believe the waiter spilled water on EVERYBODY'S lap as she stated. Any how...this is a very nice hotel. Completely remodeled in a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hospitality and service at Vertigo Sky Lounge”
Reviews.Author: Charles H
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I had our engagement party at Vertigo Sky Lounge on 3/6/12. Vertigo is the elegant lounge/nightclub on the roof of the Dana Hotel. We coordinated plans through Gino Bartucci. Gino and the entire staff at Vertigo made our party a huge success and absolutely flawless. We actually had guests calling us the next day saying how much fun they had (how often does that happen...?). The bartenders were fast and friendly. Food (appetizers) were great. Music and sound system was top notch. Crowd was sexy and sophisticated. We did not stay at the actual hotel, but did walk through. Very elegant and modern. If the rest of the staff at the Dana Hotel is as superb as Gino and the Vertigo staff, I would highly recommend staying with them. Charles and Ashley

Reviews.Title: “If you want your special Event ruin Book here”
Reviews.Author: Beedo
Reviews.Content: One of the worse experiences doesn't even begin to describe the experience we had. My sister Caryn, had her thirtieth birthday here. I thought wow, a bit extravagant...but really it's a HUGE birthday marker for her and she really deserves to be pampered. So I though, why not? They'll make sure she's taken care of...BOY WAS I WRONG, read her testimonial since I wasn't there with her bad experience...SO, MY bad experience she didn't mention. A week prior my sister asked me if I wanted to get a treatment and have a girls day for her birthday. Very EXCITED I said yes, and asked her to book me a facial. The night before (less than 12 hours notice) they contacted her and stated they were cancelling my appointment and gave no reason. Caryn doesn't like to complain and asked me if that was ok...I was disappointed but, didn't want to cause a problem and just let it go. Later that night we were supposed to have dinner at AJA, Dana hotel's restaurant. When we walked in the restaurant's hostess looked at us like we were crazy when we said we had a reservation with Caryn. We had to call Caryn for the hostess to acknowledge we had a reservation. The hostess told us that we HAD to wait for the rest of the party in the bar area WHICH IS NOT HEATED and it was the same temperature as the outside. My Father, who is elderly, could not sit in this cold room and we insisted to be seated. After having an argument with the manager they obliged. We sat down and the bus boy proceeded to pour water in our glasses and our laps. YES OUR LAPS. For some bizarre reason he poured the water into the glass spilling it and then proceeded to continue to pour outside the glass on the table and into our laps. And he did that to all 15 settings of the table. Caryn had not arrived and we didn't want to spoil her evening so politely mentioned it to the waiter and he apologized. We ordered our drinks and they gave us a canter (of sake) that leaked. SO half the sake went into the glass and half went onto the table. The waiter apologized and was super embarrassed. He was kind enough to give us extra napkins to clean up the mess the buss boy and the faulty canter created. We ordered our food...Which was a complete disaster and completely disorganized. One by one when our food eventually came out. SERIOUSLY EVENTUALLY, from the time we ordered the food to the first course to arrive at our table was an HOUR. By this time we were all RAVENOUS but, relieved at the sight of the first plate coming out. We were all staring at the first plate of food, like starving wolves just coming out of winter and finding a dead carcass, and thinking in relief, "OH GREAT, my food won't be very far off behind." YEAH, we were wrong. Not wanting to be rude the ONE person who got their food waited until someone else got their food...Which was 10 minutes later...I KID YOU NOT! I have never had service like this. Literally only one person every 10 MINUTES got their food. The food was cold by the time the next plate came out. By this time we encouraged everyone just to eat when they got their food. The delivery of the food was to ridiculous we actually asked the staff to cancel the rest of the orders. 10 Minutes later the REST of the food arrived! Miraculously.It only took TWO HOURS TO GET EVERYONE ONE FED. I use the word FED loosely. This whole dinner was supposed to be $1000...for a $1000 dinner one would think they would have their stuff together and at the very lease feed the customers properly. After dinner here we had to have dinner again somewhere else. The portions were substandard, wasn't all that good, and the service lacked. Our waiter did what he could with what he had so, I can't say he was a bad waiter...Just everything else. After that pathetic dinner My family went upstairs to Caryn's room when we arrived at the floor there was BOOMING music coming from all directions. I asked Caryn if she was taking us to the night club, she laughed and said "No, Apparently this is the party floor." The room was nice and spacious and the view was nice. The wait staff arrived to set up the room for her party (which is why I am surprised that they gave her such a hard time after we left) Overall, I am very disappointed in this whole experience and I am even more so upset that our family PLUNKED down all that money for a special occasion that was ruined by Dana Hotel. If you want your special event to be ruined go here.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome room with a view”
Reviews.Author: lgd-chi
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff and views from my interesting room at the far north end of the hotel. Finishes are a little worn on the furniture, but the room and bathroom were wonderfully designed and the bed was extremely comfortable. I thought the breakfast food was fine, but the service and the food were not nearly as good as some similar hotels nearby. I would go out for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Location”
Reviews.Author: Matt A
Reviews.Content: I travel about 80% for work and have seen far too many hotels. dana has set a new standard and easily my favorite boutique hotel, Chicago or anywhere. Fantastic location in one of downtown Chicago's best area. Easy access to the hotel by limo, cab, or CTA from the airports, and on-site valet if you're driving into town. Even easier access to all of Chicago's neighborhoods (Gold Coast, Lincoln Park, Loop, West Loop) once you're there. You really can't get more central than dana, and the immediate surroundings have some great accommodations within walking distance. From Vertigo (rooftop bar) to aja (main floor restaurant) to the spa services and everything in between, the service was nothing short of perfect. Every employee we came across was attentive, courteous, and professionally -- yet somehow non-intrusive. Truly 5 star service. The room was impeccable. From the gorgeous design to the attention to detail, I couldn't have asked for anything more. Chicago is a noisy city, but the moment we walked into the room, everything was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hidden gem on N. State Street, Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Stacie B
Reviews.Content: My husband recently booked a trip for a celebration with friends and booked the Dana. We go to Chicago on a regular basis and had never heard of the property. Actually have walked right by it on several occasions! It was wonderful! The Corner King Room (south facing is a must) was amazing -- floor to ceiling windows and a great view of State Street in the eve. Beds were to die for, rain shower was great! Weekend parking rate was $43 for the entire time. Location, location, location!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel - great location and rates!”
Reviews.Author: Hi_Fi_Guy
Reviews.Content: Dana Hotel & Spa is a boutique hotel in the heart of Chicago in the River North area next to the Gold Coast. The hotel is situated near many attractions and only a block away from the Magnificent Mile shopping district and many restaurants. Modern & trendy decor perfect for couples or singles looking to have a great time. Families with young children would fare better elsewhere. + Corner suite spacious with separate living and sleeping areas. Perfect for entertaining. + Aja restaurant and lobby bar open all day. Decent breakfast & sushi, very nice prime beef sliders. Great cocktails and bar drinks. Better selection of wine and liquor than the rooftop bar. + If you enjoy hotels like the W, Hard Rock, as well as trendy non-chain boutique hotels you will feel right at home when visiting Dana Hotel and Spa. - VERTIGO SKY LOUNGE is popular but also packed on Saturday nights. Focus is on bottle service with few liquor options (lobby bar is far superior for cocktails) Club bouncers take over elevators making it very difficult to get up to your room between the hours of 9PM-1AM. Hotel should allocate one of the three elevators for hotel guest use only. - City noises can be heard even on high floors. Not a deal breaker but worth noting. - Like most of Chicago the service is indifferent and quiet. Everything is available to you if you ask for it but very little is offered. Don't think this to be rude, there is a respectful distance and patience practiced in Chicago that can appear rude to those visiting from areas with more aggressive service cultures like NY or LA. Bell services, car services, concierge services and other amenities can be arranged so do not hesitate to ask. TRANSPORTATION: Much of what you may want to see and do in Chicago is within walking distance. For attractions farther afield Dana Hotel is 2 blocks away from several public transit lines and cab rides rarely exceeded $10 when traveling to The Field Museum or restaurants that were farther away. Dana hotel doormen were always able to hail a cab for us within seconds, not minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, Great location”
Reviews.Author: MVGriff
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location by Michigan Avenue and the rooms were very comfortable. Some street noise was a problem. And the set up with the shower is a little odd (there is a glass wall from the shower into the room)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay on NYE”
Reviews.Author: KaratheTravelAgent
Reviews.Content: I loved The Dana hotel!!! We stated here over NYE and went to the Vertigo Lounge for the party. Here is my breakdown. Rooms: you have to stay in a corner suite, they are incredible! The room was favourite part of the stay. The floor to wall windows are the stand out feature. Location: great location, close to lots of restaurants. Only a short walk to The Magnificant Mile for great shopping. Service: wonderful! Everyone was super friendly, especially the door men! All in all it was just a really cool place to stay in Chigago. The design of the room and lobby are unique and are really what sets this place when you compare it to the big name hotel. I would whole heartily recommend this hotel to everyone planning a trip here!!

Reviews.Title: “Gem in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Nicholas D
Reviews.Content: This is a very trendy, fun place to stay. My girlfriend loved it and anytime someone is coming into town we recommend it. The food is excellent, although the only complaint was that the nueskis bacon wasn't the black pepper crusted type, which is the best bacon on the planet. Other than the small disappointment here we were both thrilled with the room, service, and food. slightly pricey, but you get a lot more than the average hotel. def a step up from the more popular W downtown. And close to a lot of great downtown and river-north spots.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago top 10!”
Reviews.Author: Pauljoseph75
Reviews.Content: I spend about 6 weekends a year in Chicago (in the warmer months) just for pleasure. I have stayed at just about all the "hip" hotels in downtown. I was just planning my next trip this morning and was shocked to see the Dana ranked at #24. Dana is easily a top 10 Chicago hotel. Sure you have the big boys like Trump, Waldorf, etc... YAWN! Im in my 30's not my 80's. I am originally from Chicago and currently living in Florida. I travel quite frequently for fun and enjoy trying new hotels and restaurants. I was very impressed with the Dana hotel, from the doormen to the random cleaning staff in the hallway. You can't beat the views in Dana (try the corner rooms) AMAZING! Its in a great location to many fun chitown activities. In summer the rooftop bar is fantastic! Dana showers are written about all the time in magazine articles. I can't say enough about my endorsement of Dana. I was last in Chicago in October and happened to be close to Dana and thought about getting a drink at the rooftop bar. I stopped by the doorman and asked if it was open yet for the evening and unfortunately it was not, however the doorman and I chatted for a good 3-5 minuets about where I should head to instead. I wasn't even a guest that weekend! Just good people and Great vibe at Dana. So if you are thinking about a chitown trip try these guys out! Also... don't leave Chicago without trying Lou Malnatis chicago style pizza and Portillos for an italian beef and chicago dog. My favorite upscale restaurant is by far MK's on Franklin its out of this world. Anyways, I am now second guessing trip advisor all together. Can you buy your ranking with them? I thought this was a public forum of unbiased opinion based on actual experience? rning and decided to look up my favorite resource for public opinion on travel, "trip advisor". I was SHOCKED to see the Dana ranking at #24. The Dana is easily a top 10 hotel in Chicago. I mean y

Reviews.Title: “Noisy. Understandably so, but come on.”
Reviews.Author: tifnegrace
Reviews.Content: The hotel door was not properly sealed or just too short as there was a 1/2 inch gap between floor and door. Thus all the hall traffic was very noticeable. The rooftop bar was very loud and open very late. Seemed like it was on the floor right above us. (fyi I am in my 20s so if it bothered me I can only imagine what other guests thought) The room was bare or contemporary however you look at it. Bed was comfortable. Great location. Keurig coffee maker. LOVED the shower setup. Floor to ceiling windows with nice views. Booking with the hotel allowed a $10 pp voucher for breakfast, making breakfast almost free each morning, a plus. Must take the elevator/stairs from ground level to lobby on 2nd floor. Then two elevators are available from 2nd level to your room. Inconvenient. (This set up is thanks to the rooftop bar that uses the 1st floor to load guests. Thus hotel guests are stuck waiting for a elevator as they are bypassed for the rooftop bar. Hotel guests have to use their room keys to stop on guest floors but still security is a concern with people other than hotel guests using the elevators.) Spa was average. Maybe it's me but I can't enjoy a massage with the sound of horns honking like they are right in my room. Move the spa up from the 3rd level or the massage rooms away from exterior walls!

Reviews.Title: “3 days in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: johnmcd2
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel and flight stay at the Dana thru Bookit.com. The Hotel was excellent in every way. Upon arrival we were escorted into the front lobby and eagerly helped. Our room was not quite ready so we left our luggage and walked a block and a half to Pizzeria Duo. Once we were able to get into our room we were very pleased. I upgraded to the Corner room and bow was it worth it. The floor to ceiling windows made for incredible morning and night time views. The stay at the Dana was way more than we were expecting. For a couples trip it is the perfect hotel close to everything and nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Awesome Room”
Reviews.Author: LoveMyThree3
Reviews.Content: Perfect place to relax and enjoy Chicago. Rooms are modern and very cool. Restaurants galore all around this hotel. Roof top bar was different and lots of fun.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST.”
Reviews.Author: bluexessence
Reviews.Content: After a horrible visit to another hotel in Chicago, Dana HOTEL IS HEAVEN!!!! Great price. Good location. Great service. I will come back for sure! Cool room designs. Bed is like sleeping on a comfy cloud.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Christmas shopping”
Reviews.Author: tennman2
Reviews.Content: We have gone to Chicago to Christmas shop 36 consecutive years. In all those trips, Dana Hotel rates in the top 5 places we have stayed. Although not on Michigan Ave., it is only a couple of blocks walking distance and is on State Street so most shopping and 100's of restaurants are only a short bus ride away. The people at Dana were just outstanding and went above and beyond in helping resolve an airline issue. The room was spacious with all glass walls (get the corner rooms) and a gorgeous view of the city and all the lights. Lake Michigan is not visible, but the lights of the city at night are breathtaking. I did not have theopportunity to use the spa but heard it is among the best in Chicago. Dana is a world class hotel for less than Marriiott, Hilton, etc.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: symphony88
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here and loved it! It is near the shopping area and there are lots of good restaurants around it. Also, the room is quite spacious and it has a floor to ceiling windows with a view of downtown chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, modern, nice rooms but NOISY ac!”
Reviews.Author: steevke
Reviews.Content: I'm actually still staying in the hotel, today is my last night. Arrived here on Saturday, and I was really surprised. The hotel is nicely decorated, beds are comfy, the smoothies are great, the restaurant is fun, the gym is small but it'll do for a quick workout. There's a nice rooftop bar, well worth a visit. The only thing I don't like is the really noisy AC, so only 4 stars. I would definitely come back if I were to be in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Agnieszka A
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for my birthday and the hotel is simply amazing! I love the decor and the friendly staff. I wasn't a huge fan of the complementary breakfast that the hotel offers. The available choices of foods was very limited, but that might have been due to the fact that we walked down a little bit closer to 9am. Not sure, but looked like some of the foods were out already. Overall, we were very happy with our stay and talk about that hotel everytime we think of that trip.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary & Great price”
Reviews.Author: DeskJobDaydreamer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband the week after Christmas (Dec 2011). The hotel is contemporary and swanky, and showing signs that it's gently worn (i.e., scuffed up floor molding, chipped paint on furniture edges, tattered linens). Rooms are TINY, but very clever design almost makes up for it. Imagine that the room felt almost like a cabin in a ship, but with high ceilings. Front-desk staff and concierge were helpful, young, and not snooty. (I often feel that, in "fancy" hotels, the staff want everyone to be rich, and that was not the case here.) Highly recommend this hotel. Note about rooms: if you are sharing a room with friends (i.e., to save $) or someone you are not that close to - think again. Between the bedroom and bathroom, there is just a glass wall (with a curtain). Not much privacy for sounds and scents from bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Modern & beautiful, Great location”
Reviews.Author: travelbug2009_9
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, close to magnificent mile. The hotel was just recently renovated. the shower was huge and loved the ability to switch from showerhead to wall shower. The towels and bedding was extremely comfortable. room was big enough for a king size bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jerzdiner
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Hotel Dana and had a excellent experience. Location is great and every staff member we dealt with was professional, courteous and very helpful. The rooms are very comfortable(stayed a Serene Rain King or something along those lines-it was the one around 335 SqF) and it had all the amenities I needed and the perfect amount of space. I have stayed in many of the boutique and regular hotels in the Magnificent Mile area and I would rank this among the best in terms of hospitality and quality. When I was looking at this hotel a few mentioned that they could hear neighboring rooms and the walls were thin. I never had this issue nor did it seem that way at all. I would not hesitate to stay here again. The hotel also has a nice bar on the first floor and a great rooftop lounge (both indoor and out and open year round) that during the week is not too busy and a nice stop for a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: russian33
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for our weekend getaway to Chicago by reading tripadvisor reviews, and we were not disappointed. The location is prime...so close to everything. The hotel is very cool, modern. The service is top notch, from the front door, to the check in. Rooms are cozy, with a balcony, comfortable beds, cool bathrooms (really liked the showers ;-) Will stay here again, when we're in Chicago. And will recommend this to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff !!”
Reviews.Author: MichellePs
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to the Dana Hotel & Spa did not disappoint. We got a great rate over Christmas for the tranquil suite. The shower alone was worth it! The room was nice, views were great, but what really made this hotel stand out was the staff. From Ceasar, the doorman ( and others) to the maintenance man who had to fix our thermostat, they were all super friendly. The staff at Aja, including Matt & Mary and the whole morning team were attentive and friendly. The location of the hotel was perfect for us. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to celebrate the new year.”
Reviews.Author: rogerandvirginia
Reviews.Content: Staff was always on go. Very informative and always with a smile. Our corner king room was divine. The view all the way down state street was fabulous. Yes, you could hear all the city noises. Sirens, honks,traffic but for the view it was all worth it. See thru shower was great for a couple, but I would say this hotel is not for children. Most couples traveling would like that. Location, location, location. Central to everything. We loved the bed, service, and modern style of this hotel. Would for sure stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: msremedy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Dana with my two sons for a college touring trip. We've stayed there several times and find it a great value with wonderful service. We stayed in a Divine Double at a fantastic rate. The Divine Double is clean and spacious with beautiful floor to ceiling windows. Not one-way glass so you must use the shades! They also have black-out shades. The rooms have wood floors up to the bed area which is carpeted. I-pod docking station and nice flat screen TV. They have an honor bar which has reasonably priced beverages and snacks as well as beer/wine. There is however a Trader Joe's right around the corner. I absolutely love, love the shower. It has a rain head and a hand held shower which you can direct according to your height; great water pressure! We ate dinner one night at Aja and had an assortment of sushi which was delicious. The bartender makes the absolutely best mango cocktail (which I have not quite been able to duplicate even though they shared the recipe!). The staff goes out of their way to accommodate. My older son brought his road bike which they carefully stowed for him. Rates include a $10 off breakfast ticket per person/per night if you book directly through the hotel. Excellent breakfast menu includes hot oatmeal, pancakes, french toast and wonderful omlettes/eggs dishes. Used the work out facilities; small but adequate. Parking was around $40 per night. Typical for Chicago. The Vertigo Sky Lounge on the roof was nice when we stayed without the kids. However for a real view go to the Hancock Tower's 96th floor lounge for a few drinks and hors' d oeuvres. Kid-friendly and can dress in jeans. Only a 5-10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bachlorette Party”
Reviews.Author: LauraE10
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived at The Dana it was raining. Ceasar greeted us with an umbrella and indivdually took us to the front door. He was very nice and accomodating. The hotel was beautifully decorated for Christmas as we walked through the lobby. We checked in and the concierge arranged to have 3 taxis pick us up at a specific time. We loved the rooms, even the rustic concrete ceilings. The only thing we didn't care for was the glass bathroom wall, but it would be great for a romantic getaway! The beds were a great size and were very comfortable. We also loved the Sky Vertigo Lounge located in the hotel. All the girls had a wonderful time, and I hope to return! The service was amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice contemporary hotel”
Reviews.Author: candychi
Reviews.Content: We visited the Dana for a couple of days over Christmas. The room was lovely and the service was good. No complaints. We also visited the Spa. The mani/pedi with a glass of wine (as it was at 10am, it would have been nice if I'd been offered a mimosa instead but whatever) was nice and my husband reports that he had the best massage EVER. The hotel entrance is on the 2nd floor which is confusing at first. It definitely could be a little more welcoming at the restaurant/valet level.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: SonalNigam
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Dana Hotel on a business trip to Chicago for 6 days. The room was spacious with a HUGE iPOD doc!!! The location of the hotel is optimum to go and explore the commercial center of Chicago which is lined up with lovely shopping plazas and boutiques. The staff was attentive and took care of their guests. Their conference suit have good facilities and have a lovely view of the street. I also sampled their lunch and dinner and was very pleased with the vegetarian options they had. The breakfast menu in the morning is really filling and good. I had Salmon and Egg Benedict and it was very tasty. The rooftop bar is a good place to visit and had good selection of drinks. Overall happy with the stay. I got confused at times when coming downstairs via lift but then its not a big deal if the stay is comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Best Anniversary Yet”
Reviews.Author: beachbumIllinois
Reviews.Content: Yes It's us again,Posting yet another great review of this absolutely excellent Hotel.We stayed at the Dana on the 30Th through the 1st for our 20Th anniversary,and as usual Yolanda,Joe,Justin,Ashley,Tim,Richard,Matt,Caesar And the rest of the staff found out it was our anniversary.I didn't think it was possible,but they made sure our weekend was one to remember.We arrived on Friday around 12:00 PM.We didn't think our room would be ready until 3:00.We were met at the front desk with a smile and welcome home Jon and Lisa your room is ready and here is your keys .We took our bag to the room,then went downstairs to the bar,had a few drinks from Richard,went to dinner,had some great fondue.We came back to the hotel where we sought out Yolanda,The hotel manager.Honestly,I can see why the staff is the way they are after talking to her.She is one of the nicest people we have ever met.And so is the rest of the staff.These people really do love their jobs.On new years eve we sat in the bar until about 10:30,our bartender was beautiful Ms.Ashley.Whome by the way was working her tail off serving people all night.Ow i forgot to mention when we went up to the room when we arrived they sent up more MGD,and i didn't have to call down.Too many nice things to mention.We will be returning to the Dana.Service,Beautiful rooms,Great food,and the people that truly make you feel special.Thanks you guys and gals..

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lpvillarreal35
Reviews.Content: Dana has surpassed all of my expectations. We arrived late on a Friday night to spend a long holiday weekend in from the city from Florida. The check in process was seamless and the front desk was very helpful with providing information. The only con was in reference to some of the shared areas to include the elevator seemed a little "worn" however, this was all overlooked once I stepped into our room with corner views of the city AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “Bittersweet experience”
Reviews.Author: lopezsalvador92
Reviews.Content: This hotel has good potential without a doubt. From the moment I contact them to make a reservation, the person assisting me was helpful and always wrote a prompt response. The check in was smooth and quick. This trip was to celebrate our first anniversary and we decided to book a corner room because of the view. We weren't disappointed by the room. Everything was perfect except for two little issues with the tv and safe not working at the moment we arrived, but it was fixed in no time. The view was amazing and the location could not be better. The bed was incredibly comfortable. Checking out could have been a lot simpler if not by the only bad experience I had in this hotel. This was the first time I visited Chicago, therefore I was not aware of the procedures they use for extra services. At the moment of arrival I paid my stay and taxes with cash and left a card on file just in case we decided to use any extra service. The person at the front desk never mentioned that they would make a significant charge to my card at the moment that we arrived just to cover the hotel's back. Every hotel manages this type of situations in a different way, but I could have been told about this before checking in and I would have not been as upset when I checked out. The guy who was at the front desk when we checked in was there for check out as well. All he could say when I asked him about when I would get the money back was "It's up to your bank man". Poor customer service from that person, no standards on how to talk to a guest and could have warned me about this from the beginning. Other then that, the stay was good, but will possibly consider a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: Taiwan W
Reviews.Content: As soon as I open the door 2 our Corner king room I was in awe. The view was outstanding. The King bed was so soft it felt like we were sleeping on a cloud. The Bathroom was state of the art, I loved the see thru shower. The staff were great, If you are looking for a hotel in Chicago this is the 1.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel”
Reviews.Author: frech21
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very modern, young vibe. Our room was large with a living room, bedroom and bathroom with a walk-in shower. The bathroom was all tile, 2 shower heads and 2 benches. We had 2 balconies with a great view of the city. The night-club upstairs was hip and seemed to be the in-place to be. Everything was within walking distance for us (we love to walk). Michigan Ave 3 blocks away. Lots of shopping, restaurants, all within a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: oldstile
Reviews.Content: I don't usually stay at higher end hotels but got this room with a discounted price. That said, the place was great and we liked the modern design, with the exposed concrete slab ceiling, amazing pillows, and rain shower. The ipod dock with remote was great, but whatever online system they were using to control the TV channels was very clumsy and slow. All the staff were very helpful with bags and hailing cabs.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good as was expected”
Reviews.Author: Teemu L
Reviews.Content: The price was top-end but the hotel itself was lower than that. In the downtown area one would have been expected to get more with the money spended. The images of the hotel rooms at the website were nice, but in my case the room was without floor-to-ceiling windows. Actually there were no windows at all, the only thing was a door with a window to the balcony. In the room there was cold all the day due to balcony door. Quality/price ratio was poor, unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay at the Dana”
Reviews.Author: ammts28
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dana Hotel for 3 nights this November and would definitely stay there again next time I travel to Chicago. I initially chose the Dana based on its location near to a conference I was attending and because of the competitive rate offered through my corporate travel group. But I am so glad I chose it over a few other options. I had a corner "Comfy King" room that had floor to ceiling windows along 2 walls. The view was incredible! It was almost unnerving walking into the room and seeing all the way down to the street level. It definitely has a wow factor. Sure, it can be a bit of a chore to close all the shades before going to sleep at night, but isn't that a small thing compared to an incredible view? I loved the rain shower, though I agree with other reviewers that the glass walls make the room inappropriate for people traveling with kids. Other reviewers noted that they thought it was inconvenient to have to take one elevator from the ground floor to the 1st and then switch to another elevator to get to the rooms. It probably takes an extra minute, but I didn't mind it... With the restaurant Aja and the elevator to the rooftop bar located on the ground floor, I liked that anyone looking to access hotel guest rooms had to stop on the first floor and walk past the reception and concierge staff. I thought it provided an extra layer of security in addition to the fact that you must use your room key to activate the elevator stopping on your floor. Overall, I thought the Dana was fantastic - centrally located, with beautiful rooms and great service. I hope to be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Views, Modern Room, Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: travelingteacher14
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Dana last Christmas while visiting my family in Chicago. From the minute I stepped inside the room, I knew the Dana was the perfect place for us. Picture this. Corner Room. High Floor. Floor to Ceiling Windows. Rain Shower. The Dana had it all. I was shocked by how modern and luxurious the room was and especially at the price point I got it at (directly on the dana's website!) Overall, it was close to the redline, the breakfast in the restaurant was great, and the service was fantastic. We ate dinner at Feast, on the gold coast, which was not too far of a walk from the hotel. We visited a lot of good shopping close by near- CB2 (one of our favorite stores, etc.) I'd definitely stay at the Dana again and you too should consider staying here!

Reviews.Title: “sexy little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: chocolatetwistcone
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Dana in october for business/vacation reasons x 5 days. Wanted something close to shopping (Magnificent Mile) but not right on the busy zone. That said, it IS downtown chicago so busy is expected. Got a cute room with a corner balcony that had a great view of the city. Was in an easily walkable location to many other places (we walked to the Cloud in Millenium park - about 30 minutes away). wanted to try the spa because I had heard great things about it, but sadly ran out of time - too much to see! check in- easy - the computers for automatic check in didnt work, but there were 2 staff and 1 concierge who took care of things right away. the breakfasts - totally awesome, and incredibly huge portion sizes. but totally yummy, in fact one of the best restaurants in a hotel i have ever stayed at. The cheddar cheese grits and the breakfast club were my favorites! service was impeccable. they also have a sushi restaurant/level which was very good! Cesar the doorman - so awesome. just so friendly and chatty. We were dining in Little India and he was giving us tips on his favorite places. the mini-bar - THE BEST minibar i have ever had - FULL bottles of wine for what you would expect to pay in the store, little bags of local treats (gummi bears, smores, pretzels) for totally reasonable (2-3$) compared to overpriced junk that you can get at the corner store. the bathroom - so this hotel may not be kid friendly, but it's kind of neat the full glass shower wall - i thought it was a fun concept. bed - i loved it, the bed was soft and smooshy - my husband hated the beds because he likes really firm mattresses. great hotel - would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but not kid friendly”
Reviews.Author: kimmers71
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my 9 yr old daughter for the Lights Festival weekend. Overall it was a very nice hotel and would stay here again but not with my daughter. I did not feel it was kid friendly at all. Simple things make it kid friendly such as a simple breakfast menu for kids and a few kid channels. No simple breakfast menu and not a single kid channel. The room was very small (smaller than a NYC hotel I stayed in) and had no windows but did have a balcony which was a nice touch. The room amenities were standard and the bed was very comfortable. The pillows were awful but that's a personal preference. Even with two pillows, my head still sunk way down. The main area of the room had wood floors and LOVED that. I felt as though the room was clean. It was but it just felt cleaner. The door men and bell hop were very nice and courteous and remembered us every time we came and went. I would definitely stay here again with my husband or girlfriends. I would not recommend for a family. I'm giving it a 4 out of 5 due to it's lack of kid friendliness. Had I stayed here without my daughter, I would give it a 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: shopgirl1
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Dana twice--and this has become our "go-to" hotel in Chicago. Both stays have exceeded expectations. The location is very covenient, rooms are modern, staff is accommodating. The restaurant is excellent,too, particularly for breakfast. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable beds ever!!”
Reviews.Author: ValerieTraveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Dana twice now, once in the Tranquil Suite, and another time in a Comfy King room. The rooms were quite different - which is nice to have options. The King room had the beautiful floor to ceiling glass - which worked out great being on a higher floor. The tranquil suite had more compartmentalization, and the most exquisite shower - the tiles were soft and warm and so nice in the morning. Both rooms had beds so soft and luxurious I had no trouble falling asleep right away. Except for one night on the lower floor room the noise from the city was quite loud. However, you can turn the heating system onto "fan" to create white noise. Also - I love balconies and the fact the Dana offers some rooms with real balconies is a huge bonus for me. The rooftop bar is also really nice in the warmer months. I'd be happy to stay at the Dana for any future trips I have to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: ExecPlat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in August 2011. We normally like to stay at the Witt Hotel, but the price was not right so we elected for the Dana Hotel. Well we were plesantly surprised, it was a fabulous hotel and a great location. We booked the hotel right from the Dana's Hotel website and received a $20 credit for breakfast each day we stayed. Our room was large, airy and the bed was so comfortable. We even received free WI-FI.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Dana!”
Reviews.Author: Speedy2k42
Reviews.Content: Recently spent two nights at the Dana and really enjoyed it. Attentive service, clean & sleek rooms, and convenient location. Wireless internet worked without any problems and the king bed was extremely comfortable. I liked the iPod stereo/charger. As other people pointed out, inside the bedroom there is a curtain that can be pulled back to reveal the shower and the entire bathroom. The only things I did not like: -There is just one ice machine in the hotel and it is located on the 5th floor. I had to call the front desk to find that out. When I got to the 5th floor all the lights were off; after finding the ice machine I had to look for a doorstop to hold the door open while I filled up my bucket. -I was warned ahead of time that the key cards were sensitive. On the second day of my stay the key card stopped working and I couldn't get into my room. Had to go back to the front desk to get a replacement. -My room was on the 19th floor and I could faintly hear the music from the rooftop lounge on Friday night. It wasn't bad enough to keep me awake, but I could see how it would bother some people. Upon my arrival I asked one of the staff members where he would recommend getting a hearty bowl of soup since it was snowing. He directed us to "Soup Box" just four blocks away, and it was just what I was looking for! All in all, I would definitely stay at the Dana again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot”
Reviews.Author: Michelle B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Chicago for our 'minimoon'. From the moment we walked through the door, the staff greeted us with a smile and wanted to know if there was anything they could do to help us - call a cab, recommend restaurants, get toothpaste. The room was great with floor to ceiling windows and a super view, even though we weren't even close to being on the highest floor. If you have kids who are fussy eaters (or if you're a fussy eater), this might not be the spot for you. The restaurant affiliated with the hotel is Asian and has a different spin on all of their dishes. We loved it though. The location is also perfect. We walked just about everywhere and always felt safe. If we come back to Chicago, there is no reason why we wouldn't return to the Dana. :)

Reviews.Title: “The President couldn't have had it better!”
Reviews.Author: therealadm
Reviews.Content: A last-minute booking in downtown Chicago on Halloween weekend... Never having before been to Chicago, and not knowing my State St. from my LaSalle Ave... Without a clue as to the relative distances between things in the downtown area... This tale isn't starting out so good, is it? So I took a gamble on a highly-rated, glowingly-reviewed, but perfectly-priced downtown Chicago almost-boutique property, the Dana (pronounced "day-nah"), and let the Fates have their way with me. This time they were most kind. Too kind, in fact. In a word? The Dana is CRUSHING!!! That's what the experience was like. Everything began from the moment I arrived... Seeing as I'd booked so late after my local contact dropped the ball on my hotel reservations, the order hadn't even cleared Expedia.ca's queue (I ordered off the Canadian site, seeing as I'm based in Toronto) when Frederick came through in the clutch -- one call to Admin, he had me sorted out lickety-split. And I thought I'd be waiting for at least 20 mins. No vacancies given the Halloween weekend? Nope...rather than shunt me off to some out-of-the-way silly room facing a brick wall or nestled in a noisy alleyway (read my review of my last hotel stay in Cascais, Portugal)...I was treated like arriving royalty. I was given a top-floor room with a majestic Chicago-style skyscraper view facing north in a sumptuously-appointed suite with all the fixings, the majority of which I regrettably didn't use, but were available to me if needed. All manner of drinks and snacks were *already* available for the taking as I stepped in (no phone call to room service), so for those of you who don't like venturing out into the urban wilderness to fetch victuals or groceries...it's a snap. Only thing I feel terrible about is the fact that I came alone, and had business to attend to in town. Definitely the next time I have occasion to be in Chicago, I'll be bringing company and enjoying all of the Dana's cute little charms. Seeing as it was a birthday trip, Romeo on concierge duty was uber-helpful in suggesting jazz venues for my birthday evening jaunt -- even offering me a drink on-the-house -- and his cab directions were spot-on. Romeo has a knack for remembering everyone's name and as you pass through the lobby, the Dana Front Office guys and gals are always quick to share a laugh or a kind word with you as they address you by name, which makes all the difference when staying at some of the medium-priced hotels. You don't want to ever be treated like a number and that was never the case during my stay. Bonus! Checking out? Breeze! I had an insanely early checkout time (five-ish in the a.m.), and Lindsay realized that I was in a rush to get to O'Hare/ORD for my morning cross-border flight back north. He noticed that I was getting a bit jittery and antsy, seeing as he was serving an arriving guest just as I was about to dance on out of Dodge, within two keystrokes he had my invoice printed and my cash deposit back to me. #FTW!!! Bottom line: while I didn't get a chance to use all the facilities to their maximum -- pity, I know, given the high quality of this place and the fact that the Dana seems like a place tailor-made for fun -- it's an all-star hotel. I even made a short video of the bathroom area to show my friends that such a thing actually exists, and that I wasn't making it all up. Added feature: there's even a nightclub on the top floor -- with some pretty stylish attractive guests (yes!) who were streaming through the patron-only exclusive elevator that spirits them skyward -- though I didn't have time to party there but makes me want to get back to Chicago ASAP just to sample it. That shower is heavenly -- I won't describe it and ruin your surprise (nor will I forget it), but it's worth every dollar you'll spend and newlyweds, couples, or businessmen enjoying a little extra-curricular fun away from home will appreciate the look, and, er...feel of it. And that king-sized bed? I didn't even realize what hit me as I woke up most mornings, and those were the nights I wasn't enjoying a few beers! Unless you've got family in Chicago and they'd be insulted that you're not staying with them during your visit, stay at the Dana and be happy. Very happy. I was and plan to be again...

Reviews.Title: “The Dana: Our Chicago Staple”
Reviews.Author: LindyKC
Reviews.Content: The Dana Hotel is perfection! It is perfectly situated at State and Erie, a short walk to ANYTHING you want or need! The room: Very clean, sleak design, nice balcony, and THE most comfy bed we've ever slept in while traveling! Great view from our 24th floor balcony! The bath is big enough for two to get ready simultaneously, and has an amazing rainfall shower. Sexy. The location: At State and Erie. A three block walk to Geno's East (a must), three blocks from Michigan Ave, and in the middle of a great variety of shops and restaurants and bars. Also, there is a 7Eleven across the street for snacks, sodas, wine, munchies. The food: Tasted great, and fairly affordable. If you book directly through The Dana, they offer $10/day vouchers/person for food or beverage. So, breakfast was nearly free every morning, and they offer brunch as well. $8-$25/meal. The decor: Modern but warm. Chic!! The rooftop: I didn't go...but know that it's a hot spot for visitors and locals. The Spa: Again, a favorite to locals, but I skipped it.. The parking: $38/night, fairly affordable. I think $30-$60 is the city average. Our Audi was well taken care of, and they are very quick to bring your vehicle. The value: Definitely worth the money, but a little pricey for Friday and Saturday stays (it's Chicago). We paid $400 total for Saturday and Sunday nights. $250 Sat and $150 Sun. Overall, I would recommend The Dana to anyone traveling Chicago. You can't beat the location and chic vibe!!

Reviews.Title: “Chic and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: momoftwo_NJ
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 2 nights at the Dana hotel on a business trip to Chicago. The property was very charming. With friendly staff and nicely appointed rooms, I was delighted. The corner room I had floor to ceiling window on 2 sides of the room. It made the room feel much larger than its actual size. The bed was very comfortable. I loved that the room and the entire hotel do not look like one of those chain hotels. Its location was also a big plus. It was close to the business district and accessible to so many great restaurants. I will likely return to the Dana hotel next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice design hotel, but not really a spa..”
Reviews.Author: cmedby
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days at the Dana hotel. It's a nice hotel, with friendly staff and a very cool roof-top bar. The rooms are interior design statements. On the down-side, the gym was a bit disappointing and the spa was a joke. The location is great for shopping and sight-seeing. The Golden Mile is only a 4 minute walk away, and there are loads of good restaurants in the neighbourhood. I will definitely come back next time I go to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: dropandflop
Reviews.Content: Stay two separate stays during Oct at this hotel on business. Booked a corner rooms both times. Reception is on the first floor (ground being street level). You will need to take an elevator up one floor. (on the ground floor is where breakfast is served). The door man was helpful in assisting and was fine when I elected to take my own bags (I don't line to let them out of my sight). Check-in was fast and efficient. They also took my freq. flyer number and points credited without issue two weeks later. By booking directly with the hotel a $10 breakfast voucher was provided. The hotel wifi details were also supplied. The room was ready and clean. There was a king bed, work bench, chair, single lounge chair, TV with good reception, (quiet) mini-bar and cupboard for clothes.There was an speaker phone and alarm clock. Do be aware that the room is very 'concrete'. By that I mean that there is no carpet, but just a lot of exposed concrete everywhere. So it can have a bit of an industrial feel vs luxurious. The bathroom - in the first room there was a large shower (no bath) and the second room had a shower over bath set-up. Good toiletries were provided (shampoo, conditioner, body wash & soap). House keeping was done each day and well done. Nothing ever went 'missing'. The hotel wifi worked well and was fast. The air-con work well but in both rooms was a bit noisy as the unit is not well sound insulated. But it wasn't too intrusive. Room service was used twice. First time (on Columbus Day) was very slow. It took me several attempts to actually order room service (about 10pm at night). But the food was tasty when it arrived. On my second stay, service fast fast and again tasty. The room service menu is a little limited for my liking. Breakfast was taking at the hotel. The $10 voucher will allow you to eat for free (plus tip) as most items are $10 or less. Breakfast was again fast and nice. Location is fantastic. Easy to get to everywhere. There is noise from the outside streets, but you get used to it very quickly especially if you stay in city hotels. However; my second stay had me staying on a Friday night. This is when the hotel itself seemed to become noisy with party goers. Much more door slamming and people noise in corridors. Check out was again efficient. This is a well priced hotel in a great location. It does take a little getting used to, but well worth it. For leisure or business, I would stay here again when next in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best values in town”
Reviews.Author: Spladi
Reviews.Content: Picked the Dana because we had business in Chicago and also to spend a nice weekend in Chicago. We found it over www.jetsetter.com. It's one of these boutique hotels we certainly will stay at again. The ladies at the reception were very witty, nice, helpful, and showed a great sense of humor. We felt welcomed right away! Each room has floor to ceiling windows, a cozy couch close to the window, so you can watch the city's life pass by and it makes you wonder about so many things. A glass wall with a curtain separated the shower from the bedroom and all the essentials were nicely presented. The concierge gave us valuable information where to sample local foods and where to find the best restaurants. After dinner we checked out the roof top bar. It was a great place to end the evening with a couple of drinks. A breakfast coupon was included in the package. The breakfast was indeed also nicely presented and very tasty. The value received for what we paid is unbeatable. Unfortunately we didn't had time to check out the spa, but certainly will next time!

Reviews.Title: “Not good if you want to sleep!”
Reviews.Author: shoesjl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted a nice weekend away to relax without kids. We chose the Dana because of the location and the reviews but were very disappointed. It would be a great place to stay if you were interested in the night club on the roof, but we weren't and could hear the music and people talking until the club closed at 2am. The club is on the 26th floor and we were on the 21st. After 2 nights of this, we asked to be moved to a lower floor for the last night. They moved us to the 9th floor and we were able to sleep better that night, but there is a lot of noise from the streets too. I'm not sure what floor you would stay on that wouldn't have some sort of noise issue. The staff did move us, which we appreciated, but would have liked to be compensated in some way for the 2 nights of horrible sleep. It is not a cheap hotel and the only thing we really used it for was to sleep...which did not happen. We will not be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: AnandPhoenix_Arizona
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with very attentive service. The doorman greeted us everyday by name. They have a cool rooftop lounge. Also, their room service and mini-bar prices were very cheap considering how nice this hotel is, and how much other hotels of the same caliber would charge. Because it is in a very popular area, the street noise at night can be somewhat loud so be aware of that. Very comfortable bed!

Reviews.Title: “Overall nice place to stay, unique rooms”
Reviews.Author: BostonMeg11
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, in a pretty good spot a short walk from the magnificent mile. There is a restaurant on ground level and a bar on the top level, I could see noise being a problem on the upper and lower floors as people have mentioned in other reviews. Minor street noise was all I heard on the 16th floor. Bathrooms were a little weird, there is a glass shower that is clearly visible from the bed, there is a curtain but it can be opened and closed from the outside.... a little weird from a privacy perspective. Attentive staff made it an all around nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great, comfortable, noisy at times, super restaurant”
Reviews.Author: FredHayek
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly and helpful especially Tim the concierge. Room (I had the smallest available) was cozy. Noise was a problem - lower floor - mainly Friday and Saturday nights. The windows aren't double glazed at least in that room, and noise from the street funneled right up to the room, I could hear buskers, police horses and so on. The heating/cooling unit was loud too. Jetlag didn't help admittedly. I would ask for a room higher up, but not too close to the rooftop bar either. The restaurant and bar at ground level were superb, I was too tired to go elsewhere for 36 hours and greatly enjoyed the Asian food and excellent wines and spirits. The minibar was really well stocked at sensible prices, the selection of TV and movies was great. Location excellent, a five minute walk from the best shops, and a walkable distance from the Loop. I would stay there again but insist on a quieter room. I would encourage the owners to soundproof, hopefully that will be done for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and Unique Rooms”
Reviews.Author: TastyTraveler7
Reviews.Content: The Dana has an entrance on street level that takes you into the restaurant. You take an elevator or stairs to the reception area where you are greeted by warm front desk staff. The only strange thing for me was they stay seated at a desk to check you in; it isn't the normal front desk experience. I had a great room overlooking the city on a high floor. The room was spacious with a corner sofa and very comfortable bed. There was a very wide selection of local snacks and drinks in the room. The room I was in had a shower and my little pet peeve is no full door on the shower, but I got over it because there was a waterfall showerhead that more than made up for it and the water was extra hot. There was also a teak bench, and that is always great when you need to prop your foot to shave your legs. The hotel was quiet and the dark hallways were warm without feeling closed in. I stopped for a drink at the bar and found it very well stocked with great wines. It is a few blocks from Michigan Avenue and walking distance to many fantastic Chicago attractions. I didn't have time to visit the spa but heard from other guests it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: sasha d
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a weekend in the city and couldn't of had a better experience. The room was beautiful, the views were breathtaking and the service was top notch. The restaurant lounge on the roof was an amazing plus. Staff anywhere from the valet to the front desk went above and beyond. I will definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Indie Gem”
Reviews.Author: ANETKA3
Reviews.Content: Admittedly, I am an independent hotel snob - I pretty much don't like anything about branded hotels so I always try to stay in upscale boutique properties. Mind you, I work for one too, but nevertheless, Dana Hotel & Spa is fabulous. The staff is awesome - from the doorman to the bar staff to the front desk and the management team, I had the opportunity to meet them all and they are terrific. The room was spacious and contemporary. The spa was peaceful and I had a great deep tissue massage. The immediate area is very nice with an upscale feel as well so feel comfortable going for a run outside. Easy walk from Inner Circle stations to the hotel too. Just a really great area and a beautiful hotel. Don't forget to check out the rooftop lounge. Very chill in the evenings, kind of turning into a nightclub toward the latter hours. Very cool. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best rooms I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: crbguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dana for four nights in October 2011. This place is relatively small, but it is really a great hotel. We had heard good things, so our expectations were already high. But, I must say that even my high expectations were met by the corner room with windows on two sides! It really was one of my favorite hotel rooms ever. The bed was very comfortable - really soft, but not in a way that hurt my back. The rooms are a little on the small side, but they make up for it in hipness and comfort. The Pros: Really good food in the hotel restaurant (Aja). Much better than typical hotel food. They did not have hot chocolate on the menu, but they made it for me by steaming milk and dark chocolate together and addingt some sugar. It was really delicious. The room - can't say enough about the bed, the shower, and the views! The location - this is in a nice area of Chicago - close to shopping, restaurants, etc. Just a few blocks from the red line stop. We liked it a lot! The cons: The price - I considered some of the Kimpton properties, and they were significantly less expensive than the Dana. Ultimately, the price is probably about 10-15% higher than it should be. Plus, the price for food was really high as well. A bit misleading check-in person. On check-in, we were told that our rate included breakfast each morning and were given vouchers. But the vouchers were only for $10 each, which usually would not cover all of the cost of breakfast. This is a nice benefit, so don't spoil it by painting it as more than it is - it is not for a "free breakfast," but only for "$10 toward your breakfast." Say what it is. The lobby is on floor 2, and the main elevator stops there and does not go all the way to the ground floor. So, whenever you leave the hotel, you take an elevator down to the lobby floor, and then you have to either get on another elevator, or take stairs down to the ground level to leave the hotel. It would be nice if you could just get on one elevator to leave the hotel. The television in the room takes forever to change channels. It was painfully slow when we were watching TV and trying to flip through to see what was on. That's about it. My "cons" are really not too bad. This is a great place to stay and I would highly recommend it without reservation to anyone coming to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, yummy breakfasts, and sexy rooms”
Reviews.Author: wandernotlost1
Reviews.Content: I loved the sexy glass shower and super-plush king bed. The gym was great, and the $10 voucher for breakfast in Aja restaurant was perfect. The breakfast menu was delicious and had good variety. Most of the staff are very friendly and very helpful, especially the doormen. My one complaint is that despite the concrete ceilings and walls, the soundproofing isn't great and I was woken several times during my stay with voices and doors banging in the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: bidnowbaby
Reviews.Content: This hotel is almost too cool for the midwestern 40yr old mom that I am! But, honestly, it was great! Loved the design and style of rooms and the entire hotel. Didn't get to use spa, but the bathroom and spacious shower is very spa like! Rooftop bar is fun, albeit a young (20s) crowd. GREAT location. I like to be in the heart of things, but not on Michigan Ave. Shower/bathroom set up may not be great for the self conscious or people who are traveling with family members (kids?). Bascially, the shower is floor to ceiling glass that overlooks the bedroom. There a curtain that's in the bedroom part, therefore can be open/closed by whomever's in the room, not the person taking a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: anirishgirlinboston
Reviews.Content: Every time I go to Chicago, I always stay at the Dana Hotel and Spa. The place is ridiculously amazing! The beds are unbelievably comfortable, which makes getting up the next morning extremely difficult! The showers are AMAZING! The overall hotel is a very cool place to stay and in a great area. The staff are so accommodating and TJ the bell man is outstanding! Everyone was so eager to help at every moment. The breakfast was delightful and well worth the price....which includes $10 off coupon. I ate a full hot breakfast every morning for less than $10! I recommend this hotel to everyone that is heading to Chicago. It is just a FABULOUS place!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! rooms are awesome”
Reviews.Author: Pookie188
Reviews.Content: I was in chicago for a busines trip and had some issues with sleeping arrangements so my friend booked me into this hotel for a great rate -- 1/2 price. I was so pleasantly surprised. The staff is so nice and helpful and the rooms (I had a corner room) are amazing. Big comfy king bed, kurig coffee pot in the room (candy too), huge full length floor mirror and the 2 best features of the room: the floor to ceiling windows and the bathroom that has a glass wall that looks into the bedroom. Other reviews complained about noise but, aside from some city street traffic I didnt hear much. I also sleep with the tv on so that may have been why. The ceiling are concrete and make the room really hip and cool. I would image it may be a little cold in there during the winter months so crank up the heat. I didnt go to the rooftop lounge or try any of the restaurants but, everything was busy and looked very cool. I cant wait to go back...

Reviews.Title: “trendy but noisy”
Reviews.Author: justcruizen
Reviews.Content: the bar on the roof and the restaurant on the ground are fantastic. Unfortunately there is 20 floors of rooms in the middle that have not been sound proofed so if you're like me you will be awake all night with the traffic and noise on the street. Location is OK but I'd defiantely stay some place else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago stay”
Reviews.Author: Amcgibbs
Reviews.Content: We were in town to visit colleges for my daughter. We booked rooms at the Dana for 50% off via a 3rd party site. We had a small suite which was comfortable for our needs for a few days. The bathroom was amazing! Received coupons for $10 off breakfast each day of our stay in the restaurant downstairs which was great. Downsides was not enough closet space for 3 people and no real place to hang your coats other than the bedroom closet which just seemed a bit of a pain for us for some reason. Especially in Chicago where coats are a must for a large portion of the year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Week In Botique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kitty14221
Reviews.Content: THis was a hotel I found by luck on tripadvisor and I must say it was a wonderful find. The hotel was close to shopping which we enjoyed. It was also close to the Red LIne which we used to go to the Cubs baseball game. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The General Manager of the restaurant gave us some wonderful suggestions for other places to eat and have fun. The doorman Ceasar was always smiling and asked how our day went. It is a green hotel and it offered us better rates than the other hotels we have stayed at. I look forward to returning again. The rooms had Egyptian Cotton Sheets and Duvets and the beds were very comfortable. If you are looking for a quiet nice hotel I recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: MagsMooMoo
Reviews.Content: Booked our stay at the Dana through a deal on Expedia for $200/night for a comfy king. This was the best deal we could find for a 4 star hotel in this area. The room was definitely cozy...a little small for our liking but they utilized every inch of space very well and for what we paid, it worked just fine. The positives:The room itself was modern and clean and the bed was very comfortable. The mini bar was very reasonably priced (i.e. $2 for a can of pop, $3 for a bottle of Voss water). We were on the 8th floor which had small balcony and a nice view. Pretty good location - within a couple of blocks to shopping, restaurants and attractions of State Street and the Magnificent Mile. All of the doormen we met were exceptionally helpful and friendly. We visitied Vertigo one night and had great service and really enjoyed the view out on the patio; we went up early to get a table (around 8:30) and left just as it was getting super busy (around 11 pm). Reasonably priced (and strong!) drinks and decent service at the lobby bar as well. Heard from other guests that Aja had really good food (never tried it ourselves though). The negatives: As stated, rooms are "cozy". We weren't able to get ready at the same time just due to lack of space, particularly in the bathroom. The air conditioning is very loud and woke me up quite a few times during our stay when it'd turn off and on. Card keys are required to use the elevators and ours never worked to get to the ground floor - always to the lobby and then we had to take the stairs down (not a huge deal just annoying). We couldn't get the door to our balcony open - it appeared to be broken. The bathroom is not very private - it has a sliding door and the shower has a floor to ceiling window on one side that can be covered with a curtain but still isn't that private - wasn't a concern to us but could be to others. Overall: We had a great time but I wouldn't pay full price for a room here; if I could get a similar deal to what we had, I'd definitely consider it.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Stay”
Reviews.Author: Waldavaus
Reviews.Content: The Dana Hotel & Spa is a boutique style hotel with friendly staff and small enough you don't feel lost. It is in a good location on N. State Street downtown and within walking distance of most attractions in Chicago. I also recommend a transit pass while there; it's very good and easy to get around. We had a corner king room which was windows on all sides. Bed was comfortable; nice bathroom ; flat screen TV;frig to keep stuff cold.
