Our room was a corner king with floor to ceiling windows all around. Keurig coffee maker was great and the stereo played your iPod. Downsides: the air conditioner was noisy, the phone didn't work even after I complained and the closet was not tall enough to hang up pants . We would return if we got a good price.

Reviews.Title: “strange that it is considered as a good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zaza64
Reviews.Content: was surprised to see how big is difference between what they are advertising on the web page and what you are getting in reality. Price 269 US$ and you getting room which is under renovations....staff seems to be tired with all those quests and they are looking to you as an enemy (if you have question). Vertigo sky lounge - you enter and wondering is it a cheap sport bar? more or less good location, but it is too expensive to pay only for it. I have photos, and I will add them later

Reviews.Title: “Not a good stay”
Reviews.Author: Katerina_CA
Reviews.Content: This place is trying too hard to be cool, however they forget some basic rules of customer service. I tried to put in my order for breakfast the night before, which I do in every single hotel I stay. This time i was informed that staff tends to lose orders placed the night before so I would be better off calling in the morning. what??? I was speechless. The room itself was OK with pretty thin walls. I could hear pretty much everything that was going on in the hall. Being right next to the elevator didn't help either. We also planned to check out the sky lounge on the top floor of the hotel but they closed it for a private event so hotel guests didn't have access. I beleive that room rate covers access to hotel's facilities. So in a way we were ripped off. Good thing this was just a one night stay. One positive thing was free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice if you are looking for a chic, contemporary property”
Reviews.Author: bwhit6
Reviews.Content: LOVED the Dana Hotel. It was very modern & contemporary without feeling stark. I usually stay at the Palmer House for its very 'old school' feel; but decided to switch it up and was not disappointed. Its also in a convenient location to great restaurants / attractions. I will absoluitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very CoOl Sassy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Worldhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Loved the location. Loved the rooms. Excellent having a balcony that we could walk out in and overlook state street! And the shower and glass doors..... Fun fun fun! A little over priced though. The bell staff where extremely helpful and super friendly. The front desk staff where rude and not helpful in any way. Fix that and his place would be #1

Reviews.Title: “Dana Hotel is the best place I've stayed anywhere”
Reviews.Author: MCJaram
Reviews.Content: I really like staying at this hotel. We go to Chicago periodically and generally stay at the hotel with the best rate but would make a point to stay here from now on. The check-in was great the concierge was helpful and we got a room (one of the least expensive) was on the 18th floor with a balcony. The room was small but laid out efficiently and we had a huge window looking out on State Street. It was what I would call affordable luxury with bathrobes, slippers, and a coffee maker with good coffee. To top it off, I left my iPod here and when I called their lost and found, they had it and were going to send it to me. Great, great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: nem014
Reviews.Content: LOVE LOVE LOVE this hotel! Just back from a 5 night stay and it was perfect. Every single member of staff was beyond friendly, the room, whilst it was quite small, was gorgeous. Lovely wooden floors, great amenities in the bathroom, cute balcony....I could go on and on. And the location was just perfect. Absolutely everything was in walking distance, and 2 blocks away was the red line station. I would recommend this hotel to anybody and we will definately be staying here next time we're in chicago, we won;t even bother looking anywhere else. Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMan19866
Reviews.Content: Check in is not the greatest with the front desk clerks unable to crack a welcome smile while they sat at a low desk and did not even offer us a seat while we "stood around" waiting to check in. The Dana is in a old renovated building. The reception is on the first floor and so you have to walk up the stairs or take a single floor elevator, cross the lobby just to get to the elevators to your room. We got a large king size room which was nice but with floor to ceiling windows it was a bit of an effort opening and closing around 10 blinds every morning and evening. The bathroom was a bit of a strange design with a glass panel which gave the person in the bedroom complete access to anyone using the "facility". There was a curtain which you could leave open or closed across this glass panel, but still a very odd design feature. The location is good with easy access to a lot of local attractions and nearby restaurants. The gym is well equipped with new machines. Unfortunately I did not have a chance to use the spa but it looked very nice. The Metro station is located a few blocks from hotel which is really convenient and easy to use. We took a train to and from airport to avoid traffic which gets congestive. Free easy to use internet access in room. The restaurant on first floor had a club atmosphere at night but sound is well contained. Overall we had a good stay, but reception staff can definitely use a motivational talk. Try get room on higher floor for a better view.

Reviews.Title: “The best rooftop bar and great rooms”
Reviews.Author: neettraveler
Reviews.Content: I truly recommend this hotel. I stayed there last week for three nights. I called in advanced to ask for a room in one of the upper floors, and was pleasantly surprised when they gave me one in floor 20. The hotel has only 25 floors. I wanted one of the rooms facing State St. because of the floor to ceiling windows, but got instead one on the side that had a balcony. At first I was a little disappointed, but it turned our to be a great advantage as we could go out to the balcony to catch some fresh air and take advantage of the great weather we had. The bed was super comfortable, and we had great water pressure and a very nice shower. The staff in the hotel was really nice and helpful, always willingly to help us with whatever we needed. And we went to the Vertigo Sky Lounge one night for some drinks, and we had an amazing time. The music was great, a great crowd, not too old and serious, but also not to young and stupid. The drinks were good and not as expensive as I would have imagined for a roof top hotel bar in a city like Chicago. And itÂ´s only 3 blocks away from Michigan avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Dana offers Location, Relaxing Room, Scenic View”
Reviews.Author: MemoryMaker2011
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a very enjoyable stay at the Dana Hotel and Spa. Our front desk agent made us feel very welcome and treated us as special first time guests. The staff, spa bathroom (including steam room and toiletries) and corner sleeping room on a high floor were wonderful! The location of the hotel in downtown Chicago is near many fine dining establishments and a short walk to Magnificent Mile shopping - a real treat! If you are looking to get away and explore the city with your spouse, this is a great option!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: dobermandogmom1
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful surprise! Had a great experience at The Dana. Serivce was awesome, rooms were spacious and very clean. I will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra P
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dana September 2-6, 2011. The hotel is in a great location; within walking distance of the Red Line, Michigan Avenue, the Art Institute, Millenium Park, and the Navy Pier. My check in was OK, although the redhead at the desk wasn't very friendly or welcoming and she appeared incredulous when I gave my name(?)...I then offered ID although she did NOT request it. The negatives I encountered were: long brunette hair found twice in the bath towels (that's why I bring my own wash cloth); the room smelled stale (I bring air freshener); the room was too dark even with every lamp turned on. Positives were: the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever experienced!; friendly and attentive bell hop/doormen - Caesar was great!, friendly and patient concierge; I loved the wide plank flooring in the room and the ceiling to floor windows. I would be comfortable recommending the Dana to a friend. I plan to revisit Chicago Spring 2012, but will try another hotel just for the sake of being in another area of the city.

Reviews.Title: “It's all in one place”
Reviews.Author: kyls1972
Reviews.Content: On the ground floor you have a great bar, lobby a fantastic restaurant & on the roof another bar with fantastic views great music & friendly staff. It's centrally located to cafes shopping & all other clubs & restaurants what more could you ask for. The rooms are large & very clean with the nicest sheets on the bed. The staff are very very friendly & accommodating

Reviews.Title: “Best Guest Service”
Reviews.Author: knickslover
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome. My only complaint about the whole thing is that the restroom for the restaurant is upstairs and a little hard to find. The staff was great and my room was fabulous. I'm looking forward to my return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful getaway”
Reviews.Author: Gregg A
Reviews.Content: Amazing!! Hotel is absolutely wonderful. Rooms were very spacious. The food at Aja was exceptional. But what I want to talk about is the staff. The Aja staff of Kris, Ashley , Neal and Paul made my stay. They provide exceptional service which is very hard to find theses days. Vanessa, for the tour of the Spa and Jackie, for helping me when I forgot my code in the Spa. Marina, Nick, Ashley and Jean-Pierre of Vertigo. But a big shout-out to Sandi Robinson for the invite. I have been in the hospitality industry for several years and always try to "create the experience" for the guest. The staff at Dana Hotel & Spa "created an experience" I won't forget. So a big shout-out to the hotel staff who toiled in obscurity, doing their best to create guests experiences. Thank so very much. See you soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Unique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travels121586
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dana for 3 night this August and what a great hotel! The rooms are so unique and all have floor to ceiling windows. We stayed on the 24th floor and had a great view to wake up to. They warned us that it might be noisy due to the lounge on the top of the hotel, but we did not have any problems with the music. The bed was super comfortable and the room was very clean. The bathroom shower was great - the only issue was that the bathroom/shower door is just clear glass. There is a curtain, but it doesn't cover everything. Great idea, probably not the best execution - it didn't bother me, but could be uncomfortable for some. The lounge on top of the hotel offers great views, but I enjoyed Aja downstairs more. The food and drinks were delicious. The hotel itself is in a great location, everything was walkable. The staff was very helpful and all the bartenders were great. Lovely hotel for a young couple visiting Chicago, I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jae411
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended the Dana Hotel. My Niece graduated from Navy "A" school at Great Lakes Naval Base. I attended her graduation then we drove to Chicago for the night. Wonderful hotel. Terrific staff. Concierge made dinner and boat tour reservations for us. Hotel is walking distance to everything. From now on this is MY ONLY Chicago hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to lay your head for a few nights”
Reviews.Author: Pandora_is_Eve
Reviews.Content: The location of this place is one of the best things about it, Three blocks to Mag Mile, walking distance to restaurants and if you want something for in your room Whole Foods is around the corner. The room itself has fairly basic decor but with full length windows and a glass floor to ceiling shower. The ceiling does have this unfinished look that makes you wonder if its a decorating choice or if they ran out of sheet rock and plaster. Be aware though since it is downtown the rooms can be kind of noisy at night and the window treatments do not block the noise. The beds are made of that memory foam stuff which personally I hate but it was Ok for a 1 nite stay. Don't understand the comments about the staff they seemed very helpful when I came in and when I saw them assisting others. Remember your not buying the place its a short term rental for business or pleasure ... the key is it is a good location and reasonably priced! Valet your car at about $38 which is average for downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Unique funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: Closch
Reviews.Content: Booked on hotels.com with a great price. Celebrated my wife's birthday. Called the hotel after booking and asked for high floor. We got the top, 25th floor. Great city view. I didn't know the 26th floor had a night club. The music was loud in our room, bass booming. Ear plugs saved the night. So ask for a room no higher than 24 th floor. Club was cool but we didn't want to be clubbing all night. Interesting room lay out with glass wall shower view into the room. Easy walk the near north shopping yet traffic was light. Used the valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous place, great price”
Reviews.Author: Katie H
Reviews.Content: We were given a corner room on the 15th floor with floor-to-ceiling windows, the requisite Keurig coffee maker, two cushy robes, fast wi-fi and electrical outlets galore. The bed was unbelievably comfortable, and the rainshower shower head was a small slice of heaven. We ate dinner at Aja downstairs, and although neither of us is a huge fan of hotel restaurants, this one is excellent. Everything we ate was delicious, in particular the truffled mashed potatoes, a menu item left over from when the restaurant was a steakhouse. One annoying "feature" (or is it a bug?) is the requirement that room keys be inserted in a security slot in order to operate the elevator. I can understand the need to keep things safe, but it's annoying nonetheless. For breakfast, I ordered a bagel but the restaurant was out of them, and gave me a croissant instead. To make up for my disappointment, the waiter gave me a second -- delicious -- latte on the house.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: KMKC08
Reviews.Content: I stay in Chicago about twice a month but have been less than thrilled with the hotels. I finally found my Go To spot in the Dana Hotel. The hotel is just far enough outside of the Loop, so you avoid some of the hustle and bustle. Upon arrival, the staff was courteous and helpful, making check in a breeze. As it was a business trip, I didn't have time to use the spa or restaurant. However, the rooftop bar has a great vibe, fast service and great views - in the bar and of the city..... The room was very clean and spacious, with a very large shower, floor to ceiling windows, and Ipod dock. The in-room bar prices were shockingly reasonable, with a nice selection of wine, beer, and some specialty items. I was supposed to have a King bed, but it seemed more like a queen, as my feet were hanging off the edge. That aside, the bed was extremely comfortable with high thread count sheets. This hotel is hands down one of the best in Chicago and it's the complete package. Nice rooms at reasonable prices, great social scene, and quality service.

Reviews.Title: “The Good & The Bad”
Reviews.Author: StaJo29
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dana Hotel & Spa in Chicago over the 4th of July weekend, and into the following week. It was a couple days of vacation, followed by a couple days of business in Chicago. First I would like to say the Dana is a beautiful hotel and for the most part I really enjoyed my stay. Other reviews mention it being a party hotel and very loud and I'd say that on the weekend that is true. But most people don't stay at hotels in downtown Chicago for the weekend for quiet and rest. There is a club on the top of the hotel so obviously there will be people coming and going from there. On the weekend part of my hotel it was pretty much full, and quite loud. The rooms have awesome sound systems that you can plug your mp3 player into that sound amazing... only problem with that is people like to crank up the volume so you are likely to hear it in the next room. Even though it was not an issue during my stay, I did have neighbors who liked to turn up the music at times. During the week portion of my stay it was MUCH quieter and I was able to get rest as needed. The rooms at the Dana are pretty much exactly what you see in the pictures. They are very asthetically pleasing, and the bathrooms are amazing. However, as others have noted they really need some type of door on the shower as the water does get all over the floor. The shower is truely amazing though, I didn't want to go back to my shower at home after using it! So overall I'd recommend the Dana Hotel, just know that on the weekends there will be a lot of people coming and going, and there will be noise. I did have an issue with the housekeeping one day... I was there for 4 days and one day came back to my room to find an an unacceptable level of cleaning. The towels in the bathroom were dirty, but rolled up as though they were clean, and my coffee was not replenished for the in room coffee maker. It made me wonder what else had not been properly attended to. I must admit this was a BIG issue for me as I tipped housekeeping every day, they least they could do is make sure they do a thorough job of cleaning/stocking. Oh one more thing... the room key cards are TERRIBLE. They are constantly being erased and you need to have them re-programmed. I've never had that happen at any other hotel. I suggest they really look into getting that fixed as it's pretty inconvenient to have to stop at the desk (and wait if there is a line) all the time to have them re-programmed.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels except for hassles with key cards not working”
Reviews.Author: amjur613
Reviews.Content: Great hotel overall with interesting rooms and bathrooms, good service and a great restaurant. Had meetings there as well and it worked out well. The key cards were a complete hassle though. Everyone complained that at some point they no longer worked in elevator and/or room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Find”
Reviews.Author: BennyKenna
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Chicago for 4 nights and only wish we could have stayed here for more! Got upgraded to a corner room on the 19 floor, wow! The view from the room was amazing... The room had everything we needed, well stocked mini bar and snack bar, iPod docking station which also charged. TV, wifi a very modern room. The location was great. The staff were extremely helpful especially the conceirge. The roof top bar was stunning and appears very popular with the locals. I will definitely return and will recommend this hotel. I have already passed the hotel details onto people and they also enjoyed their stay as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC! Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel59
Reviews.Content: It was a fabulous hotel and would absolutely go back! Have been to Chicago a couple of times and this hotel is on the top of my list. The staff were great and extremely friendly. I read the other reviews and there were concerns about that but when we checked in the front desk did a change for us from a king size room (which was the only one available on the site we used) to 2 queens and in addition gave us coupons for breakfast. We ate in the hotel for breakfast for 2 mornings and it was very well prepared. The location is very good and within walking distance of shopping and about a 20 minute walk to the Navy Pier. The room was spectacular. It was modern but warm with really comfortable beds and 6 pillows each! It had a large desk area and beautiful bathroom with rainhead. Also, unheard of the internet was free in the hotel. It always seemed to be extra in the other hotels that we checked. We were able to get a great price and it was an excellent value. We would absolutely stay there again. We stayed in 5 star hotels in Chicago previously and this would be our first choice for a return stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: azdcgirl
Reviews.Content: The staff here are amazing; bellmen, doormen, spa staff, Aja hostess, servers, even one of the kitchen staff gave me directions--they were some of THE friendliest staff I've encountered. I give them all a 5 for service. The ladies at the guest check-in, however, get a 1 for not making me feel welcome at ALL. After getting past the front desk, however, my stay was wonderful! I liked the design of the rooms--unlike the guest below, i really loved the concrete ceilings. The beds were SO comfortable. I could have lounged all day after my massage. My friend and I had a really great meal at Aja. The himachi guacamole was killer. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: errikinky
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in August 2011. The rooms are spacious and have floor to ceiling windows, not exaggerated contemporary design and a very good restaurant. All service from bellman to concierge was upscale but not pretentious and the rate i got on their website was far better than what I expected when i saw the pictures. Beds and pillows are comfy, too !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the young traveller”
Reviews.Author: pnmehta
Reviews.Content: I visited Chicago with my son for his campus visit to the University of Chicago in October 2010. The hotel is very centrally located and within walking distance of the famous magnificent mile of downtown Chicago. The hotel is furnished in a stark minimalistic style that appeals to the younger business and couple crowd. However, the glass wall for the bathroom doesn't work when you are travelling with your teenage son! Other than that the hotel was very pleasant to stay in and though I could not visit their lounge/bar on the higher floor as we had a very short stay. Its not a place to go with family consistin of young children or old couples.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Stark Hotel, by far!”
Reviews.Author: mirsar
Reviews.Content: We were directed to this new, and allegedly hip, hotel in downtown Chicago as members of a wedding party over the 4th of July weekend. The staff, ALL IN BLACK and ALL YOUNG, are under the delusion that they are doing hotel guests a favor, thus their demeanor is uppity, disengaged and impersonal to the point where they look at their computer screens more than the guests. The rooms were amply furnished but given the refurbished nature of the hotel, they have left the ceilings in raw concrete (to add to the "rustic" character?), the wall plugs do not work and lighting is totally inadequate to the point of not being able to even read a newspaper! I had to threaten Room Service in order to have drinking water bottles in the room fridge and coffee packets to be replenished (maybe the Room Service people decided to celebrate the 4th of July at home?!). What was incredulous, however, was when we got on the elevator and were joined by a young lady with a huge bowl of salad destined for the wedding reception at the top floor bar of the hotel; the bowl was uncovered, the young lady was joyfully using the guest elevator -instead of the service one- and any of the other ten passengers could have spat on the salad in the bowl with potentially disastrous infectious results! What took the cake, of course, was that I did not pay any attention until I got home but I was charged for parking at the hotel for two nights instead of only one at an additional charge of $40 which I am still owed! So, although very weel located in the downtown area of Chicago with easy access to great restaurants and other visitor delights, this hotel tries to pretend being a Philip Stark hotel (young and hip) but fails miserably in the execution of the intent. Management better get with it or else DANA HOTEL will not last too long as a visitor destination, at least not for my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: We had a corner suite and two of the four walls were made of glass. I loved the view of being able to look out at the city. I was also amazed t how dark the room was in the morning when I was trying to sleep in. I was worried about this at first but the room was completely dark and when I rolled up the blinds it was well lit and amazing. Will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “All is good in the Dana hood!”
Reviews.Author: sarah h
Reviews.Content: Hip room, bar, spa and hotel in general. Not thrilled with the check in folks..but hey, I'm not there to make friends. Concierge super helpful as I needed to buy 2 bottles of Veuve and he sent me to a place closeby that I would NEVER have found alone just strolling along (that place alone is worth a viist if you are a wine buff!). I had a corner room with floor to ceiling windows..loved it! I'm not a shower person though..I like my baths so this was the only downside for me...though I will say the shower was big enough to have a party in! I'd stay here again with friends, but not on business or with family..just a bit too hip for them.

Reviews.Title: “The Dana is a 5 star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: beachbumIllinois
Reviews.Content: We are the O'Donnell's and we have stayed at this hotel about 20 times,once a month on average.The staff knows us .Great location.The tranquil suites are our favorite.Two rooms two balconies,a huge bathroom.very comfy bed..The hotel is in the center of Chicago..We love you DANA..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, probably too hip for families.”
Reviews.Author: GWorldTour
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 4 month old for 3 nights between moves (we are locals) and had a very goodstay, very courteous bellmen, I found the check-in staff to be a bit 'snooty' but all good. Our room faced a building with professionals working-make sure you pull the blinds I am certain they can see everything. Loved the snack bar options! Great area with lots of restaurants to choose from - their restaurant onsite was fabulous. If driving and want to save on hotel valet parking there are cheaper options in a lot across the street. Try the frozen yogurt across the street - so yum.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish interior, chilly (cold) reception. Won't be back”
Reviews.Author: matysa
Reviews.Content: The only words of greeting upon arrival "Picture ID and Credit Card". This potentially really excellent hotel left me cold. Sad but true. The room and bed were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Smacked it”
Reviews.Author: Parasm12345
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel. Great location. Friemdly staff. Possibly the best all round hotel i've ever stayed in. Close to shops, bars, clubs, restaurants and easy access to rooftop bar oveerlookng the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: TomWhitePelham
Reviews.Content: This very clean hotel has a hip feel to it, but remains quiet. The location makes it convenient to walk to many loop/near north stores and restaurants. The el is only 3 blocks in either direction to take you further away. The staff was very helpful when service was requested and there is free wifi. We got our room on Expedia for a very good price. There is a Whole Foods around the corner so you don't have to pay a typical hotel price for breakfast, although the breakfast was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Chicago Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trvlgrl7772
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Dana Hotel and Spa and as usual, the hotel did not disappoint. My friends and I arrived at the hotel a few hours before check-in and the front desk had a room ready for us. All of the staff were friendly and attentive. The room was bright and spacious. We were given complimentary breakfast vouchers and we were surprised at the quality and quantity of food on the breakfast menu. I recommend taking advantage of the breakfast offerings at the hotel. The design is typical of a modern, boutique style hotel. I realize that some reviewers were put off by the design of the bathroom and some of the weekend noise at the hotel; however, these were non-issues for me personally. The location of the Dana can't really be beat. Just a couple of blocks from the Magnificent Mile, the hotel is surrounded by excellent shopping and dining. I highly recommend this hotel and will certainly return on my next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great View - Request a corner Room”
Reviews.Author: LLSquared
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an Amazing View... the Rooftop Bar is so cool and is open all year! I had the opportunity to stay at the Dana on a business trip to Chicago and it was one of the most interesting hotels I had ever experienced. Although it was one of the more expensive hotels in the area the floor to ceiling windows and the view from my room more than made up for it. If you stay at the Dana request a corner room... the view is great, the north side of the hotels view is better in my opinion. The breakfast was great and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “What a glorious Chicago find.”
Reviews.Author: Mueller63
Reviews.Content: If you happen to be in Chicago this is the place to experience. We were here for business and didn't know much about the hotel and wow, were we in for a surprise. Location was wonderful. The event we attended was on held on the rooftop and all of us were blown away by the skyline. Check out the photos on the website. The hotel looks exactly like the photos plus 10 times better. Service is beyond belief. Experience it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, funky atmosphere, great location, we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: cathytravels
Reviews.Content: The floor to ceiling windows give you unparalled views of the beautiful city of Chicago. The Hotel Dana rooms are modern, and beautifully equipped, with the most reasonably priced mini bar and snacks I have ever seen at a hotel! What a concept! The staff in the bars and restaurants were incredibly friendly and welcoming. The food was excellent. I can not say enough about the fine,hip,urban oasis this hotel has created. The roof top bar with patio again provided amazing views and excellent service. Stay here! Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “great view and pretty trendy”
Reviews.Author: loves2travelanywhere
Reviews.Content: had a nice stay in a corner room with a fab view but the modern design of the rooms have a flaws including that fact that I could hear the people in the room next door as if they were in my room . Additionally, the half glass shower wall should be a bit longer. Water was all over the floor after my shower- even after I was intentionally/carefully trying to avoid on the second morning. The business center computers needed toner for the printer for the entire 3 days I was there- even after I mentioned it to the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: NYCtraveler319
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on a business trip to Chicago. I usually stay at the big hotels along the Magnificent Mile but most hotels in the city were completely booked. I'm so glad I came upon this hotel and will definitely consider it again. Very convenient, central location near the Mag Mile, shops, and restaurants. The service was lovely and the room was beautiful and had everything I could ask for during a business trip: quiet, spotless room, comfortable bed, terrific rainforest shower. I'm tiring of the big, bland chain hotels I usually stay at and love the intimate, stylish atmosphere here. I'm looking forward to my next stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, too loud, no bathroom privacy.”
Reviews.Author: phillymom77
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights over a long weekend in July. It was the hotel suggested by our friends, whose wedding we were in town for. Overall, I would not recommend this hotel. The main problems were the service, the noise, and the impractical nature of the setup of the rooms. Some of the service problems we had included: having to ask twice (once by phone to the front desk, once in person at the front desk after turndown service ignored our request) for new towels and toilet paper when our room was cleaned but not restocked. Had to wait until the next day when we left a note for housekeeping on the sink. Finally these items were restocked. The snacks in the â€œhonor barâ€� in the room were all expired (with May and June expiration dates.) Most offensively, the alarm clock went off the first morning at 6am on the highest volume. We had only gotten a few patchy hours of sleep anyway, what with the screaming guests congregating in the hallway all night. The walls are paper thin, and every time someone on your floor opens or closes their door, your door will shudder closed as well. The street noise is terribly loud. I guess this is a matter of taste, but we did not enjoy the bathroom setup. There is no wall separating the bathroom and the bedroom. There is only a clear glass with a flimsy curtain, that is on the bedroom side of the glass. SO, if you are in the bathroom, you cannot close the curtain. There is also no door on the bathroom. You have to open the closet, and use the closet door as the bathroom door. Neither the closet door nor the curtain closes completely. Some people cooler than I am might think itâ€™s hot and romantic to watch your partner in the bathroom, but my husband and I prefer not to watch each other on the toilet. The hotel definitely caters to the nightclub guests more than the hotel guests. Hotel guests are forced to use the elevator on the lobby floor (first floor up) rather than from the ground floor (itâ€™s the same set of elevators.) Nightclub guests wait in line at the ground floor, so as they are making their way up to the nightclub, there is no room on the elevator for actual hotel guests. The music is so loud that we could hear it in the hallway even though we were a good 10 floors below it. Thankfully we couldnâ€™t hear it in our room. There were a few positives. I had a great massage with Tim, which I booked a few minutes before I wanted to start, and the spa was totally accommodating. However, going along with the service problems, the otherwise nice receptionist at the spa gave me the wrong bill, charging me more for someone elseâ€™s treatment. When I checked the bill, she immediately fixed the problem, but again, if I hadnâ€™t noticed the error, she wouldnâ€™t have. Not the kind of thing you want to deal with after a relaxing massage. The location is great, but not a reason to stay here. There are MANY other hotels in a few blocks that have the same location advantage. Also, this is not a boutique hotel although it advertises as one. Itâ€™s a HUGE hotel with around 25 floors of rooms. A boutique hotel is small, quiet and caters to guests. Overall I thought the Dana hotel was more concerned with being â€œcoolâ€� than being hospitable. I would be surprised if itâ€™s still in business in a few years.

Reviews.Title: “patio and roof top bar were a plus for the summer”
Reviews.Author: CAWeekender29
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay overall. The highlights for me were the access to fresh air both by in-room patio and in the roof top bar + the free wireless internet - thank you! I also enjoyed 24 hour access to the spa showers and steam room. The room was comfortable and had nice bath products. The only downside for me was the elevator system. The room key also served as an elevator key, (which I appreciated for security) but it was a pain. In addition, the staff, guests, spa goers and roof top bar guests all use the same elevators, which created an akward experience for me leaving the spa in just a robe and entering a elevator full of young partiers for the bar. Other than that, the staff was friendly and I enjoyed the services provided.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DietBoost
Reviews.Content: This is my go-to hotel for business trips to Chicago. The rooms are clean and well designed, though the concrete ceiling is a bit off-putting at first. Depending on the room, though, the views can be tremendous (or you can be seen through the floor-to-ceiling windows by the people in the offices/apartment building across the street). The staff are helpful, but don't expect them to remember your name, no matter how often you stay there, and I certainly would not call them friendly. Ultimately, the hotel is clean and it's a great value for the price, and that's a major motivation for my continuing to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Superb - in every detail!”
Reviews.Author: shabuma01
Reviews.Content: I researched a multitude of Chicago hotels for settling on the Dana for our 3-day trip to celebrate my husband's 30th birthday - and I'm so glad I choose them! Since I based my decision on reviews, I thought it only fair to write my own, because they were wonderful! We stayed in their corner king on the 18th floor and had a spectacular view of the city skyline, and State street with the famous Chicago theater sign in the distance. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the peekaboo waterfall shower was fun for a couple! However, what really blew me away was the amazing service at the Dana. We arrived far too early for our 3pm check in, and ended up going to lunch and coming back. When we returned, they still weren't quite ready so we had drinks downstairs at Aja, and the server took care of our check-in about 15 minutes later for us! We also got comped for the breakfast the next two days. I had mentioned in my reservation that it was my husband's birthday, and they had a plate of chocolate covered strawberries waiting for us in the room! The room-service was prompt and delicious, delivering wonderful food exactly when we requested it to be brought up. Every staff member there was friendly, attentive and helpful, and took care of all our needs! We had no billing issues whatsoever, no complaints of any kind! Having stayed at many other nice boutique hotels in other cities, I know how rare this is! They truly did a great job, and I would highly recommend them. I won't stay anywhere else when in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Something different”
Reviews.Author: Reldas
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for a "girls" weekend in Chicago. It was so fun to stay somewhere that is not the cookie cutter chain hotel. The room had floor to ceiling windows, really comfy beds and a luxury shower. The staff was over the top friendly and the price was very reasonable for a hotel so close to the Magnificent Mile. Bring your iPod, they have a dock for it! The bar on the roof is one of the best in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Stay”
Reviews.Author: GregRI
Reviews.Content: This hotel was solid. I wouldn't say that it blew me away, but it was solid. Great location, right next to Michigan Ave, very modern style. The noise level was not great, we stayed on the 22nd floor and you could hear sirens on the street in the middle of the night, you could also hear music from the bar on the top floor. It did not really bother me but just be aware of this when chosing this hotel if you are a light sleeper. The bar scene at the top of the hotel is young and hip, was a pretty cool bar. Got great help from the concierge, Romeo. I probably wouldn't stay here again, do many options to chose from and I am not in love with this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Friendly, Helpful Staff.”
Reviews.Author: RoundTripper
Reviews.Content: The Dana is a newish, boutique hotel...well located only three short blocks from Michigan Avenue in the heart of the prime shopping district and close to public transportation. It sits on a tiny footprint, with only about 10-12 rooms per floor. While the hotel has all the trappings of a trendy, too-cool-for-even-itself property, it has NONE of that vible (except, perhaps, in the dark, rooftop bar that was filled with twenty-somethings when we popped up for a look one evening). Bell, check-in and concierge staff are casual, super friendly and always helpful with multiple requests. The room was warm contemporary in decor, spacious, equipped with all of today's gadgets and featured a wall-to-wall, floor-to-ceiling window (no special view...but good city perspective; black-out shades were great). Seriously comfortable beds with crisp, white linens and down or synthetic-down comforters. An abundance of pillows. Flat-screen TV. Keurig coffee maker and all the fixings. Wine and other beverages in the fridge (relatively reasonably priced, surprisingly). Lots of plugs for charging devices. Bath is good size (only one sink...but enough counter space for two to share). Shower is huge and has a rain-head and hand spray. Beware...the back shower wall is all glass and faces into the bedroom. You have to pull the curtain in the bedroom before you go into the bathroom if you don't want to shower on display to your roommate and/or those who live in the apartments across the street (we heard funny stories).. Must confess that we sorely missed having an in-room bathtub or, even better, a hotel Jacuzzi on the cold afternoons/evenings when we returned from our excursions (would have used it every day). With a full-service spa in the building, you might think they'd at least have a Jacuzzi guests could use. But no. A magnifying make-up mirror hung face height on the wall would be a nice addition, too. The dressing/closet area lighting is dim. And with the shower "window" opening into the bedroom, any lights turned on in the bath at night spill out into the bedroom. Also, when the bathroom's sliding door (which does not lock) is open, the closet is inaccessible. Easy-to-use, huge, in-room safe for laptop+ while out and about. Only ate one meal in the restaurant. Breakfast. A bit big-city pricey and the Eggs Benedict was just o.k. (too much regular ham rather than Canadian bacon; not enough Hollandaise), but the capuccino was fabulous. Plenty of alternate places for breakfast nearby. All in all, a great stay at a fun, well-located property. We'd definitely return again...but I do hope they add a Jacuzzi somewhere accessible well into the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, balconies, and top floor.”
Reviews.Author: candebat
Reviews.Content: Standard upscale hotel with small (20x10ft) rooms and still comfortable. The rooms are chic and probably best suited or honeymooners and couples. Overnight, valet parking is pricey at $38/night. The showers are nice along with the view. The beds are comfortably soft and pillows huge, but not best for long, back-enduring walks around the loop. Nearby is Magnificent Mile, shopping, 3:00am bars, and plenty to eat. Please note the rooms Do Not cool below 70F although the thermostat promises better.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in downtown Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: MarciaMarciaMarcia2
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? The room was so modern - dark hardwood floor, granite table, flat screen TV, floor to ceiling window overlooking N. State Street. The bed was like sleeping on a cloud with lots of pillows. The shower was my favorite. A huge stall with walls of windows with a rain showerhead. Pull the curtain for privacy between the bedroom and shower stall, or leave it open and have some fun! The honor bar was stocked full of chilled favorites, and the assortment of munchies looked soooo tempting. The free Wifi was much appreciated. The hotel comped $10/day per person for breakfast in their fabulous restaurant Aja. Over the course of 3 mornings, we had something different every day. The food was soooooo good, and the staff was soooo friendly. Better than any comped breakfast I've ever had. You can't beat a real breakfast in a classy restaurant. The downstairs bar was lively on Saturday night. Unfortunately, we never made it to the spa or the lounge at the top, but I'm sure we would've been equally impressed. The location was so convenient - a few blocks from Michigan Ave, close to the Red Line, John Hancock bldg, Water tower. Will I stay there again? In a heartbeat! For the price, location, service, the beautiful room, by far the Dana is the best deal in downtown Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: COhotelcritic
Reviews.Content: Bad: 1) dust bunnies in the bathroom barn door, crud in the shower, gashes/scratches on walls 2) can hear EVERYTHING from the hallway Good: 1) wood floors on 1/2 or room- awesome! 2) great location- 3 blocks from Whole Foods, 6 blocks from Michigan Ave & dining 3) great views- floor to ceiling windows 4) wonderful shower, amenities, beds, sheets 5) has fitness center, but no pool 6) snagged for $180/ night - with taxes- off expedia Note: the shower has an open glass wall to the bed area, making it very trendy; I loved it, but conservative people may not. Recommendation: a FANTASTIC find for downtown Chicago- I will stay again. Get turn-town service: yummy snack.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but not without flaws”
Reviews.Author: NickAndKaren
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dana Hotel and Spa for a girls weekend away. The location of the hotel is fantastic, close to it all. We got a good deal for a rate and the rooms are fabulous. The beds are a little hard but I think most people like them that way. We had some issues with a few minor things, nothing that would make us never stay here again. The biggest issue was no microwave available to guests. We had leftover food and all we wanted to warm up on a cold, rainy day and they were not willing to help us out at all. They only give a few creamer and sugar for the coffee (which the only choices are dark or decaf) and it wasn't enough for two people. We called guest services for more and it took them more then two hours to bring it to us. The rooms are decent size and I love the wood flooring and floor to ceiling windows. What I don't care for is the fact that the wall between the shower and the room is glass with just a curtain over it. I get it and it would be cool if you were staying in a room with one bed...but for people traveling on business, or in our case, with friends it's a little creepy. I don't need to see shadows of my friends showering. I don't know why they would have that in a room with two beds. If you have trouble sleeping because of noise, bring your Ambien. On weekends the hotel gets a little loud ( a cab driver told us it's a known party hotel) and the street below is very busy and noisy. I guess I would say that guest services isn't all it's cracked up to be but I would stay here again if I got a deal on the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but issues”
Reviews.Author: jim1231
Reviews.Content: The Dana has lots of potential but lots to refine before it joins the list of "greeat/fun place to stay" hotels. Great location downtown near Michigan Ave. But problems began as check-in with a uncaring first encounter at check-in, mixed up reservation, and then to the room where the TV didnt work, toilet dripped, no reading lamp on one side of bed, elevators where the key entry needed 3-5 attempts to get to your room, etc. Room design is very interesting with glass walled shower facing the bed. Nice amenities. Comfortable bed. It just needs management to smooth out the bumps.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tsogl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dana Hotel & Spa on multiple occasions between November 2010 and February 2011. We found the rooms and service quality to be excellent. The breakfast was excellent, although I did not find the room service menu to be as high in quality. The floor-to-ceiling windows offer incredible views of the Chicago skyline. I would recommend the Dana Hotel & Spa. One point to note -- the top floor of the hotel has a nightclub which can get very noisy. We enjoyed our stays at the Dana less when we were close to club activities and guests, who could be heard in our room and who were quite loud. The free high speed wireless is quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: theoriginalwoman
Reviews.Content: Took a tour of the rooms and the set up was cozy. Rooms are not that big but have a cute hardwood floor finished look. Windows stretched from ceiling to floor, flat screen tvs, and MP3/Ipod dock stations, are a few of the modern amenities included. The location is at a busy corner so it can be lots of traffic, noise at times, but lots in the area to do and see. The see through glass shower from the bedroom was something I had never seen before. (you can opt to make it private during showers)...We will probably be coming back to stay. We actually booked a spa day at the hotel and it was average. We got in and out, professional and nice staff, quiet and relaxing though. Just watch for the extras some may try to convince you to add extras to your spa treatments..it can add up to more than what your pockets can afford. As this was the case with us. Overall the spa experience I grade a C+... maybe a B-??. Oh and there was a guy name Tim there that was awesome and very helpful in assisting us!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JLAA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Dana for the weekend for my first trip to Chicago. We stayed in the tranquil suite and we were very impressed with our room. My husband and I travel frequently and the bed was one of the most comfortable we've ever slept in. The suite itself was clean, comfortable and had plenty of space. The living room was separate from the bedroom and the shower in the bathroom was incredible. The staff, especially the concierge/bellhops were very friendly and helpful. We used the work out room and had spa services, both were good. The location is great. Overall the Dana was great and we will be staying there again next time we go to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!!”
Reviews.Author: maldape
Reviews.Content: We had plans to spend Thanksgiving with family in Chicago and to drive in on Thanksgiving morning from the twin cities. Just for kicks we decided to jump on line and see if we could find a room. We did--decided to take a chance and drove in on Wed evening. Had a great dinner at The Fifty/50 and checked into our spectacular room with our spectacular view. The only thing I disliked was that we had to search the neighborhood for parking---no valet--maybe it was too late at night. The room was floor to ceiling glass with the most amazing view of the city. Very contemporary furnishings and architecture--and sound system to plug our iPod into. Its the kind of place where you can pretend you are young and hip again (for a little bit I forgot I had kids!). The service was givien by the hotel manager (only one on duty at that late hour) and he did everything from check us in to take our bags to our room and we felt incredibly spoiled for the short time we were there. Best decision we made all weekend---and that's saying a lot cause the whole weekend was pretty amazing. Would DEFINITELY stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, with incredible shower.....a bit of a party hotel though”
Reviews.Author: 2tampuh2
Reviews.Content: If you want to hit the nightlife in River North or downtown and like a modern, hip vibe this is the hotel for you. Restaurant looked good but didn't get a chance to eat there, there is also a lounge/club on the topmost floor that can get pretty loud. The room was nice but tiny, I was told that a "comfy king" has a half wall of windows but the only window was the glass door that led to the tiny balcony. That was kind of a let down considering the photos they show on the website....but the view from the balcony was pretty decent so it was okay. So my advice would be to upgrade to the corner room with two walls of floor to ceiling windows. The bed was extremely comfortable and pillows/linens excellent. The shower is what really makes staying there worth it. Full glass shower that looks into the room and a rainfall shower head.....its like being in a spa. You could easily spend an hour taking a shower. There is plenty of room for two people too.... The hotel was loud, one night you could hear doors slamming and girls yelling and laughing, they were totally drunk. The front desk suggested a middle floor because the sounds from "Vertigo"( the lounge on the top floor) can penetrate four or five floors. When going for an early morning run on Sat morning there was a drunk chick talking on her phone unable to get into her room, pair that with laughing and yelling every couple of hours it reminded me of college dorm days. Overall a nice place, if your looking to relax though I am not willing to say it would be a good idea, people stay there to crash late at night when partying downtown

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: galochka1982
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Dana 4 nights, it was our second stay there. Loved it once again! Joe at the front desk was very helpful and showed us what customer service should be all about. Cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, stunning hotel in fantastic location-excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: CheltenhamHolidayer
Reviews.Content: Could barely fault this hotel. Very good location, BEAUTIFUL hotel and rooms, friendly staff. Very close to the metro station, and plenty of very good restaurants in walking distance. Only minor niggles were that the bed was too soft for our liking, I'm not a fan of transparent glass bathroom 'walls' and the bar was closed for refurbishment during our stay. Would definitely stay at this boutique hotel again due to the outstanding value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: Angela4997
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay here for my first trip to Chicago. So happy that I did. Staff was wonderful! Room was on the small side, but it was just fine for what we needed. Great location also.

Reviews.Title: “The friendliness and service of the conciege and restaurant staff was exceptional”
Reviews.Author: StMichaelsKathy
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for 4 nights at the Dana Hotel for a Mother/daugher double dual birthday celebration. The concierge Tim was wonderful with directions, tickets and even sent us a bottle of wine to celebrate our birthdays. Because we booked the hotel direct we received a daily $10 breakfast voucher for the restaurant (it worked til 3pm on weekends) where they had hinese chicken sald was one of the best ever) Matt in the restaurant even insisted on providing us with a to go dinner snack for our plane flight out on Monday. The bedding was wonderful, location great, room well equiped ( but a tiny bit worn).A great value and the staff added so much to a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointing, could have been so much better”
Reviews.Author: AlisonA009
Reviews.Content: Having read the rave reviews for this hotel I was really looking forward to our eight night stay. We regularly visit Chicago for business and pleasure, and this time around were traveling with my husband's business colleagues. Someone had phoned the hotel in advance to let them know we would be arriving late, but in spite of this the hotel had let our room go. While this may be a common occurrence, the handling of it was abysmal. The guy on reception started off by saying that he had some really bad news for us, but it wasn't his fault! This was before we had even had a chance to comment. He then told us that we could walk the three blocks to another hotel...with heavy suitcases at one in the morning on a Saturday night. He continually told us it wasn't his fault, and our general impression was that we should just go away and shut up. I had to ask for the money for a taxi to the other hotel, and he then told me I needed to get receipts as he couldn't be seen to be just giving out money. It was only when I asked if he was actually sure the other hotel had a room that he bothered to ring them and explain the situation. Otherwise I think it highly likely that we would have arrived at reception and had to do all the explaining ourselves. He didn't even offer to get someone to help us outside with our luggage to find a cab...I had to ask, but according to him it definitely wasn't his fault! After a very restless night sleep we returned to the Dana prepared to do battle with the manager. To be fair he did upgrade us to a corner room and was pleasant to deal with. The actual hotel was very nice and the room was clean and comfortable and the desk made working a pleasure. All the other staff were unfailingly friendly, and the doormen were particularly good, however the waiting staff at breakfast seemed very disorganized as we had to wait ages for a very simple order of toast and coffee. While this hotel has a lot of potential to be very good, and the location is convenient, the staff could really use some extra training, and I would not feel comfortable booking this hotel for our next trip in September. I have traveled a lot and never had such poor service when checking in (or trying to!). In general hotels are not supposed to 'bump' guests who are staying for longer periods of time, and you are far more likely to get bumped if you only have one night booked...we had eight.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, luxurious, urbane, friendly, hip base for our family wedding.”
Reviews.Author: cyrushay
Reviews.Content: 3 generations the bride's and the groom's family - from the NY region - filled a score of rooms and everybody sang the praises of the Dana staff. They are relaxed, focused, ready to help however. Within 24 hours, key staff were using my name. Very helpful consierges. Excellent restaurant: "aja". Excellent details: beds, linens, towels, showers, iPod stereo. Chicago know how to play host, and Dana is at the top of the list.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence, can't ask for anything more!”
Reviews.Author: followmylead
Reviews.Content: We had the best of times during our brief stay. No complaints whatsoever. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was immaculate and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhh meets Yum”
Reviews.Author: toddmfein
Reviews.Content: What a place! The spa was aromatic, tranquil, and relaxing, and AJA had a warm ambiance that went well with the orange lanterns and delicious sushi. The appetizer of flavored ice chips on the dry ice was very cool, and the rainbow roll was tasty. Vertigo was hip enough that it motivated me to check out the fire pit and ice bar outside even though Iâ€™m a wimp when it comes to the cold weather, and the hooded robes were a nice touch. Plus, we devoured the oreo cookie dessert there to top things off. Our corner room on one of the upper floors had a rustic, but modern feel with a Superman-like view of Norther Chi-town, and the staff was responsive and professional... a class act!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Time”
Reviews.Author: traveltogether
Reviews.Content: Our room was comfortable and the service was excellent. We especially appreciated Aja for breakfast each morning. The location is perfect for exploring Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Rock Star Treatment and Luxury for Their Everyday Guest”
Reviews.Author: EcoChefLove
Reviews.Content: I had the delight of being a guest in the Dana Corner Suite last Thursday. I would like to take time to tell you that the staff is FABULOUS. From Cesaer my Bell Thursday evening and Romeo on the Front Desk set the tone for the polished Hallmark of Dana Service that made my stay memorable... To the unforgettable Rock Star moment of seeing my name on the Flat Screen TV in my room welcoming to the Dana. I screamed with DELIGHT! I will definitely return again and again. And yes, the location is perfect as well.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: Jewlye
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Dana for 5 nights when visiting Chicago this summer, and it was fabulous! The suites are well appointed, two sides of floor to ceiling windows gave a spectacular view over the Chicago Skyline. The hotel is located two blocks from Magnificent Mile, excellent location! It is close to everything! Dinner and entertainment for our night was walking distance. We stayed in a Corner King Suite, which contained an oversized King Size bed large enough for a little army! It is the single most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in - fluffy down comforter and a mountain of pillows! The bathroom was great, especially the rain shower! However, it's all glass and you can see into the room, but there is a curtain you can use for a bit more privacy.. Bathrobe and slippers came with the room, super comfy! Overall, great stay at a great hotel with very friendly staff, and clean and comfy rooms with a magnificent view. I will definitely stay here again during my next trip to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “You don't even need to leave the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carrie-n-Kevin
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect place for a relaxing getaway. We never even had to leave the hotel the whole first day, and if we had the time, we would have easily stayed another day. The corner king room views with floor to ceiling windows are gorgeous. The dinner was very tasty, and with restaurant, a sky lounge, a spa and fitness center, including spectacular views, you never need to leave! The place was very clean, stylish, modern, and the workers were very friendly. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daveyh70
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a few friends, the hotel is excellant. The rooms are superb with some great views. The hotel staff are helpful and friendly. The roof top bar was good in Jan and will be even better in the summer. One to recommend

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Marielee2521
Reviews.Content: The rooms are amazing, I could live in the shower. The staff is very friendly. I had dinner in aja, I recommend the seabass!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home Every Christmas”
Reviews.Author: mooresy2
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Dana Hotel every Christmas holiday for the past 4 years and occasionally throughout the year. We are treated like one of the family from the doorman outside who always recognizes us to the staff in the lobby. We always get an upgrade to a corner room which is the way to go always as the views are spectacular, rooms fully stocked with nice amenities( ipod/iphone docks, stocked wine cooler, excellent toiletries) and the beds are so comfortable. This hotel used to be relatively affordable by Chicago standards until a write up in a travel magazine as one of the top new boutique hotels in the world and then the prices shot up, but around Christmas and during the winter season it is easy to get a rate of $89-100 per night. This is a modern hotel and if you are shy about possibly being seen in your room by the apartment right across the street then maybe this is not the place for you as the windows do afford views into your room all the way into the bathroom via the oversized shower. The only complaint i would have about this place is the restaurant in which breakfast is served in the morning is very expensive for what you get, but there are plenty of places around the area to get a cheap standard breakfast without paying couture prices. If you can wait until 10am you can always go right across the street to Bijans which is a great place for eats anytime and they serve until late at night. My last visit i did go up to the rooftop club, Sky Bar, and although it was during the day it seemed very musky and nothing special honestly although it is a reputed "hot spot" on the weekends. Overall i would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service makes hotel 5-star worthy”
Reviews.Author: madmadd01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dana Hotel and Spa two days ago, I was in for a weekend wedding. Right off the bat my excellent experience began. It started with the the general "look" of the hotel. Everything is clean cut, relaxed environment. I had stayed in a Comfy room, I LOVED IT! Very comfy indeed. The room was beautifully designed and very modern. These employees are exceptional when it comes to guest service. They have a personal touch, that reaches myself as a guest and everyone else who walks through your lobby. My check-in experience was phenomenal, I believe the agent that worked with me was a woman named Jill. This woman went above and beyond the call of duty to make my check in experience wonderful. She was very understanding and caring when it came to my multitude of questions. She made sure everything from my bags to the the soap bars in the bathroom were ready to go for me and taken care of.. Now I have stayed at many hotels before, usually 4 star and up. I have never had the service I did with Jill. I will definitely be staying here more often, when I get the chance! Definitely keep her around! My hats off to all of you at the Dana Hotel and Spa! Keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “The front desk staff made me feel welcome and at home and the room was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Istaz
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at the Dana and we loved it. We are telling all of our friends, family and colleagues about it. The front desk staff, Joe and Eve, made a great first impression and were most helpful throughout our stay. The room/view was awesome. We'll be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic corner rooms, indifferent waitstaff”
Reviews.Author: goldilachs
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I and another couple stayed here over the New Year's holiday. Although the room rates were significantly higher during this time, both parties were upgraded to corner rooms, two sides of wall-to-wall windows looking out at the Chicago skyline. In addition, we enjoyed the hard wood floors, comfortable king-size bed, and rain shower. With the well-designed rooms and great location, during the off season the Dana hotel would provide excellent value. If the waitstaff improves this venue may become my hotel of choice for Chicago. The only downside to the hotel is the mediocre waitstaff who seemed unenthusiastic about waking up early in the morning. When our table of six asked our server for more cream for our coffee we were informed that there was already one pot on the table. The staff seemed more interested in catching up with each other then waiting on patrons. Notable exceptions to this include Miroslav, the Bulgarian buss boy, who went out of his way to anticipate the needs of his tables. The concierge, manager, and check-in staff were all friendly and helpful. The location also can't be beat. We were able to walk everywhere in the city--premier shopping sites are only five blocks away and the Art Museum is a 20 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars , all the way around !”
Reviews.Author: CharityGetaway
Reviews.Content: Being in the travel business, I attend a lot of conventions throughout the year. While attending the Midwest Clinic in Chicago, I found a hidden gem, The Dana Hotel and Spa. From the very start, I was greeted by Ceasar at the door, with a large smile and a handshake I was welcomed to the hotel. Throughout my week stay, he never lost that smile, even in 10 degree weather. The other Doormen and Bellmen, all had the same manner about them, and always remembered me by name, this included Chris, T.J., Preston, and especially Stephen, who I now consider a good friend. After a long day at the convention and fighting the cold, we always made it a point to stop for a drink and something little to eat at the Aja restaurant and bar, where Todd the bartender would have our cocktail waiting upon our arrival daily. Drew the other bartender was also very professional and another good conversationalist. The manager Grant always approached to see how our day went, and to make sure we were enjoying ourselves during our stay there. We did have a fantastic breakfast each morning, and dinner a few times, ordering a steak that was out of this world, and sushi, which came in larger portions than I am used to. Also ask for the homemade SPICY sauce, a flavor you will never forget. The service was excellent provided by Andy, Asleigh, Natalya, and Angel. The Vertigo bar was a great nightclub, with dancing throughout the evening with every song having a great beat. The servers Kristie and Tara were fun, and Megge the manager does a fantastic job, hats off to her. The only problem I had the whole week was remedied immediately by Dan the building engineer when my key would not work for my room, due to the fact I erased the code by carrying next to my cell phone. The supervisors Jeff and Sherman did a super job of making sure everything was perfect from the chic rooms, to overseeing the staff, which gave us a wonderful reception every time we walked through the lobby. It was a pleasure meeting the entire Front desk staff, including Lindsey, Romeo, Eve, Jill and Joe. I would highly recommend this hotel when you stay in Chicago. Between the accommodations and the staff, I would rate my experience a five star stay. Danny Yanesh Charity Getaway Fundraising

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: AnthD78
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel experience EVER!!! Rooms were small yet cozy, however, the staff could use a lesson or two on manners,decency and customer service. When I called to speak with a manager and explained my issues, he flat out told me I'm not the first one to make a complaint like this and about a specific "security" employee who has treated other guests similar...yet they still allow this behavior. Very poor management. I highly recommend staying at one of the more larger established hotels instead of The Dana. It definately was NOT worth the money that was spend to be treated so ignorantly. It was my first experience there and will absolutely be my last. If you plan on booking a room at The Dana, I strongly suggest looking elsewhere. The city has plenty of other great hotels who treat their guests with respect. I'm extremely disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Rooftop”
Reviews.Author: BrizBot
Reviews.Content: I have only ever visited the Dana to go to their rooftop bar. It is one of my favorite views and scenes in terms of rooftops. It's a bit "sceney" as a friend would say in that they will make you wait behind a velvet rope depending on the time and day. Drinks can get pricey but it's worth it - love the DJ, always have a good time. For you smokers too you will like it because they allow it on their rooftop (at least cigars). Definitely come.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is just average but the front door employee is extremely nice.”
Reviews.Author: yating
Reviews.Content: The front door employee on the first floor is extremely nice. One of the employee saw us ran down the stairs. He ran to open the door for us. very very impressive. However, the rest is just average. I don't think it reaches the 4-star level. The bed is really bad. The middle part sinks. When I asked the guest service if there is anything that they can do, she said no and it is just because the bed is too soft. This is ridiculous. The bed is really not even.

Reviews.Title: “Super Cool”
Reviews.Author: Lane_Scott
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at Dana from the minute the taxi pulled up... Great look and vibes. Had a corner room on the 15th floor with great views of state street, couldn't say enough about the beauty and comfort of the room. Highly suggest getting the Oreo dessert Really enjoyed the Vertigo bar on the 25th floor, great views of DT Chicago. Mostly a positive experience but they could improve their beer selection...

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: twinmom2Illinois
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Dana Hotel when we went to Chicago for a weekend getaway. We are in our early 30's and had an absolutely great time. The only complaints I have is that the blinds do not block out all the sun so we found it hard to sleep in due to the sun shining on us. Also the hotel is loud, noise from outside, as well as, great deal of noise from elevator and bar on rooftop. We went up to the Vertigo Sky Lounge on Friday night. It was a good time. They have robes and minks to put on to sit out around the fire so that was nice. Breakfast at the Aja was excellent! I highly recomment the omelet. The bloody mary is extremely, extremely spicy. We also got a couples massage at the spa. It was not the best massage ever but the spa was very nice. I really liked the ladies locker room, has a steam room and everything you need to take a shower and get ready. We would definately stay at the Dana again if the price is right. FYI... you get 2 $10 off coupons for breakfast if you book directly with the Dana.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Weekend at the Dana Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NoviceTrlvr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Chicago for a short weekend trip. We chose the this hotel for its location and the deal we got online and we were not disappointed. To start, this hotel is ideally located for walking the City, close to Michigan Avenue and within walking distance to legendary eating establishments such as Giordano's and Portillos. The hotel itself was very trendy and clean. They have a hotel restaurant there called Aja that is delicious. We ate there for breakfast a couple of times and the food was excellent and reasonably priced for hotel fare (I recommend the eggs benedict). They also have a rooftop terrace with fire pits, blankets and coats if it gets cold. The view is beautiful, the ambiance is fun and the food and drinks were good. We booked a corner king room, which had floor to ceiling windows and beautiful views of the skyline. The room was immaculate and the bed was super comfortable. I would recommend this room if you can get a good deal. All the staff were very helpful and attentive and were always available to meet whatever our needs were. We really had a great time exploring this fantastic City. The Sky Deck at the Willis Tower is awesome and the Signature Lounge in the John Hancock tower gives you fantastic views, especially at night. The 90 minute architecture boat tour is also a must. However, if you are traveling to Chicago you MUST do yourself a favor and go to Lou Malnati's and get their deep dish pizza (and make sure to get the buttercrust), I assure you that you won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel in a great neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: lady_winter2
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a "staycation" in Chicago. After a few glitches in the beginning (first room assigned had a tiny window and no view, tv didn't work, mp3 dock broke), everything went smooth. I was moved to a great room with a huge window and an unforgettable view of downtown, and all my requests were promptly answered. Love the mp3 dock! Also, love the tiny balcony. Oh, and the chocolate-covered fortune cookies on my pillow. The room is small but space is well decorated and every inch of the room is very smartly made use of. Definitely not for a family vacation though (note previous reviews about the curtain in the bathroom). The upside is, I can be in the bathroom and watch TV at the same time! I enjoyed being walking distance to Michigan Avenue, the film festival and some awesome restaurants in the city. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful small hotel, good restaurant and spa, great value!”
Reviews.Author: eastshore10
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I wanted a weekend away for shopping and spa. Our travel agent recommended the Dana. Great choice, the small restaurant served Asian foods, the breakfast was also excellent and a good value. The room was on 23rd floor overlooking the city with floor to ceiling glass on 2-sides. Comfortable bed, desk, even offered reasonably priced in room snacks, wine, 24hr room service and beverages along with a HUGE rain shower in the well equiped bathroom. Conveinently located near Michigan Ave. We would definetly visit again. The spa was small, very clean with friendly knowledgable staff.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Author: sussed_nl
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were greeted by the friendly and helpful doorman. At the desk things weren't running as smoothly, it was busy and the staff behind the desk were very unfriendly and unattentive. The staff had this attitude the whole week we stayed there, if you would ask something they would role their eyes and sigh ... very unprofessional. Actually I have never experienced this in any hotel and I do quite a bit of traveling. Housekeeping and the doormen on the other hand were very helpful and friendly. The room, a serene king, in itself was ok and well fitted except that it was missing a safe. Bathroom was big, with nice big fluffy towels and a good shower. The window could be opened and free-wifi is always a bonus. The room is on the noisy N State st side, which didn't bother us too much but be warned if you are a light sleeper. All in all the stay in Chicago itself was great, the city has a lot to offer and we were lucky with the weather. I will definitely be back, but not at the Dana, way too much attitude.

Reviews.Title: “I am looking for my third stay already!!”
Reviews.Author: AFunSeeker
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice with my BF... just for weekend fun! Staffs are so nice. A friendly gentleman, TJ, welcomed us when we stayed there for the first time. He and another staff (cannot remember his name) actually remembered me when I recently stayed at Dana. It just makes me feel so comfortable and want to come back again. Rooms are awesome. Very unique and nothing I have experienced before. Very spacious, so open (literally). I stayed at a corner room back in Dec and a suite for the recent stay, and the view from the room could not be better. If you worry that someone outside might be watching you in the room, make sure to scroll down the screen at night. They have a good selection of wine in the fridge. Also they have a great restaurant / bar downstairs and I LOVE it. Rooms Corner room has a superior view and is SO open. Tranquil suite --- again, wonderful. The shower room is great! I was so excited and forgot to take any photos but their website should have some. Cannot complain about the location. This hotel is located in a very convenient area. Whole Foods market is close by I can buy some good night snacks if I want to take back something to chew on :)

Reviews.Title: “Little details keep it from being a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: carosim
Reviews.Content: Great: housekeeping was great, perfect timing: never saw them and room was always made up and/or turned down when we got back in. Staff could not have been nicer and more welcoming -- everyone from valet to doorman (nicest!) to servers, room service, and front desk; unlike 5-stars, the staff at Dana seemed genuinely happy to see guests and interested in their Chicago plans. Valet was prompt and friendly. Free and reliable Wi-fi. Room service was 24-hours and food was very good and promptly delivered. Room was well-appointed, lovely honor bar selection and had great design finishes -- "hardwood" floors and bathroom fixtures in particular were great. However, this leads me to . . . Not so great: requested a high floor room (we had a corner) and got one on the 6th floor; it was occasionally noisy and the view was pretty bleh of the parking lot, 7-Eleven and a Container Store billboard.
