A/C was incredibly noisy and clattery when it came on ever 20 minutes. The safe drove us crazy -- we had to key in our code about 20 times before it would open; we wound up just shutting it unlocked. Bathroom vanity was coming apart a little at the seams, and the bathtub faucet (while v. cool looking) was not properly affixed to the wall. Shower curtain was one of those snap half-curtain things and the snap buttons had become loose, tearing the curtain in half every time you so much as brushed by it. Bathroom a touch small. The two hotel gift cards we got as part of the package erroneously had 1 cent each on them and we had to spend 15 minutes with the (nicest ever) hotel barista trying to figure out what the deal was before he comped our coffees and got the front desk to replace them -- again, service was mostly wonderful and warm. Only exception was breakfast on the last day: waitstaff were inexperienced and literally running around the dining room trying to cover everything, making the whole breakfast a little unsettling. But they were still very nice and kept apologizing about the wait times, and the food was very solid. Finally, we saw two in-room movies, and while we had no problems with the first one, the second one in HD (Iron Man 2) skipped and stuttered like a youtube video with a bad connection throughout until the last half-hour. Incredibly annoying. To your taste: the hotel entrance is small and shares space with the entrance to its rooftop bar (Vertigo) and a restaurant, so it has a little bit of a clubby/hip/chaotic feel, and the lobby is one story up (stairs or cool glass elevator); the elevators require key access for security reasons but is a little finicky. Closet is half-size. Overall, I really liked the staff and the design of the hotel, the entrance notwithstanding. I think I might try some other hotels we walked by that looked great but at this price point, Dana offers a good package if you're ready to deal with a few glitches, and I would stay again. I didn't have time to try the spa or the rooftop bar so can't really comment on those; would be interested to see how good the spa services are because that would be a good reason to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with an Awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: HappyCamper36538
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a wedding and reserved at Dana because of the bride/groom's block of rooms. We would not normally stay at such a fancy hotel, since we have younger children (7 & 6), but took advantage of their reduced wedding block rate. The room was comfortable and fabulous! The view was breathtaking ... I found my kids laying in front of the windows every chance they got just taking in the city sites. We were VERY LATE getting into Chicago, trying to get to the wedding on time. Every single worker at that hotel that could help us did. The front desk lady sped up our registration and made sure our luggage was taken to our room ASAP. The bellhop got us a taxi cab and even told the driver how to get to the church quickly. Everyone was so helpful. Even though we were in the heart of Chicago, our room was very quiet. We heard no noise from the street or from any rooms around us. We were on the 9th floor. The curtain between the shower/bathroom and bedroom was kind of different, but allowed my kids to be goofy and play practical jokes throughout our stay. (Needless to say, our bathroom didn't have much privacy!) You would think that there should be a curtain on the inside of the shower. The breakfast was good, but do agree that they need to communicate to you that it is not 'complimentary', but you get $10.00 off of it. We had 4 people in our room, but only received 2 $10.00 vouchers. Overall, it was a beautiful hotel with a staff that should be commended for their great efforts.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: goochave
Reviews.Content: We had a corner room with views down Erie toward Michigan Ave. Floor to ceiling windows on 2 walls. And a shower with a floor to ceiling window looking into the room and beyond. (Curtain available when desired) Rooftop bar was nice but needed new outdoor furniture. Drinks were very pricey and not great., Everything seems brand new. Nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous room with a view”
Reviews.Author: Aug20Kims
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our pre-honeymoon a few days after our wonderfully stressful wedding weekend, and it was the perfect getaway. Our room was chic and cozy with a fabulous rain shower, complimentary breakfast, and an amazing view of the city. Though we enjoyed just sleeping in and relaxing in our room, it was wonderful to have a wide variety of restaurants and shops within a three-block radius. We even caught a late-night movie (finally after many months) just down the street. We had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic downtown location very close to...”
Reviews.Author: matthewwoolf12
Reviews.Content: Fantastic downtown location very close to all the major sights. The hotel staff were very friendly and gave some great recommendations for food and things to do. We had a problem with our air conditioning which was resolved very quickly. We have 2 complaints about our stay: - we asked for a balcony and didn't get one. - we booked directly with the hotel and were offered free breakfast. This was actually slightly deceiving as we were only given $10 per person per day. At least 1/3 of the menu cost more than this. One point to note! There is a glass wall between the bathroom and bedroom. There is a curtain to cover this but perhaps not the most private of rooms if sharing with a work collegue etc... Overall this is a good hotel which we would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like in heaven”
Reviews.Author: PuennelJade
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we received an upgrade for a corner suite. What a view!! The windows are down to the floor, the wooden flooring was chic, the interior modern. The breakfast was perfect, fresh juice and tasty sandwiches. The location ideal for shopping and restaurants. The staff is friendly and very helpful. We felt like in heaven! It was our second honeymoon, after 22 years of marriage, first time without the kids. We enjoyed it tremendously and will return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: jeponcini
Reviews.Content: I booked my 'comfy king' room over 2 months in advance and was placed in a dungeon. The hotel's description of a comfy king includes 'a half wall of floor to ceiling windows' and the only window we had was on the door to the small balcony. There was no where to put clothes other than the hangers in the closet so we had to keep everything in the suitcase in the already cramped room. The 'free breakfast' is actually a $10 voucher towards breakfast, which would be fine if they did not advertise it as a FREE BREAKFAST. Service in the restaurant was horrible. we had to ask for things multiple times from multiple people. The 'Complimentary Wine Tasting' was comical as well. It was entertaining to watch the bartender and a person whom appeared to be the restaurant manager scramble to try and find the cheapest wines to pour during this hour, I must have been there on the busiest day they have ever had because they were running in circles. The phones in the room did not work, the staff was fairly friendly but unattentive until our checkout day when I had recieved a late checkout and the maid knocked on the door twice and I got a phone call, which was hard to answer because you had to try and find a phone that actually worked. I told both individuals that I was told I could checkout late and the lady on the phone stated that there were no late checkout that day and when would I be ready to leave. Ha, I told her I would be ready at 2pm like I had agreed upon with whomever gave me a late checkout and hung up the phone. There are other hotels in Chicago that I would go to before I go back to the Dana Hotel and spa. It is a nice hotel aesthetically but way too much attitude and terrible service in my opinion. ( I did go during a very busy time in Chicago so you may have a different experience if no one is at the hotel since they staff it the same way regardless it seems)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, popular with the young party crowd”
Reviews.Author: mikeormichael
Reviews.Content: Lobby area is small and often crowded and loud. Actually upon checking in I was having 2nd thoughts about this hotel; was it too busy, loud, young, etc... Staff was friendly, but always appeared busy with 3 guests in line, 2 phones ringing etc... I wouldn't stay here if you wanted or expected lots of personal attention. Once we got into the room, it was excellent. Make sure to reserve a corner-king if you want those awesome views with floor-celing windows on 2 sides of the room. Shower and bathroom were very nice; yes, there is a clear window in the shower(with a curtin), and the bathroom door slides shut without a lock - so not a ton of privacy. Again, the hotel is extremely popular with the 25-35 crowd, if you are bit older/quieter, you might be put off. With the crowd, the hotel guests like to party. I could hear people above us and in the halls around 2am - but it wasn't horribly loud. But I found the room excellent, very comfortable and stylish without being overly modern. I highly recommend it for that $150-250 price-point room, for the same money I would never stay at a {Hyatt etc...} if i could stay here..but if you want that luxury/special feeling and you can afford $100-200 more a night, you'd probably like the Peninusla, Trump or Elysian more.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: mrelsted
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! Just the perfect location for us. Close to almost everything. Very nice hotel. The service was super, everyone was so nice and helpfull. The food was nice, we enjoyed the breakfast - got some valuecoupons, so it's not "all you can eat", but very nice. Get a top floor room, if possible one with a balcony.

Reviews.Title: “The Dana puts the "ooh" in boutique”
Reviews.Author: CharlestonTwoOfUs
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our first trip ever to Chicago. I literally spent weeks researching all of the possibilities with my wife being the one to decide since this was her birthday gift. It was a good call. The location is great but then any hotel in that area is well located. Easy walk to the lake, Magnificent Mile, Navy Pier, restaurants, etc.. If you're not in the mood to walk then places like Millenium Park are a cheap cab ride away. We stayed in a Corner King on the 17th floor. We arrived late morning and were pleased to find that our room was ready. It was beautiful with floor to ceiling windows around the whole perimeter of the room. The decor was very comtemporary and nicely appointed...it was exactly as advertised. Our one fear was that since we are fifty-something that the place would be too loud and cater to a younger alternative crowd. We are happy to announce that the atmosphere was calm, casual and sophisticated. The Vertigo lounge on the top floor was the only part that catered to the younger set. And that's fine. The hotel is a business and the twenty-somethings have money to spend so more power to the Dana. Plenty of piano bars in the area for us mature folk who have "been there and done that". The only criticisms I have are this. I am an early riser and my wife is a late sleeper. There is no common area in which to leave the room to sit and read the morning paper and sip a coffee. They give you coupons worth $10 towards breakfast each morning which is a great deal and the food is great. During our five day stay the service was a little sluggish but they were under staffed and those on duty poured their hearts out. The one really curious shortcoming of this property is its lack of ice. The hotel is not huge by Chicago standards but it is 25 floors. There is one ice machine in the whole place...on the 5th floor. Where ever we stay we enjoy having a cocktail in the room as we prepare for going to dinner. The first night we stayed a party in the banquet room depleted all of the ice. I had to take my ice bucket to the first floor and ask the bartender for ice. Not good. For the record the mini-bar with wine and beer was nice and very reasonably priced. Also, don't rely too heavily on the concierge service for restaurant recommendations. Our first lunch for Chicago style pizza was at one of their local favorites (Gino's) in which I paid $22 for a small pizza. It was good but not that good. Walk around, you'll figure it out. The Dana is a great upscale, boutique hotel. The people were nice and the property is warm and comfortable. Having taken note of the huge chain places like the Westin, Marriot, Sheraton, etc and their impersonal assembly line service I have absolutely no regrets about our stay at the Dana. Chicago is a fun place to visit and when we go back (and we will) we will stay at the Dana

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good deals available”
Reviews.Author: SixtyDays
Reviews.Content: Got a very good weekend deal on quikbook.com for $110+tax per night. For this rate we were willing to accept some of the design features of the hotel that could be improved (curtain for bathroom, toilet paper holder inaccessible etc.). The hotel is definitely trying to be both a club destination and a hotel similar to what the W hotels chain is trying to be. Visited the Vertigo lounge and it was very busy with some guests being forcibly removed by the bouncers. The vibe is young and hip so worth being aware that this high-energy atmosphere will also contribute to some noise/loud music during your stay. The room itself was a good size, the bed was comfortable and the view was of the nearby condo buildings. We also had massages at the spa - these were very relaxing and the therapists were fantastic. However, for the rate and the good location I would recommend this hotel. Also, for dinner, a good tip is the Balsan bistro restaurant in the nearby Elysian hotel.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Sunseeker_mtl
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights got a very good deal on internet with a voucher for breakfast They upgraded me to corner room what a view highly recommended Room excellent all what you need spa shower bathrobe.... Breakfast very nice It is a busy hotel with lounge on top floor you may be surprise at first with music and the crowd Good gym and spa Staff very nice especially concierge desk Romeo who gave me very good tips on the city thanks to him Location cannot be better you can walk everywhere from main attractions beach and shops

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: rf06903
Reviews.Content: The small room was small with a very comfy bed & bedding, nice flat screen TV, Ipod docking station, wine cooler and free internet. There was a tiny balcony. A large glass shower in the bathroom was visible in the bedroom unless the curtain was pulled! We got a very discounted rate. I would probably try for the larger room on my next visit. Service was excellent. The location was very good. Cafes, resturants, & a Whole Foods nearby. Nice small gym.

Reviews.Title: “Dana Hotel - Too cool for school”
Reviews.Author: KP_voyager
Reviews.Content: Just completed a 3 day stay at the Dana Hotel and Spa. Got a great rate on a cozy king on quikbook.com. It has some great amenities, but the hotel has some major annoyances that keep me from rating it higher. Here is my pros and cons list: Pro: Great location, central to almost everything and close to the L. Bathrobes and slippers in the rooms. Very clean and very good housekeeping services, including turndown service. Very comfortable bed and nice linens and pillows.. Good TV. Reasonably price mini bar. Rainfall shower. Modern decor Con: Glass shower wall looking into main area is a cool concept but doesn't work so well in practice when your partner uses the bathroom in the middle of the night and the light from the bathroom illuminates the entire room! Testy AC: Called about the room being hot and they sent someone up right away. He explained that the green AC system senses when we are not there and shuts itself off. It did cool down after a while, but caused us to get up in the middle of the night to do jumping jacks to get the system working again. Absent Concierge: Did not once see the concierge at his desk the entire time we were there. Shared Closet, bathroom sliding door: Can't go into the bathroom if your partner is getting stuff out of the closet. No dresser - Closet is the only place to store clothes. TV located on the side of the bed taking up a lot of room on the desk and resulting in a sore neck. - Why don't they mount it on the wall across from the bed?

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SBpicky
Reviews.Content: Room 2316, absolutely fantastic, hotel incredible, breakfasts phenomenal, views terrific and the staff from the manager to the front desk staff to the bell men and waitresses all top notch, the very best!!! Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a girl's spa weekend!”
Reviews.Author: debmcl
Reviews.Content: I met my two best friends for a girl's spa weekend, and we could not have been happier with our choice. The hotel was beautiful, and the service at both the hotel and the spa was exceptional. The computer booking system for the spa is a hard to use, but when we called, we were assured that all of our requested appointments would be together, and they were. If you buy gift certificates online for the spa, you receive an additional $25.00 for each $100.00 you spend, which is a great deal, plus they were very gracious about our using them. The manager of the spa even made dinner reservations for us at a restaurant that they recommended which overlooks the lake. We had a table by the window for the fireworks on Saturday night, really cool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Dana Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sliphorn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dana for two nights on our way home from a Western trip. We booked a corner king and it was a refreshing change from the norm. It had floor-to-ceiling windows on two sides with a good view (mostly of condos nearby). I have acrophobia but was able to enjoy it (we were on the 24th floor). I appreciated the inside non-glass elevators. The shower was interesting as it had glass on one side, which can be covered by an outside curtain for privacy (I guess newlyweds would enjoy watching each other shower). It had an overhead shower nozzle so you just stand under it. There is also a wand, if you wish to use it. The room was well-kept and very clean. It had a long desk of sorts that had the TV and lots of work space. The floor near the windows was nice hard wood. There were two curtains that can (and should) be drawn down for shading out the sun and for total privacy. The only problem we encountered was loud music Saturday night and I assume it was from Vertigo the rooftop lounge, which was two floors above us. This said, it also could have resulted from a wedding reception that took place there that night. Although the entire hotel is smoke-free, people are permitted to smoke at Vertigo, tending to ruin the fresh air policy. Some of this smoke finds its way down to some rooms, unfortunately. The location is great as it is two blocks West of Michigan Avenue and its mega-shopping opportunities. Check in and out were seamless and the lobby is on the second floor. This permits them to screen people coming and going. You have to scan your room key card in the elevator to get to your floor and occasionally this was a problem getting it read. The doormen were friendly and a great help. The valet parking runs $42, which is steep but not out of line with this part to town. I would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: cuca6104
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the wonderful reviews on here, as well as checking out the website, I was really excited for our brief stay in Chicago at this hotel. Unfortunately I was quite disappointed. The room definitely needed to be updated, which was surprising after seeing such modern, hip rooms on the website. When I called to make a reservation I asked if breakfast was included and was told it was. However, we only received two breakfast coupons, worth $10 each, to put toward breakfast which was a la carte so after only ordering four items and racking up nearly $50 on our breakfast tab, we were left covering the rest. On the flip side, the staff was very friendly and the small gym had good equipment. I am from Illinois and travel to Chicago frequently and can say with certainty that you can find much better deals in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: june1300
Reviews.Content: Was booked here 3 days for a class. Loved It!!! got there at 7:30 am and thought I'd have to wait till after class to get checked in...but no they gave me my keys and told me I could go unpack and get ready for class. Walked in and WOW....really nice room big white fluffly bed..Big Fluffy Pillows were to die for!!!! TV was already turned on and had a welcome with my name on the screen....10 th floor (office building right across the street but is is downtown Chicago) had a device you can put your Ipod into to play (I have a zune so it didnt do anything for me) free wireless in room. desk area. 2 sets of shades can be lowered, room darkening and shears. Also have a mini fridge filled with drinks....beer or soada $4.00 each. There were also misc snacky foods with a price list . bathroom very nice (larger bottles of shampoo, conditioner and lotion) No Tub...but the shower was pretty nice.....rainshower head, glass wall looking into the bedroom (there is a curtain on the bedroom side if you would like privacy, but it might be fun if you there on a "romantic" stay) had robes, slippers & blowdryer. There was a nightly turndown service where they whould leave chocolate covered fortune cookies, draw your shades and leave on soft music on the radio. If you are in your room you can just tell them you dont need the service but would still like the yummy cookies. Oh I did read some complaints about noise at this hotel.....I think it may be a matter of what you are used to.....if you are used to the sounds of the city...no problem. If you are used to the quietness of the country, you may have a problem....the ceilings are concrete so people about you are not heard....only heard the occasional emergency vehicle go by. We were there for 3 day conference/class so we ate at the hotel for breakfast (they did continetal breakfast for us, break had continetal stuff still on it. Lunch all 3 days was yummy and never the same at any meal (though most of the foods (including the BBQ pork) had a kick to the flavor. Great location walking distance to to lots of things to see. We did milennium park and the bean, art institiute, and buckingham fountain. Lots of great places to eat around (I forgot just how good Pizzaria Uno's really is). My only complaint.....I could not get the elevator to work for the whole time I was there...the night I went and picked up my Pizza from Unos I had to ride the elevator for about 5 min till some nice people helped me get my floor lit up. Its the kind of elevator where you have to put your room key in and raight just the right amount of time for just the right light then enter your floor...well...I could never get it right!!! Definatly would go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing - clean, quiet, comfy, but trendy. A "must-stay" in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: mldc02
Reviews.Content: I don't usually review the places I stay in when I travel but I really feel the need to review this hotel. Hands down the best hotel I have ever stayed in. Swanky feel to it with the cool designs and rooftop lounge (great view by the way), but comfy and inviting. The big white bed felt like we were sleeping on a cloud. Very nice, helpful staff. Make sure to pay the money for the Corner King room, unbelievable floor to ceiling windows all the way around with an amazing view of State St. Great location, 2 blocks off Magnificent Mile, 2 blocks from Red Line (which goes straight to Lincoln Park and Wrigley). The chocolate covered fortune cookies were a nice little surprise at night. Free internet was a plus as well. Zero complaints. If you're going to Chicago, stay here. It's as simple as that.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely nice and pretty place to stay, very good price!”
Reviews.Author: CRO_10
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant place, beautiful lobby area and bedrooms, bedrooms are large and beautiful with an unusual decoration. Staff are very very friendly and willing to help. Nice restaurant were you can get delicious but pricy breakfast. If you book online, you may get coupons for your breakfast though, a very good deal specially considering how much we paid (not too much at all for the area, ect, $100ish/night). Excelent area. I definitely recommend this hotel! I've tried to stay there again but could never find a room anymore, you probably need to make your reservation ahead of time.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oldsk8r
Reviews.Content: Great staff - knowledgable, friendly and giving. Hi-speed internet fast & reliable. Great Spa. Restaurants and Bar friendly, welcoming and good value. Located close to downtown and Red Line.

Reviews.Title: “Strong case for the Dana”
Reviews.Author: chicagoboi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Dana in Chicago twice over the past two years. My first visit was for three nights, second stay for five. Depending on your specific needs, budget, and taste, The Dana can range from very good to fantastic. The location is a few blocks off the main drag but it's a very easy, safe, and quick walk to reach North Michigan Avenue or River North. Cabs are easily accessible at the front door and the "El" train and bus stops are within a 5 minute-or-so walk. The Dana was a newly built property buily a few years ago. It is modern, with a lot of exposed concrete and glass but still maintains a warm, Chicago-style loft feel with wood floors and touches of earthy colors throughout the hotel. There is an excellent spa, good restaurant (although too many better options out the front door), and a slightly-above-average continental breakfast included with all rooms. It would be great for younger or young-at-heart singles and couples. Not recommended for families or children due to privacy issues in all rooms and nightlife vibe when the sun goes down. The rooms: Very good, modern, Chicago-style design with partial wood floors, excellent desk/work space, sliding loft-style bathroom door, excellent spa-style bathroom with spacious rainfall shower, (One wall of the shower is glass exposed to the main bedroom area, which is really fun for some guests but maybe not-so-much if you are traveling with friends or family.) The rooms have excellent in-room amenities for this level/price of hotel. High quality music/TV systems, very good bed/linens, robes/slippers, toiletries, wine bar, and shockingly reasonably priced mini-bar/snacks. There is at least one floor-to-ceiling window offering standard to impressive city views. Excellent natural light in all rooms, although when needed there are blackout shades, if you want to sleep in or have privacy from the nearby buildings. I preferred the upgraded corner room during my second stay since it offered a little more space, two walls of floor-to-ceiling windows, better views, and a small private balcony. Be aware, no rooms other than the penthouse suites have bathtubs, the large spa rain-showers were the trade-off, I guess. There is also a fitness center and small computer area, although there is no pool and had to pay for wifi. Parking here as with all hotels in Chicago equals highway robbery. One area of the hotel that really disappointed this reviewer, was the super cheesy Vegas wanna-be roof top bar. I thought the staff, design, music, and skanky little cocktail waitress outfits were far too cheap and vulgar for this hotel. You can have a hip and swanky nightclub and still be sophisticated/classy. (Rooftop at The Wit hotel got this concept right and is worth the trip over this place.) Other than the free breakfast and spa worth consideration, skip the hotel outlets. In general I have found the service sufficient- never awful or rude but never particularly memorable. Overall, I find the Dana a very comfortable and stylish hotel with some great amenities and unique touches. If you can find a competetive rate, it's a good value and a more interesting experience compared with many of the standard corporate hotels in Chicago. Other comporable/stylish hotels in the area to consider and compare rates include The Wit, The Sofitel, The James, and The Polomar.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've booked at in a while!”
Reviews.Author: avemana1
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in we had a great experience at the Dana. Everyone was so nice and accommodating. They gave us a free upgrade to a suite in order to give us a place to hang out with all of our friends. The room was spectacular. The best part was the shower! The rooftop bar was amazing. Great experience, I would totally recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Consistently awesome”
Reviews.Author: wongadvice
Reviews.Content: Loosing track here. This has got to be my 6-8th stay at this hotel. What keeps me coming back is the consistency in service and the friendly staff managed by the best GM I've ever had the pleasure to meet. As said in previous reviews, I am a Diamond member at Hyatt but despite achieving that level of "prestige" I am still very much part of the herd. Perhaps this is the bonus of a staying at smaller boutique hotel. I like the simplicity and the sublime elegance of the place. They really do remember returning guests and responsive would be an understatement. The head concierge Tim made a dinner reservation for me at one of my favorite haunts, the Kinzie Chop House and teamed up with our server to send a special dessert. In all of my stays, I finally spent some real time at their Vertigo lounge. They've implemented a new VIP system that I was told I was among the first to try. Hot spots, especially in this town rise and fall quickly but over the years staying here, the lines for Vertigo has consistently been long. I got to bypass the line wrapping around the block. You can't access the lounge from the hotel floors but I suspect that all guests who stay will have this special access. The club itself is dark, ambient lighting, a great mix of music and seems to cater to urban professionals. I was just at Excaliber (what a dive) around the corner right before Vertigo and it was definitely more my speed. A good mix of twenty to forty something gelling well at Vertigo. A re-cap of the hotel. Sweeping city views, great technology in the rooms, an awesome shower and perhaps the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. Ritz Carlton beds have nothing on this place. Must I find something deficient about my stay? Sure, I'll dig hard . Due to a restaurant convention in town I couldn't get a late check out as requested because i had a late flight. That's OK, I got to check in hours before I was supposed to anyway but in the past they've always took care of me on that issue. Will be back in town end of June. See you then.

Reviews.Title: “Good not great”
Reviews.Author: alansmith_7
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a uber trendy/hip hotel as we are not keen on the large chains. We booked the TranquilitySuite (please note every floor has one - its the corner suite 560 sq ft) which was fine - 2 small balconies although views not great (and we were on 23rd floor). The bed is so amazingly comfortable and overall service good - just not great. The roof top bar/club is a bit lame and shoddy decor and sushi restuarant on ground floor nothing special at all. However the staff were nice and friendly (TJ the bell hop is great and a font of all necessary knowledge), spa is OK (small gym/no pool) breakfast is typical American ($10 per person vochers per day provided), location pretty good so yes overall more than acceptable - just not great!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Caligirlatheart36344
Reviews.Content: I was actually in the city for a cosmetic procedure I was having. Not wanting to drive all the way back to the suburbs, we stayed with The Dana Hotel (my plastic surgeon recommended it to me). I was a little concerned about not being at home, but my fears were completely unwarrented. From the moment I hobbled out of the cab-the valet attendant ran for the wheelchair and offered my husband any help he might need getting me to my room ok. Everyone was so incredibly nice-even before I was bandaged up because we actually got there the night before the surgery. We entered our gorgeos suite-that was upgraded to us- and I spent the next hours in the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in my life-and I'm not just saying that because of the medication I was taking! When we did get home I was actually quite sad that we didn't stay longer at the hotel-I missed that bed, the huge gorgeous shower, oh and their chicken noodle soup(Too die for!!). This experience could have easily been a nightmare, but because of this outstanding hotel-it was anything but. You will Not be disappointed in staying here-I can't wait to go back-under a little more fun circumstances of course!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location, nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Indiana1000
Reviews.Content: Dana Hotel was a great find in Chicago. The hotel staff are extremely friendly and helpful, from the doorman to the restaurant and check-in staff. On check in, they gave us a couple of $10 off breakfast coupons for each day, which made a nice start the day with a delish meal. The hotel is easy walking distance to the Magnificent Mile and the boat tours along the rivers. We booked a suite which included a living room and bar kitchen combo with a separate bedroom and bathroom, plus two balconies. The hotel is concrete construction which means almost no noise between the floors, but does create somewhat of university residence feel to the rooms. The ceilings are exposed concrete, which could be nice, except they seem a little low and it creates a cave-like feel to the space. The decor is eclectic and a bit busy with lots of textures. The rooftop bar, Vertigo, seems to be THE hotspot for the city at night. Line ups form from 11 pm onwards. If you want to see the view, go during the day when it's less overwhelmed. Overall, a nice place to stay and good value.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: CHKRaleigh
Reviews.Content: You can try, but you will not find another hotel in Chicago that is better for the price. The location is great- just a couple blocks from the Magnificent Mile, with lots of restaurants and cafes in between. The rooms, service, ambiance- fantastic!!!! Very modern and chic. The hotel is only about 2 years old, so everything is brand new. The rooms aren't huge, but you have floor to ceiling windows, hardwood floors, nice desk center, great bathrooms (I'll address the shower in a bit). Our room even had a balcony. And the beds are SO comfy. Now, as far as the showers go- really neat! So, it's all glass and you can see into the room, but there is a curtain you can use if you would prefer more privacy. Rain shower head is nice too, but there is also a hand held kind in case that's not your thing. There also is a happening rooftop bar/club which we didn't go to, but as far as any potential noise factor- there wasn't one. All the rooms are quiet and very peaceful. Breakfast: the quality of the breakfast they serve is awesome. With that said, you'd better get there on the earlier side if you want to get in. Overall, we were pretty impressed. Great place and we will probably stay here every time we return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel with fantastic location...”
Reviews.Author: Travelingme28
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel with fantastic location! Room was amazing if you like an urban, modern, lofty feel! I loved it! Rainshower was fantastic. Food, drinks, bar, rooftop bar were also fabulous! This was by, far, the most comfortable bed I have EVER slept in!! It was like sleeping on a cloud!!! The walls are a little thin if you have rowdy neighbors which luckily I did not. Will definitely be staying here again soon hopefully!

Reviews.Title: “OK all around, nothing earth shattering”
Reviews.Author: AmericanInHeidelberg
Reviews.Content: It's clear the hotel was "trendy" but I thought it seemed tired and a bit worn. Room was on the small side and bathroom was also small - no tub. I think I am comparing it to my last stay at the Trump Hotel In Chicago which was WOW! No time for the spa so can't say. On busy street (noisy even early Sunday morning) so stay on an upper floor.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Dana! Absolutely Perfect Choice!”
Reviews.Author: jondrama
Reviews.Content: I searched and searched for a non-mega chain with modern flare and finally decided on Dana Hotel and Spa Chicago for my business trip. WOW! I loved it! It was absolutely perfect! Everyone was incredible friendly from as soon as I walked in, greeted with a smile and a sincere upbeat welcome! I had found a great deal on Kayak for their Cozy King room. However when I arrived they let me see the Cozy King and the Corner King. You MUST go for the Corner King!!! I paid a little more to upgrade but WOW was it worth it. I would actually say my only negative to Dana is that the Cozy King, although it does have a balcony, is DARK and very small! If I had stayed in the Cozy King I would not be leaving such high reviews. I honestly couldn't stay in the Cozy King. 1 window which leads onto a standing balcony, BOOO! Now the Corner King was something entirely different...wrap around floor to ceiling windows, gorgeous bathroom with the most amazing rain shower!!! Seriously I was in Chicago Thursday Afternoon -Sat Afternoon, I must have taken 7-8 showers!! IT WAS THAT GOOD!!!! and very sexy with glass divider separating the shower from the bedroom and a curtain which could be drawn for private and pulled back for... well... uh... anyway. All the modern fixtures really made the room very stylish. Fancy sound system for your Ipod, LCD screen against the window so you're always looking at your magnificent view, great for checking out all the fancy condos across the way. The Roof Top Bar Vertigo was great too. part out doors and part indoors with a modern fire pit outside and robes to keep you warm. A lot of fun to people watch. Tim the Concierge is GREAT! I told him I would write a rave review for him cause he was always so friendly and had lots of suggestions as to where to go and what to do. All in all I had an absolutely wonderful time at The Dana! It met and even surpassed my expectations and I can be a pretty rough critic.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: AllysonH61
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved the workers. The breakfast was superb. Great service. Love the conceirge. Very helpful. Our room was simple and pleasant. The shower was amazingl Love the products ****************** NEG: It is noisy due to needing to be insulated. However. Each room has a fix. a great iphone station. We were able to dock our cell phones and play our music during the day and sounds of the sea at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in an Awesome Location!!”
Reviews.Author: pjdelgado21
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Dana Hotel during a 3 day stay in Chicago, room rates were reasonable, and almost everything about the hotel was great. I would have to say the Pro's are the hotel's location, the quality of the service at the hotel and the rooms. Although on the small side, the rooms were of great quality and the bed was super comfortable. Room service was prompt and price for the room (weekend in late April) was the best for the surrounding area. Located in the heart of downtown, everything was either a cheap cab ride away or walking distance. Only Con would have to be the noise, this is no quiet place. Police sirens and noise from the hallway's inside the hotel were noticeable. I would not discourage someone from staying here based on that, but if peace and quiet is what your looking for then this is not for you. Overall great place and would DEF. stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: kbs12
Reviews.Content: I live in the Chicago area and purchased a coupon through We Give to Get to use at the Dana's spa. My husband I excitedly booked two appointments for Saturday and noted the four-hour cancellation policy when we did. Unfortunately, I did not notice that the coupon could not be used on the weekend until I printed it out two hours before our appointment. I quickly called the Spa, thinking that either a.) they would accept the coupon in good faith since I had made a genuine mistake, or b.) allow me to reschedule. Not only did they refuse to accept the coupon, but they called me back after I cancelled the appointment to inform me that I was being charged $100 in late fees! I nearly cried - I have now spent $90 on a coupon that I never want to use because the hotel was so rude to me, but I have also wasted $100 in late fees. I do understand it was my fault that I overlooked the small print, but in my experience, the hotel industry is much more accommodating. If the Dana is not supportive of We Give to Get, then it seems the underlying reason to work with We Give to Get, e.g. exposure/advertising and the appearance of a commitment to charity endeavors, has been defeated. As of now, I have a sour taste in my mouth about this hotel and will never recommend it to family and friends who travel to Chicago. Nor will I use its spa or other amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room..but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: time4go-away
Reviews.Content: We have stay mainly at the Westin on Michigan Ave in Chicago, but this time we decided to give Dana Hotel a try. Great location, rooms are very nice, clean and modern. On the down side: the lounge on the top floor was just that, a lounge. No bar you could sit at, only couches, and most of them had "reserved" signs, and all others were occupied. So we headed down to the bar on the ground floor, where we were charged $11 per glass of Bailey's which we thought was a bit steep. As for the sleeping, well the neighbors slammed their doors at all hours, and then decided to play loud music at night. This compounded with the street noise had us wishing we were at the Westin. So overall not much noise insulation in the walls or windows. Overall for $200 per night, you can find a better deal else where. But it was worth the try.

Reviews.Title: “They call this is a budget hotel, but it's only budget in bang-for-buck factor...”
Reviews.Author: andergtr
Reviews.Content: I am a member of Tablet Hotels' Plus program, and am always looking for cool independent boutique hotels that are more modern. I happened to be riding past the Dana one night in Chicago and saw what looked like a very spot, so I took note and was delighted to find it listed as a Tablet Plus hotel. (For those who don't know anything about Tablet, it's a program that allows you to get complimentary upgrades, late 4 p.m. checkout, etc. on hotels that are independent, more boutique/modern properties.) The Dana is labeled as a budget hotel on the Tablet site, but it's clearly not, except that you get a lotta bang for the buck. I was upgraded to some ridiculous corner suite that had floor-to-ceiling windows all around. The suite was probably 900 to 1000 sq .ft. and had a modern shower with a large rainforest head as well as a removable Waterpik-style one. All the bathroom products were top-notch (same ones that are used in the Borgata in Atlantic City, if that makes any difference), and the room was furnished in a very hip and modern decor. For couples, the shower and bathroom were visible from the bedroom, but you can pull a curtain for privacy. Unfortunately, the curtain is on the bedroom side, so if your partner is playful, you might find yourself being spied upon while sitting on the toilet. Cheeky, I guess... A nicely stocked wine refrigerator replaced the typically mundane mini-fridge, as well. Service at the hotel was good and unobtrusive, with check-in being one floor above street level. One hassle was that you had to use your room key to access the elevators, so you have to meet all guests downstairs in the lobby. The only other niggle is that the walls are thin, so it might be noisy if you're in a regular room. A suite is no issue...just close the bedroom door, and it's really quiet. I'd stay here again, but only if in a suite. There's a hip rooftop bar, and the steakhouse below, Ajasteak, is a Latin-themed steakhouse with some Asian influences, so there's some other reasons to visit the hotel even if you're not staying here.

Reviews.Title: “B-Day Celebration at the Dana”
Reviews.Author: gidget&rocky
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Dana for my wifes 50th B-day celebration. Booked the Traquil Suite. We arrived and the room was ready and proceeded upstairs. The check in was smooth and we recieved 2 coupons for breakfest. They wished my wife happy b-day at check-in but THAT was all. No free drink coupons up top in the very expensive bar, no bottle of wine...NOTHING. The room was nice but for $300 a night it shold be. Did it exceed our expecataions...NO. The bed was somewhat comfortable...but we found the room kind of "banged" up. The coffee table had very bad ding marks on it and it looked very dated. (like a party was held there and the furniture was invloved..) The most amazing thing was the bathroom...the shower was amazing..loved it. We can forgive all the downfalls..cuz this made the stay. We also have say the location was perfect. My son lives in downtown but this made it alot easier for all of us. We loved hte breakfest also. Service fantastic. They had a special that Sunday...Free Bloody Mary's...good thing cuz our bill w/out coupons would have been over $100...yep...over $100 for breakfest. (luckily w/ coupons it was more like $65 for 4) The staff was friendly and very helpful. I would give the Dana another shot but I doubt if it would be for a specail occasion as they don't really seem to give a darn amyway...even if it was mentioned during the reservation... oh well...a decent rating...anyway.

Reviews.Title: “oh no you guy's!”
Reviews.Author: tontito
Reviews.Content: Traveled around the world twice! Location amazing, noise level at night "way to loud to sleep" Heater and Air conditioner way to loud to sleep" I asked four other guests who agreed! Front desk Kennady was the best, the rest were mediocre at best. The concierge was very nice but lets face it we had a reservation at three places "the most hip in town" The name Dana pulled 0 weight! The lobby was not very inviting to sit and relax! Get a couch. There is comfort and style available. The parking crew were amazing and very helpful!! The spa had no men massage therapists and a women had to get me a locker four times and men were always in the locker room so I had to wait four time! Not very relaxing for anyone!

Reviews.Title: “great location and cool place”
Reviews.Author: Uli_Germany
Reviews.Content: absolutely loved staying at Dana Hotel & Spa, it is a rather small boutique hotel in great location within walking distance of all downtown attractions. Also good access to major roads. Restaurant is cool and good quality food, great breakfast too. Rooms are spacious with a large rain-shower and stunning downtown city view. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Fancy with a bang!”
Reviews.Author: Beentheredonethat86
Reviews.Content: When I mean bang, I do not mean a good thing. It was about 5 to 8 degrees that weekend, so heat in the room was essential. The problem was when we turned it on, it began making a loud banging noise. It started around 12:30 am. When I called down to the desk to ask someone to fix it, they were not very responsive and said they could move us instead. I really did not feel like packing up and moving at 1am. So we ruffed it out and got little sleep, not good!! We did enjoy the upstairs bar and breakfast coupons in the morning. I really do expect more from boutique hotels, pretty sure we are "done with the Dana!"

Reviews.Title: “Very good but not quite perfect”
Reviews.Author: rjgibb
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a serene king room in late February. The room was great, impressed with floor to ceiling windows, the B&W iPod dock and the spa-style bathroom. The hotel is in a great location, just two blocks back from Michigan Avenue, pretty much mid-way between the river and the lake shore. Everything is walkable - even in February we walked to the Museum campus and the Willis (Sears) Tower. We both made use of the spa and had no complaints at all with the service or treatments we received. We only went up to the Vertigo bar once, in the early evening, but it looked a great spot and am sure it's a fun and lively place to hang out later on. Had a couple of breakfasts in the ground floor restaurant which, warm, cosy, laid back and relaxing. Food was perefctly fine, no desperate need to go elsewhere but you're within a block or two of some great alternatives. Really only a couple of gripes with the hotel - our bathroom door didn't shut too well and would occassionally slide open on its own. The aircon was a little loud at night but maybe we were just sleeping lightly on account of jet lag and the bed was a little too soft for my tastes. Oh, and don't expect a fully-equipped fitness centre. But generally these did not detract from our stay at all and would definietly recommend it to friends/family who may travel to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “If you're in Chicago, stay at the Dana!”
Reviews.Author: hendricksgt
Reviews.Content: For the past couple of years, my job has taken me all over the world and I have been able to stay at some of the best hotels on the globe. In Chicago, I finally had to pay for a hotel myself and spent some time researching suitable places to stay. The Dana offered what seemed to be reasonable pricing for a very nice hotel; my expectations were quite high, but what I found at the Dana went far beyond any of them! What a great place! The staff is mostly young and very nice, helpful, going out of their way to help with whatever a guest needs. The attention to detail is amazing; so many little things are sure to put a smile on your face during your stay. This ranges from fortune cookies on your pillows to extremely fast and absolutely delicious room service to a great menu in the restaurant. The Dana has very original and unique decorations for different occasions. During my stay, Valentineâ€™s Day and Chinese New Year were the cause for a special menu and very tempting special offers (one of them being a bottle of Dom Perignon for $99!!). The rooms are very modern, perfectly clean, and my Cosy King room came with a breathtaking view of the buildings around the Dana. Checking in, I was asked about room preference and I inquired about a room as high up as possible; I was accommodated on the 22nd floor. In addition to the incredible staff and the wonderful architecture of the building, the Dana also offers a fantastic Asian restaurant as well as a very fancy rooftop bar, including a terrace. When I asked for ideas for a date with a very special lady, the staff went far beyond my wildest expectations, setting up the perfect night: - For starters, a table in their fancy rooftop bar, including champagne by the fire on the terrace (in February...they gave us furry blankets to keep warm) - A fantastic dinner in the restaurant with a bottle of bubbly sake (delicious!!) and plates of Asian food we could share - The best staff in the world who all knew our story and could not have been nicer â€“ my special lady felt like she was a celebrity. It was simply a night that I will never forget and be forever grateful for! Thanks to everyone at the Dana!! My 10-day stay would have been amazing without that perfect last night, but this just really put you over the top! Unfortunately, I never got to try the spa, but I hear itâ€™s great as well. I appreciated the free wireless internet connection, the large selection of beers and liquors in the bar (e.g. Hendrickâ€™s Ginâ€¦have it with Tonic, a slice of cucumber, and some black pepper) and, I have to say this again, the friendly staff! I was always proud to tell the taxi driver to drop me off at the Dana.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: RobstersDads
Reviews.Content: We had three nights here as part of our big gay honeymoon road trip across the States. Itâ€™s a fabulous hotel with fabulous staff and fabulous roomsâ€¦ both the ones we were given! Our first room was a huge corner roomâ€¦ spectacular views and all mod cons. Howeverâ€¦ within minutes of settling in we realised we could hear every word being spoken in the next roomâ€¦ and presumably they would hear every word and sound coming from ours, not good for a honeymoon! A bit of detective work revealed small gap in the dividing wall by the window. A call down to reception brought hotel security up to see us. After we explained that the noise from next door was not because of some wild party going on but because there was a hole in the wall they could not be more apologetic. The upshot was we were upgraded to a suite on an upper floorâ€¦ â€œRESULTâ€� as they say! See our video for more details The hotel couldnâ€™t have been more apologetic and took the trouble to email us on our return home to thank us for letting them know about the problem and to tell us they had now had the builders in and fixed it! (nor could they understand why no one else had complained before). Of all the hotels we stayed in on our road trip, this was one of the top 3 and Chicago was our favourite city.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Floors, holes in sheets, shower doors not sealed, lights and tv did nto work properly.”
Reviews.Author: mediaqueen4
Reviews.Content: As I walked up the wood stairs from the ground floor entrance to the lobby I noticed the wood floors were dusty and dirty. For example, one thing was a small smushed tomato that was dried and stuck to a step, and it was still there the next afternoon when I left. While I waited to check in, I looked around at the wood floors in the lobby and they looked like they had not been cleaned in a long time. The area rug appeared to be faded, stained and not vacuumed - and it was only 10:15 in the morning. Late that night, when I pulled back the covers of the bed to go to sleep, there were three quarter sized holes in the cover sheet. Right below the pillows and very visible. How could any housekeeping staff make this bed and not see the holes? I was tired and it was late so I just went to sleep. The next day when I checked out I mentioned the holes to the staff person. She apologized but was chilly in her demeanor. No offer of any type of compensation. Maybe she isn't authorized to do so, but then I expect management of a hotel to follow-up in a timely manner with a guest after something as bad as holes in bed sheets. 4 days later and I have not been contacted. The shower door did not close properly, I tried a few times to line it up. As a result, there was a flood on the floor of the bathroom after my shower. Even after putting the bathroom rug and towels down. It did not just leak a little. The rest of my room was average at best. The light on the desk did not work and the volume control to the television was wacky - I would turn it down and then if I pressed mute and then turned back on it would go up really loud and blast out sound. The experience inside my room was annoying in too many ways for me. The only positive impression during my staty was the doormen - were super friendly and helpful. I travel to Chicago on business fairly often and wanted to try the Dana after reading positive comments here on tripadvisor. I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “an unbelievably relaxing trip with a perfect eye into life in chicago”
Reviews.Author: magglio45
Reviews.Content: The staff at Dana Hotel is definitely the best part of our experience. They always remembered us, were incredibly helpful and extremely friendly. We had lunch and breakfast at the hotel rest. the food was delicious and the service was great. We also had drinks at the roof level bar. Spectacular views and a vibrant crowd. The rooms were also amazing. Very modern... especially loved the rain shower and the clear window that gives you a view of the room while showering. Also the floor to ceiling windows make the room seem endless and gives you a glimpse into chicago life ... literally. You can see into all the neighboring high rises which really does make you feel like a part of everyday chicago. It is only a few blocks from michigan ave which even in January wasnt a bad walk. We got a great deal on our room since it was january so we were very pleased from check in to check out

Reviews.Title: “Perfect: staff, service, food, design - a healthy golden mean of all”
Reviews.Author: Wyke8
Reviews.Content: Dinner and cocktails at Aja restaurant at The Dana - a very 'metropolitan city' feel, with loft-type space and textured layers to the decor. The service, not only easy-on-the-eyes but sterling, gracious, polished. The food a delicious 'party in the mouth' of eastern flavors - recommending the crab rangoon and Suzuki sea bass at dinner... Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Swanky!”
Reviews.Author: MattandMary
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel! The room we stayed in was was very comfortable and well appointed. The floor to ceiling windows are amazing and provide terrific views of the city. The Dana has a perfect location with lots of shopping, restaurants and bars within walking distance. Very chic and modern, perfect for a weekend in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the casual traveler”
Reviews.Author: Jnk100700
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dana for a week in January. The Dana is a modern, boutique hotel so, as expected, the rooms were on the small size. The lack of a dresser and limited desk space makes this a less favorable choice for the business traveler but the central location and ambiance makes this a great one for the casual traveler. We were on the 25th floor with great views of the city. The room was spotless. Bathroom had a rainshower waterhead and vessel sink. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast in the on-site restaurant was very good although a bit pricey. Security at the hotel is excellent. There was no access to the rooms from the ground floor and the room key was required to work the elevators. An in-room safe and free wi-fi were also provided. The location is great. Steps away from public transportation and many great restaurants within actual walking distance. Try Quartino 2 doors down for great, homemade Italian and limoncella.

Reviews.Title: “Urban Chic Family Get-away!”
Reviews.Author: lauren21dyer
Reviews.Content: This modern upscale boutique hotel is fabulous. Aside from the clean up-to-the moment design lines and meticulous maintained rooms, the real gems of the hotel are the staff! Everyone we encountered was friendly, accomodating, and gracious to not only me but to my young children as well. The service and food quality in the ajoined steakhouse is far above other hotels. The spa is absolutley a treat not to miss! I would most certainly reccommend this hotel to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Very modern and classy hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: letyoursoulglo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights over Christmas. Got a fantastic deal on the internet - make sure you check all the websites. This hotel is very sleek and modern and includes extras that you don't normally see in this price range - bathrobes and slippers, HBO, a balcony, top quality restaurant and rooftop bar, great toiletries and bathroom extras (magnified mirror, double shower heads, facial wipes), great in-room coffee with half and half (instead of powder creamer - a big plus, I hate that stuff!) and a really comfy bed. Wi-fi also included free. Service quite good - the service staff are a dash snooty, but helpful. Conceirge very helpful, too and available longer hours than normal. Christmas service was not lacking - they had full staff working and the restaurant offered snacks instead of fully closing. The rooftop bar wasn't bad, with some limited cocktails and drinks but a great outdoor area - shame we can't enjoy it in winter! It would be very cool in summer. The hotel had a nightly turndown service which we didn't request - they just did it. They would also lay fortune cookies on the pillow, and come past with ice. This kind of housekeeping you never see, which was great. The door staff were also nice and welcoming. The location is North State st - a walk to Michigan Ave and everything downtown Chicago has to offer. Only major minus - housekeeping knock every day at precisely 8am - very early! Pop your privacy sign on the door to avoid this. Definitely worth a stay at this classy joint.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Chic”
Reviews.Author: hotelveteran
Reviews.Content: We go to Chicago a couple of times a year - but this is the first time to stay at The Dana. We really enjoyed our stay there. The staff was friendly, starting with the valet and then everyone else we encountered was as well. The rooms were chic and well appointed - flat screen TV and a dock for our Ipods. We travelled with 2 teenage girls who thought that the place was "cool" and we also enjoyed leaving them in the room and enjoying the rooftop lounge! We would definitely stay there again! Great place for a surprisingly great rate!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Njhammers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over NYE. The location is great very close to Michigan Ave, surrounded by some superb Restaurants & close to all attractions. The hotel itself is lovely, the decor hardwood floors, concrete beams, very loft like, we had a corner room with floor to ceiling glass on both sides, awesome!!! The bathroom is great, i loved the rain-shower & the toiletries are off a very high standard. Service is good. The only reason i didn't give 5 stars is because one day after calling down for my car we waited 30 mins (They said the didn't get the message from the front desk) & at check out they added honor bar costs we didn't have. The Gym is very good, we tried to book the spa but it was full & we didn't eat her due to the fact that so may good choices are on your doorstep We would return here again, i would suggest try your best & book a corner room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay At A Great Price!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Indtraveler44
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at The Dana Hotel and Spa for our annual Christmas weekend in Chicago. This is one of the best hotels we have chosen yet. The rooms are very modern with all the amenities that you could ever want or need. The room was a little small, but clean and nicely decorated. The views of the city from the floor to ceiling windows are an added bonus. There is a balcony too, which would be great in the warmer weather. The refridgerator loaded with wine, pop, beer and water. The cost of these items are very reasonable. We were given complementary breakfast which is served in the restaurant. The breakfast is excellent with many choices. There is a great rooftop bar which includes indoor and outdoor seating. The location is within walking distance to Macy's, Magnificent Mile, restaurants and Daley Plaza. The cost was only $152.00 a night!!! What a bargain for such a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique”
Reviews.Author: jack783
Reviews.Content: Run, do not walk, to the Dana Hotel if you have a chance to stay there. For $110/nite including a $15 breakfast voucher, this was the deal of the century. The Dana is a boutique reminiscent of the W chain, but I felt better appointed. The room is a tad small, but well decorated. The room is too small for a sitting area but there was a wall of windows with a balcony, so I didn't feel cramped. Everything is modern and new including the large LCD TV, Bang & Olufsen iPOD player, and so on. Free wifi and wired internet. I didn't try the spa but the gym nextdoor was very nice; see photo. Excellent breakfast the next morning. Great service all around, from the doorman to the receptionist. All in all, a fantastic stay and I would return, especially at this price.

Reviews.Title: “Dana is spectacular! Great location, five star rooms, and fab service”
Reviews.Author: teferet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Dana with 2 little kids (7 and 5 years) in a two-room suite with a Queen bed in one room and a pull-out sofa bed in the other. Both rooms had their own TVs, free WIFI, and there was also a bar area. The beds were comfortable with crisp white sheets and extra large pillows. Our kids esp. enjoyed the shower which was a room in itself with benches, various shower heads, and romantic lighting. They also gave us coupon vouchers for breakfast and the meal was incredibly fresh, tasty, and yet reasonably priced -- from fresh squeezed juices, steel-cut oats, freshly baked cornbread, and berries. The location is just a few blocks from the Mag Mile shopping and has tons of restaurants, cafes, and boutiques steps away. Overall, Dana is a gem in the city of Chicago and I would give it an A+

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Top Value”
Reviews.Author: ChoosySuzie
Reviews.Content: Fun, modern, new hotel in the midst of Upper Michegan Ave boutiques, shops & restaurants. Large rooms with floor to ceiling windows provide great views of the Chicago skyline. Bathrooms have large walk-in showers with rainheads. I was impressed with the staff from bell, to check in, to the friendly concierge staff. Great value since there was a 25% off sale on rooms & got free breakfast for booking directly.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Linens and Views”
Reviews.Author: Johnbe
Reviews.Content: Love love love this hotel. Chic and clean, great showers and the most comfortable beds I've stayed in since the Bellagio in Vegas. Great prices and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time, Beautiful Location”
Reviews.Author: WestMichEng
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon. We wanted a comfortable luxury hotel that was close to the Mag. Mile. We were able to get a Corner King on the 21st floor. It was a great view. The pluses -Amazing bed -The shower was very lavish -Hotel staff were very helpful -Breakfast (free if you make your reservations online) was delicious and very filling -Location (near Mag Mile with a Whole Foods around the corner for easy snacks) -MP3 docking station was a nice add on -The gym was sufficient for a quick workout -The Spa was helpful and my massage felt wonderful after alot of walking around Chicago and my wife enjoyed her manicure and facial. Minuses -The second floor entrance was a slight problem but nothing that you can't handle -The ceilings were much to look at -The Spa prices were higher than we were used to but seemed to be inline with downtown Chicago. So as you can see I don't have alot of negative things to say about Dana. The service was great, the view was wonderful and the amenities were lavish. I would recommend this hotel to young couples or hip familes visiting Chicago for leisure

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: yirgajeff
Reviews.Content: The Dana was an excellent hotel in the heart of downtown Chicago. Ultra modern styling with a personalized and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: JRD90
Reviews.Content: We booked through travelocity and paid $130 a night including breakfast. The rooms are small and modern. Bed very comfortable. Close to everything. Bar on top floor, restaurant in lobby, both good. Staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience and First Class Staff”
Reviews.Author: RonOAustin_Texas
Reviews.Content: After checking Trip Advisor and seeing the pictures of the Dana Hotel, we booked a room knowing it would be close to the Magnificent Mile and friends who were also visting Chicago. You could not have asked for a better experience! The rate was great and it included a wonderful breakfast. The location was ideal to everything we wanted to do. The spacious and hip room was on the 18th floor with a terrific view. The see-through shower into the bedroom and for all the world to see was a cool addition and a good talker with our friends who visited us. (We amde sure to take pictures but they can't be posted here.) The bed and plllows were extremely comfortable and simply the best we've ever had in a hotel. The room was also very quiet which provided for a great night's sleep. We went up to the Vertigo Bar and Club on the top floor and that was fun. It's one of the hottest night spots in town. The entire hotel is very contemporary and very pleasing to the eye. Very well designed and it added to our whole experience in Chicago. And that brings us to the staff. They couldn't have been more helpful. Jeff, Romeo and Lindsey offered us some of the best suggestions on places to eat and visit. Our first night, we wanted romance and Jeff made reservations for us at nearby "Devon." We arrived to a posh restaurant and were given a private room overlooking the rest of the restaurant and tables. The food and service was incredible and it didn't take a huge chuck out of my wallet. All the other helpful suggestions from the Dana staff were right on. On our last night we wanted to hear some jazz.. Jeff recommended the Green Mill, an old nightclub that Al Capone used to frequent. To my surprise, one of my favorite jazz artists was performing that night. We went to see Patricia Barber and had the table right in front of her piano. Talk about an incredible last night in Chicago. There are many hotels in Chicago to choose from and experience. But our time at the Dana was so much fun, when we go back to Chicago, we're staying there again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Excellent location & helpful Staff,”
Reviews.Author: monty339
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dana in Sept, on our way home to NZ after 5 weeks of travelling around Canada. It was the perfect place to unwind for 3 days. Very helpful staff, lots of good restaurants nearby and within walking distance of the magnificent mile. We were on the 19th floor with a balcony with great views over the city. The room was a good size with a fantastic shower, and very clean. Even the ongoing noise from the police, fire engines and ambulances drifting up from the street was'nt too bad. Also very impressed with Quartino, a Italian restaurant, one block away, recommended by the concierge. She also gave us some discount coupons to use there. Very good food. The breakfast downstains was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Great Views...and Good Food - comes slowley”
Reviews.Author: LindySez
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located. That's been said. And yes, there is some street noise, although I didn't get much hallway noise. But I haven't been to a hotel yet, in a big city, that didn't have some noise. That said; check-in was efficient and easy. The bags were taken to our room while we went into the bar to pay for a very overpriced drink. I mean, we ordered an Irish coffee and got charged $5.00 for the cup of coffee and then $6.00 for the shot...anyway...it is a hotel bar. Up to the room, nicely appointed. The bathroom is large with a beautiful shower (we were in a double queen room - our shower had only one head, our friends were in a Comfort King room - they had like water coming from every direction) - nice comfy robes to wear too. The hair-dryer was feeble...but eventually did the job. The biggest problem with the hotel is the inconsistency. The first night the maid turned down the beds and pulled the shades, but neglected to pull the blackout shades; an important feature when you are in an east facing room...and we didn't know to do it ourselves. The second night, they were pulled, but the maid threw the pillows on the chair next to them so there was a nice crack for that sun to peek through, right into my friends eyes. A nice touch is that they give you coupons for a made to order breakfast in their downstairs restaurant - valued at $15.00. So in the morning we went downstairs for breakfast...it was busy...we waited...once we sat...we waited...and waited...can someone PLEASE bring us some coffee???? Oh, sure...we waited...and waited...can we say, the service was slow? Yes, yes we can. The food was mostly good; again a couple of missteps and inconstancies; I assume the kitchen makes their poached eggs in advance, using the method of putting the egg into an ice bath to hold it until service and then putting it into hot water to warm and finish cooking; it's an important step, that putting it back into hot water; when it's not done, the egg is a cold as ice. As was the eggs on my friend's Eggs Benedict. However, the poached eggs on my other friends plate were hot. The second morning was no better than the first on service...it was slow, and worse, it's like they are ignoring you. They don't even make eye contact. That morning I ordered the Biscuits and Gravy...let me say this...clearly...DON'T...it's not Biscuits and Gravy, it's a biscuit in some white stuff with some slices of sausage and mushrooms...that's just not right. I do want to give a shout out to TJ and the guy with the Tats, (sorry can't remember your name) you guys were great! LindySez: It's a nice place to stay, central to many sites, comfortable, and the food is good...just don't expect it any time soon.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home - fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: SigKap27
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago to run the marathon and needed a place that offered a peaceful, relaxing room to help calm my marathon nerves and the Dana was perfect. I had a corner room with two walls of floor to ceiling windows and often times I would get lost just looking out into the city. Other times, I melted into the oh-so-comfy bed and let the stress flow away from me. The modern, urban decor of the hotel actally allowed me to forget I was in hotel and it was more like a home away from home. I'm not such a great writer so all the postiive things other reviewers have said....I'll just ditto those comments. The staff was great. My check-in took all of 90 seconds. My check-out less. The concierge was quick with restaurant suggestions that were perfect. The hotel was even kind enough to have coffee, bottled water, bananas, bagels, etc. for guest marathoners on race morning. What a nice, unexpected, very thoughtful treat. Suffice to say, I'll be back at the Dana anytime I return to Chicago - and that's as often as I can. Great city. Fantastic hotel. Couldn't have asked for better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect -- they did everything right”
Reviews.Author: SeattleJC
Reviews.Content: Attended a small conference at the hotel and stayed there for three nights (extended for long weekend of sightseeing after the conference). My colleague and I were in total agreement that this was a stellar hotel experience -- on the flight home we tried as hard as we could to find something to criticize and couldn't come up with a single thing! The modern design of the building was wonderful (new construction) and the interior design very contemporary but classy -- just the style we both like. My room was a huge suite with great decor, a huge bathroom with gigantic walk-in double shower and two balconies. The make or break with any hotel room really is the bed and this one was fantastically comfortable with beautiful fine linens. You know, so many hotels have a trendy design aesthetic and decent beds, but what really made this experience supreme was the staff -- they were all young but on their game. Everyone from the clerks at check-in to the room service attendee, to the waiters in the restaurant, to the concierge, to the doormen, to the manicurist, they all just had that special something: a friendly quiet confidence in their manner that made you feel comfortable and taken care of. Bravo to them and the manager who knows how to hire for keepers. Bravo to all! I would stay here again without a moment of hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Argh, elevators of doom!”
Reviews.Author: SB-TripAd
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location - very central. Our corner room had 2 walls of floor to ceiling windows and an unpainted concrete ceiling. We really loved the modern decor and it felt very spacious, but maybe that was because of the corner location. We were very happy with the amenities in the room - fantastically comfortable bed, wonderful (huge) shower, coffee maker, safe. The inclusion of a Zeppelin mp3 player is impressive, even if we didn't use it. Our deal included $15 breakfast vouchers. We enjoyed the breakfasts, but without those vouchers, we probably would have taken breakfast elsewhere, as it's a bit pricey. The check-in machines located in the lobby enabled us to print out our boarding passes for the flight home. Awesome. Very impressed with these! Cons: The elevators. I know this sounds ridiculous, but they are the single worst thing about this hotel. The elevators shot past our floor on a regular basis, as we weren't fast enough on the trigger with our key cards. What's the point of every guest having to insert their card to select their floor when, if they were really intent on causing mayhem on a floor where they don't belong, they could just walk up or down the stair shaft to another floor anyway?! Hotel management seriously need to ditch the card system - it's infuriating. We met a disabled guest with a walking aid, riding up and down the elevator for ages, trying in vain to reach his floor. Finding a way to enter the rooftop bar was rather a quest, as you cannot go there directly from the guest elevators. You have to go via security, even to be allowed in to the special elevator up to the bar. In any other hotel with a rooftop bar, I'd have been up there several times, maybe even in the daytime, checking out the view. Not a chance with this one. When we did finally make it up there, all the areas near the windows were sectioned off for private parties anyway. It felt like they're actively trying to discourage guests from drinking in the rooftop bar. There was no information in the room re. the location of the spa. All of this creates a general feeling of "We're too cool to tell you where anything is", which is a bit tiresome.

Reviews.Title: “There is no better than the Dana Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mike3
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had the pleasure of staying at the Dana Hotel and Spa for five nights from October 1st to October 6th. It is quite possibly the best hotel stay I have ever had in the entire world (and we have traveled extensively). The check in could not have gone easier. We were even allowed to check in a bit early... which is a no-no at many hotels. The room itself is absolutey gorgeous. We stayed in a king room. Most rooms face State Street except for the ones with a balcony. The room is absolutely gorgeous! The floors were beautiful. The bed was extremely comfortable. We absolutely loved the decor. We actually liked the exposed unfinished concrete ceilings. The bathroom is a work of art in itself. The mirror's border lit up from the inside. The shower's glass wall faced the room (of course there was a curtain). The rain showerhead in the bathroom was a beautiful touch. The mini-bar's prices were reasonable.
