We absolutely loved the iPod docking station and the free WI-FI and ethernet connection in the room. I liked the extra touch of turn down service in the evening. Overall, the Dana is a hotel that I am looking forward to visiting again when we return to Chicago. I would also like to send a special "thank you" to Tim Anderson, the concierge manager who delivered a bottle of champagne to my room because he knew that I was there celebrating my 40th birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: texas14
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Chicago for the first time. There are so many hotels to choose from, so I didnt know where to begin. I looked at the W Hotel, but the rates were very high. I saw the Dana Hotel and decided to give it a try. I was very pleased with this hotel. It is very trendy and modern. The location is very good--short walking distance to Michigan Avenue. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I think this is a great hotel. The rates seemed to be very reasonable for a hotel in Chicago in a great location. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, comfortable hotel with good food and rooftop bar.”
Reviews.Author: ckredell
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my brother's wedding weekend in August and was very pleased with the accomodations. The price was great for the Loop and the room was really nice - very comfortable beds and great shower. Note: the shower is visible from the bedroom, though there is a curtain to block the view. Just kind of weird. The restaurant had good food, though the service was really slow. And the rooftop bar had friendly staff and a great band. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: mljc68
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Dana for 3 nights in late September. From the moment we got there, the service was fantastic. Doormen were welcoming and friendly, and Tim the concierge manager was amazing. We had a Corner King room and even though it wasn't huge, it was extremely comfortable and stylish. Breakfast was included in our room rate and instead of the usual, lame continental breakfast, it was a $15pp credit at the restaurant. Needless to say, each day started off with a fantastic breakfast. The rooftop lounge was pretty cool, not too busy when we were there and ideal for late afternoon drinks. We just loved this hotel because of location, service and everything else. This was my fourth time in Chicago, each time at a different hotel, and this was definitely my favorite. Will be staying there from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Dana!”
Reviews.Author: ChocAHolic10
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights at the Dana with my friend and we absolutely loved it. Location - Close to the subway/transit but easy enough to walk pretty much anywhere if you have the time and energy to do it. We purchased 72 hour transit passes for $14 and they were well worth it. Rooms - We had a Comfy King, so it was a bit small, but this did not in any way negatively impact our stay. We had a small balcony overlooking State Street , which was great and the entire balcony consisted of huge windows. The decor was ultra-modern, which is very much our style. If you don't like modern you won't like this room. The room had a large flat screen TV, a great sound system and a single serve coffee maker which made great coffee. There was a well stocked honour bar which I thought was quite reasonably priced. Bedding and linens were top-notch. The glass walled shower (which can be visible to the sleeping area if you want - we always had the curtain drawn) and vanity area were beautiful. Turn down service was provided and on 2 of the three nights, chocolate covered fortune cookies were left on the bed. Thick robes and slippers are provided for your use. Staff - Staff were wonderful - particularly the doormen who were always ready to help out. When you check in your luggage is taken and delivered to your room as the actual check in desk is on the second floor. The bellman offered some great tips on Chicago . All the staff were extremely helpful and courteous. Dining - We only ate breakfast at the hotel. $15 vouchers are provided for each morning of your stay, for each person. I found the prices to be very reasonable and between the 2 of us, we never exceeded the $30. Free coffee was available at the lobby bar so that helped lessen the breakfast bill. I usually had a coffee (or 2) in my room as soon as I woke up. As one other poster mentioned, the pancakes are too large, but they made for a great picture. I had the grilled PB&J, which was very nice, and a fresh fruit smoothie and toast. I always found it to be more than enough food. My friend usually had some type of egg dish and was always happy with her meal. Facilities - We didn't use the spa, but checked out the gym. It is on the small side, but had several cardio machines and free weights. I would definitely stay here again. And I also noticed there were several young families staying at the hotel. I also wouldn't hesitate to bring the rest of my family here. I found the best price booking directly with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place!!”
Reviews.Author: hduckett
Reviews.Content: I came to Chicago for a girls weekend, and was pleasantly surprised by the Dana. From the moment we walked up to the hotel all of the staff was more than helpfull! The rooms are kinda of small but the atmosphere more than makes up for it. If you have any problems finding your way around Chicago, or just want an opinion on where to eat, ask TJ he is one of the doorman there. He may have been the friendliest and most helpful one of them all. I will not stay at another hotel in Chicago from now on!!! The beds were AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanDiva
Reviews.Content: The Dana Hotel is a very trendy, well located hotel. Located only a few blocks away from the mag mile and only 2 blocks from the train! The front entrance is very plain and you need to take an elevator up to the very small lobby. The staff was fantastic! They were very polite and very accomodating. The doormen were awesome and very friendly! There were a few issues - when we booked our hotel it said it included a free continental breakfast. The first morning we asked about breakfast and were directed to the Aja restaurant. We were given a regular menu and paid for our breakfast. The next morning we asked again about the continental breakfast and were told that they had "discontinued" the continental breakfast but should have been given vouchers at the front desk for those who had booked with the free breakfast option. She gave us a voucher for breakfast that morning and compted us for the breakfast we had paid for the day before. All in all, huge points for excellent customer service. The breakfast at the hotel was okay. I found it quite heavy and greasy- and don't order the pancakes - they are the size of the table - as we noticed some other hotel guests had ordered and could barely eat half of it. The rooms were small but well appointed. there were robes and slippers - nice touch. And they have a real hairdryer that is not attached to the wall - huge bonus! Our room did not have a window but rather a small balcony. Cute. The noise from the hallway can be heard into the bedroom so we ended up stuffing a towel under the door every night. The Vertigo Lounge on the rooftop was nice. Busy on the Saturday night -had some pretty nice views of the city. Overall, it was a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: TravelNut48
Reviews.Content: We picked the Dana Hotel for an overnight Sunday stay because we wanted to be closer to the shopping areas, and support a boutique hotel. We foresake our typical choice of staying at the Stellar Burnham Hotel, for Dana. We found our stay disappointing. Perhaps it's the economy or the staff was too tired from the weekend revellers and didn't give much attention to those staying there on a Sunday night. We're not fussy travellers and don't need much apart from courteous, competent service. We didn't have that experience at the Dana. I'll highlight some of the good and bad points we experienced. -- Positives: Awesome bed. Comfortable room: we have an asian inspired, cotemporary waterfront condo and were pleased with the decor. --Negatives: Check-in staff seemed like they were trying to replicate a cool, youthful, aloof urban energy. It came off as apathetic. One got the feeling that they were doing this job until they went to their "real jobs" later on. Does this place really have a spa? Every time I have ever checked into a hotel that has a spa ... they at least tell you a little about it. This is true whether I have stayed at destination spa locations, or hotels where the spa is an amenity for a predominantly business clientele. -- Aja Steak: was pleased with the subbtle Hawaiian flair in the menu. Fish was good quality. I think we got left-over rice on our maki, because it was terrible. Service was lower than average. Perhaps we got the Sunday, C level staff. They were poorly trained ....and I almost felt like piping up " ummmm ...are there any adults running this place?" We have travelled internationally and stayed at numerous hotels. My basic rule is that if a place has an expensive, diverse selection of sakis and wines with limited descriptors; they should have someone on staff to discuss the selections. They didn't that night. Worse still, we had a flaky waitress who did not even seem to understand the qualitative distinctions between the food & drink selections on the menu. In an effort to be friendly/knowledgeable she tried to pipe in how did not know much about sakes ... but she loved the junmai daiginjo sakes. Her comment would have been acceptable if she knew what she was talking about (we are avid sake drinkers); but it's like someone who knows nothing about the varied construction & mechanisms in watches saying how they love the quality and mastery of how Cartier watches are built. Next time, we'll stick to the Burnham Hotel. Kimpton just gets how to do boutique hotels, and they have shown that prowess nationally and internationally. Besides, they are in the same price range as the Dana.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the experience.. few things to improve on.”
Reviews.Author: NYC_UpperWestsiders
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dana Hotel while on a business trip and was pleased with the stay. Hotel dÃ©cor is very modern. Some may like it, some wonâ€™t. I loved it. My room (23rd FL Serene King) was very comfortable, clean and I truly felt at home. What I liked: Detail, details, details. They definitely get kudos for keeping the needs of a traveler in mind. The bed, bedding, pillows and sheets were very soft and relaxing. I loved the hardwood floor. The bathroom shower has a glass wall that looks out to the room and has a rainfall showerhead. They have a real hair dryer in the bathroom, not the cheap ones attached to the wall of many hotels. (Ladies, you know what I mean.) Very nice spa quality toiletries, cotton balls, Q-tips, bath robes, slippers and extra towels. Mini bar is stocked very nicely along with a good selection of condiments: dried fruits, snacks, etc. My room also had an MP3 connection so I listened to my ipod in the room. Flat screen TV, coffee maker and a large desk allowing me much needed work space. I had dinner at the hotel restaurant ajasteak and was very pleased with the quality of food and service. Their prime beef carpaccio is one of the best Iâ€™ve had and the maki roll portions are very generous. After dinner, when I went back to my room, they had provided a turn-down service and left a couple of their chocolate dipped fortune cookies on the bed. Yum. Unfortunately, I didn't get a chance to check out vertigo sky lounge, but heard it was great . Areas needing improvements: For all the right they did, there were two things that I found very frustrating. First is the temperature of the room. I had the thermostat set to 60 in hopes of keeping the room cool! (I generally like the room temp in the low 70â€™s.) Despite lowering it, the room still got very warm at times. It almost felt like the AC had a mind of its own and worked great at times then stop working all together. Second, I was very excited to see the self check-in machines by the front desk thinking I can check-in with my airline and print the boarding pass early. Well, it recognized my flight itineraries but wouldnâ€™t print the boarding pass. Oh well. Overall, a great hotel with friendly staff. I would recommend this hotel and will stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SDS1London
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Good location. Very good rooms and friendly staff. Breakfast was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Eye candy, sexy night for a couple”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousBean
Reviews.Content: The interior design from the lobby to the room is really classy and modern. Front Desk staff was very friendly. Room was super clean and if you're looking for a sexy place to stay with your significant other, this is it. The bathroom shower shared a common wall with the bedroom...except it was glass, not a wall. There's a curtain you can pull if you want to but, who wants to? I wouldn't necessarily say that the view outside was too appetizing, as you can see straight across into the condos, so no good view of the city really.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: netheravon
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Dana for five nights to explore Chicago. Got upgraded from a Serene King to a Corner King. This means, I had two of the four walls with windows from floor to ceiling. Location is excellent as I could walk everywhere (approx. 25 minutes to Millenium Park, 10 min. to John Hancock Building - all along Michigan Avenue). Facilities of the hotel are excellent, the room is fully equipped with all mod-cons. The best was the view from the room - all around to the street below and the neighbouring buildings. Service was conscientious and always very friendly. There was no complimentary continental breakfast anymore, but I got USD 15.-- vouchers for breakfast - so I could chose what I liked. Wheater permitting, I could sit outside. There is some traffic noise from the streets below, which is normal in the midst of a big city. I can recommend the hotel if you want to stay in an unstuffy, friendly, modern and well-serviced place.

Reviews.Title: “Great value but far from perfect”
Reviews.Author: Barfly-guy
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed three nights at Dana from August 1 - 4. The hotel is very modern, perfectly located, clean and well priced. We managed to get it at $105 Cdn per night. Problems we encountered: The room was very small and dark. We were on the backside of the hotel and the window was only a patio door. Made the room depressing, but we did not spend much time in the room during the day. Room was also not well positioned. The TV was facing the side of the bed, rather than at the foot. As there was no sitting area, watching TV was difficult. Finally, the Dana advertised that a continental breakfast was included in the price. They cancelled the breakfast starting August 3rd but failed to tell anyone. Very misleading. The good part: The staff is very friendly. The concierge (Aleksandra) was extremely helpful and spot on with her restaurant recommendations. She even tried to make up for the cancelled breakfast by offering a complimentary bottle of wine from the room. By the way, the bar fridge selection in the room is good and well priced. Excellent Ipod speakers in the room. At this price, I would stay again, but get a room in the front of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary trip in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: CSLS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Dana Hotel for our anniversary weekend. It is a very hip hotel. It is set up for a younger crowd. I would not recommend staying here if you are older and have children. The location is perfect. It is close to Michigan Avenue but just enough away from it too. The staff was very accomodating and friendly. We stayed on the 25th floor which I would not recommend if you want to sleep. The club on the 26th floor plays loud music until early in the morning and you can hear it. My husband and I used the spa too. The massage therapists were wonderful! Recommend the couples harmony massages. The relaxation room needs more tranquility and comfortable chairs. The locker rooms were very nice with all the amenties that you need. The elevators were my only real complaint. They are slow and you have to use your room card to get it to work, which does not work most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Generally nice but lacks good service”
Reviews.Author: kmst2
Reviews.Content: Small, overcrowded reception area, snappy hostess upon reception telling us to go upstairs to check in (as if we were stupid not to know that), two separate very busy elevators needed to get to room, luggage was very late finding its way to the room (2 calls needed to hunt it down), internet that didn't work for 1 1/2 of our 3 days there, but worst of all was the very, very bad service at the restaurant: we got the feeling we were putting them out (way out!) by showing up and asking for our continental breakfast. For that alone, I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Weekend”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDad62
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Dana for our honeymoon, and it was, in her words "urban decadence". We loved the hotel itself, the food was incredible and the location is great for anyone visiting Chicago. We only wish we had more time there.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding! Had our annual client meeting here....terrific!”
Reviews.Author: NashGroup
Reviews.Content: We had 50 of our clients attend a two day meeting at the Dana Hotel. Most were from out of town so they booked a room. We had 100% positive client feedback! The meeting room was perfect, the food was wonderful and the service was impecable! We will book all client meetings at the Dana.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, straight forward boutique”
Reviews.Author: jhshin
Reviews.Content: Some people may find the rooms austere. I liked it - concrete ceilings, all glass exterior wall, dark furniture... The hotel offered a great list of features, iPod dock, large flatscreen, free internet, great office chairs, rain shower with another handheld wand, free continental breakfast for two (which was great because my colleague was staying at another hotel and the Dana let him join me for breakfast everyday). This is my new hotel of choice for a quick trip to Chi-town.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: julie h
Reviews.Content: loved the super soft bed. The view was spectacular, the staff was great. They have a complimentary continental breakfast that is a bowl of fresh fruit, youghurt, and croissants or scones, coffee in big saucer cups and juices. Free high speed wifi was an added bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Could've been great ... too bad it wasn't.”
Reviews.Author: Vulcan01
Reviews.Content: My wife, who just so happens to be named Dana, spent our first weekend alone since our first child was born eight weeks ago. I researched downtown Chicago hotels for weeks and finally decided on The Dana after reading so many wonderful reviews. I called the hotel about a week ahead of our arrival and asked them for three small requests. 1. We wanted a king bed. This certainly didnâ€™t seem like much to ask. It was just my wife and I, so that makes plenty of sense anyway. 2. We need a room with a refrigerator. Since my wife is breast feeding, she needed to keep the milk chilled for the weekend. 3. If possible, an upper level room with a view. Upon arriving at the Dana, we were greeted very pleasantly by the door staff and escorted to the front desk on the second floor. After a very short wait, we were quickly given our room card and headed up to our room. The room was the complete opposite of what we requested: Two double beds, no refrigerator and a 12th floor view of the side of a building. I immediately went back down to the desk and let them know we needed a new room and their response was basically â€œWeâ€™re booked, too badâ€�. When we explained we needed a refrigerator and we were already told by phone it wouldnâ€™t be a problem, their response was again â€œYour room doesnâ€™t come with a refrigerator, too bad.â€� Iâ€™ve never experienced a front desk that was so unhelpful. It wasnâ€™t exactly the way I wanted to start our weekend. Fortunately, the check-in was the lowlight of the trip. Despite the fact my wife and I slept in separate beds, had to make God knows how many trips to the ice machine (which is hidden in a closet on the fifth floor) and gazed out of our window into an office building, I slowly warmed up to The Dana and eventually left the hotel with a feeling that I might, just maybe, stay there once again. POSITIVES 1. Location. You canâ€™t beat staying right in the heart of downtown Chicago within walking distance of everything that makes this city so wonderful. Dining, shopping, beach, nightlife â€¦ You are right in the middle of all of it. 2. Vertigo. The hotel has one of the best rooftop lounges in Chicago. It was packed both nights we were there and the views from 27 stories above were fantastic. The drinks were great. The staff was helpful. Good crowd. Great place. 3. Shower. Itâ€™s a one-of-a-kind with a rain head spout from the ceiling and glass on both sides separating the bedroom and the bathroom. Itâ€™s about as nice of a hotel bathroom as youâ€™re going to find. 4. Complimentary breakfast. It was so nice to be able to walk downstairs and sit down and be served a perfectly, light meal. They brought a really good fruit bowl with the choice of pastry and quality coffee and juices. It was very simple and very good. 5. Door staff. The guys at the front door go out of their way to make you feel special. Any request was quickly answered and, unlike the front desk staff, they were very pleasant and genuine. NEGATIVES 1. Front desk. Iâ€™ve already covered it all with them. You would think a hotel would employ its most helpful workers for this position, not the opposite. The front desk staff was a joke. Completely clueless and just flat out insulting. 2. Elevator. This might sound like Iâ€™m being picky, but I canâ€™t tell you how many times I was in the elevator and another person was mumbling expletives as they battled with the elevator. In order to push the button of your floor, you have to very quickly insert your room card and then make your choice. This is much easier said than done because every single person on the elevator has to do it in order to select your floor. Itâ€™s almost like trying to feed a crumbled dollar bill into a vending machine under pressure. Itâ€™s incredibly annoying and if you donâ€™t do it quickly, you miss your floor and have to ride the elevator down to the lobby again. I appreciate the security, but I truly believe this is the hotelâ€™s way of trying to be hip and in turn just pissing a lot of people off. 3. Thin walls. I had the stereo playing at low volume and within minutes the hotel security was knocking. If you need to sleep, this isnâ€™t the hotel for you. 4. Trying too hard. This hotel desperately wants to be young and hip. Itâ€™s not young by any means and itâ€™s not really all that hip. This place is loaded with middle-agers (40-50 crowd) and all of their attempts at being cool kind of fall short. Example: To get into the rooftop club, you have to briefly stand behind a velvet rope even if the damn place is empty. I could probably give you 10 examples of stuff like that. The ceilings in the room are unfinished cement. Trendy or an eye sore? I definitely thought the latter. 5. Ice machine. Call and ask guest services where the ice machine is located. They will tell you itâ€™s on the fifth floor. If you can find it in less than 10 minutes, Iâ€™ll be impressed. There are a lot of things at this hotel where you just scratch your head and think, what the @#$% were they thinking?

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Camel122
Reviews.Content: It was a very nice hotel, the beds were great, and I loved the chocolate dipped fortune cookies that came with the turn-down service. Service staff was professional and courteous without being ingratiating. The continental breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, I'd stay there again”
Reviews.Author: topheavies
Reviews.Content: Didn't know much about this place until we got there, nice bar in the lobby and another on the rooftop, swanky atmosphere all around, but comfortable. Rooftop bar got packed at night with a nice looking crowd, there was a model show while we were there, lucky timing on our part. Staff was excellent and extremely helpful with a couple reservation hiccups, I booked through a third party name your price site and it got a little screwy, but since I had my confirmation numbers everything was sorted out quickly. Definitely more of a place for couples but we were there for a bachelor party and no one seemed to mind either way. Good location, and price, I'd recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “New, fresh, and good location”
Reviews.Author: stellamystar
Reviews.Content: very modern with reasonable pricing! PLUS, you get a cont. breakfast with Julius Meinl coffee, free wireless,...all very nice. The gym is small but nice..the locker rooms have steam showers which are clean. Front desk and concierge were friendly! All in all, great experience.. rooms are not huge (but the tv was!)...so, good for couples or singles unless you upgrade to a suite... FYI - the see through shower is cool, but I would NOT stay in a room with just a friend or my parent..there is a curtain that you can pull, but it is a bit odd. VERY nice bath, though

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, upscale, and new. Great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: snyd3202
Reviews.Content: The hotel seems to be very new, probably opened in 2008. The design of the hotel, the rooms, and the attached restuarant and bar is very reminiscent of the W Hotels. Quite trendy, but very nice. The rooms featured partial hardwood floors and very nice furniture/fixtures/TV, etc. Floor to cieling windows with black-out shades. Would highly recommend. Free computers with internet access were very usefull.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: KMme
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and children at the end of May for a weekend sightseeing trip. The location is pretty good, just a couple of blocks from the Mag Mile. We walked to the Sears Tower and Navy Pier and Millennium Park, but it was a pretty long walk. We had a Tranquil Suite which was very nice. Housekeeping was excellent and everything was very clean. Checking in was a breeze. The continental breakfast was very high quality and service was very good. Overall, I could find no faults with this hotel other than it may be a little farther walk to sightseeing destinations than others. It was a nice place and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: beantown_illini
Reviews.Content: Had a great long weekend stay here. The rooms are modern and spacious, complete with hardwood floorsâ€”a nice alternative to grungy hotel carpet. But beware, theyâ€™re a bit slippery! And I wish theyâ€™d done the entire room in hardwoods; thereâ€™s carpet surrounding the bed. Speaking of the bed, itâ€™s quite possibly the most comfortable that Iâ€™ve ever slept in. Thereâ€™s also FREE wi-fi in the room, which is a big plus in my book. Didnâ€™t partake of the mini-bar but was pleasantly surprised to see how reasonable the prices were. Noise was a bit of an issue; our room was on the 8th floor, corner of Erie and State, and we heard quite a bit of street noise especially at night (or the occasional 3:30 a.m. brawlâ€¦). The only other complaint is the annoying elevator security system which was slightly tempermental. Our stay included a free continental breakfast which was pretty typical â€“ bagels, croissants, scones, cereal, fruit and yogurt. Loads of Starbucks nearby, too. Checked out the Vertigo Sky Lounge on the Friday night that we were there, before heading elsewhere. The view is great â€“ perfect for a nice spring/summer night. Itâ€™s a bit to â€œscene-yâ€� for my taste, especially with the silly velvet rope at the entrance. Donâ€™t think thatâ€™s necessary although there was a line to get in around 11 p.m. Drinks are pretty reasonably-priced, though, in my opinion. Location really canâ€™t be beat for checking out the city.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting but not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: Hello2World
Reviews.Content: Dana Hotel and Spa is very new and is oriented to tech-savvy people who like industrial chic design. The service is great. A good continental breakfast of fresh food is provided. As for the room, the flat screen TV, iPod dock, showerhead on the ceiling and especially the floor-to-ceiling windows are fun. The bed was a bit soft and I didn't like the exposed concrete walls and minimal lighting but these are matters of taste. Also there was traffic noise (on the 17th floor) and from the elevator which our room was near. A glass wall with just a curtain separates the bathroom/shower and the room. The staff leaves the curtain open and also raises the window shades when they make up the room so you have to remember to pull it closed when you return and use the bathroom. We stayed 4 days and I never figured out the TV menu or the elevator security system. Also, oddly, the free wireless internet had some problem with Yahoo - I was never able to check my email although most other websites worked fine. The location was great, I like the rooftop bar, and the 4th night free deal made it a good value since we were staying 4 nights. But I probably will choose more conventional lodging if I'm back in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value off the Mag Mile!”
Reviews.Author: sarah_klein
Reviews.Content: The location is right off the mag mile where there are lots of restaurants and bars for night life. The valet met us as the cab pulled up. The staff was all friendly-particularly the bellhops. We had a corner room and it rocked!! Very clean and the housekeeping was easily accessible for extra towels, etc. The consierge desk was extra helpful as we were trying to find a bar to play the Brewers/Cardinals game (not hard in Cubs town!). The only downfall was slow service at the bar. Breakfast service was prompt and friendly and it was nice to have a complimentary breakfast included in the stay. We didn't get room service but used the in room fridge and it was more than reasonable compared to other hotels in Chicago. We booked the 3 nights so we saved 25%. We have stayed at the Drake and Hard Rock (worst hotel stay in the city I've had) in the past, and while the view of the Drake over Lake Michigan was spectacular, the room at the Dana was much cleaner and newer and the valet staff had much more urgency at the Dana. This is an ideal hotel also if you are using public transportation around the city. Only 2 blocks from the redline which gets you all over the main stops in the city-or to jump onto other lines to get into the neighborhoods. We will for sure visit the Dana again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and stylish hotel in a great location, but perhaps too modern for some.”
Reviews.Author: LadyJulie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dana Hotel and Spa for 4 nights and had a great time. It's location is perfect for travel from the airport via the subway/El, and we walked to shopping, restaurants, bars, and tourist spots from there. The rooms are very modern and stylish, with a few design issues that might make some people uncomfortable. Our room had great ceiling to floor windows with sun shade panels and blackout panels behind those. Because each shade is a panel, you do have some space between each one, which allowed light to come through. If you need a completely dark room to sleep, you might have an issue. We heard some noise on Saturday night, and our room was right in front of the elevators, so we sometimes heard people getting on and off, but nothing was too disturbing. As far as the "famous" glass shower window, there is plenty of privacy with the curtain drawn. However, if someone uses the bathroom in the middle of the night, the light illuminates the rest of the bedroom. Perhaps a blackout shade there would be more appropriate. The shower enclosure only has small a glass wall, and the bathroom floor can get a bit wet as a result. The bed was very comfy. We really enjoyed the mini-bar selections and wine selections, and all had reasonable prices. We went up to the Vertigo Lounge for a little bit, and while we aren't clubby people, it had a good vibe and was very busy. The view is awesome, and there is a nice outdoor area. We enjoyed our stay and would certainly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: lagunadallas
Reviews.Content: A friend and I just finished a stay at the Dana and loved it! The location on State Street was ideal --- easy walk to Michigan Avenue, Lincoln Park, Gold Coast area, etc. Tons of restaurants, shopping, and bars within minutes on foot. Decor is sleek and contemporary, loved the fun shower that looks into the room (with a curtain), beds were incredibly comfortable with great sheets, wireless internet was reliable, and everything was pretty tasteful. The hotel's club has fantastic views, even if the staff's outfits were pretty trashy, and overall service was great. I'd say the staff is relatively young and inexperienced by Four Seasons standards, but they were efficient and helpful when needed. We didn't eat at the restaurant, but it was gorgeous. The only downsides for us were the poor sound insulation between rooms and the hallway, room a/c that never seemed to get cold enough, and having to take the elevator + stairs or 2 separate elevators each time you go from the room to street level (lobby is on the second floor). Overall I thought it was a fun, stylish, well-located property and an excellent value. We'd stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing...perfect Chicago hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: NYCgirl823
Reviews.Content: This place is breathtaking. We paid $119 plus tax a night and stayed for 5 nights, and it was a great experience. Our room was gorgeous and spacy. We stayed on the 19th floor and had a no balcony king. The layout was so unique and modern. The bathroom and shower was AMAZING, I could have stayed in there for hours! Customer service was 10/10. They helped with directions, we had leftover pizza and room service heated it up for u (ofcourse we tipped them). Rooms were clean and beautiful. There was a wierd celing design which makes it look dingy, but we realized this was the plan. This is THE MOST comfortable bed I have slept in in my LIFE! The only one minor complaint I had was that the AC only cooled so much and it could get a tad warm after showering.. We are people who like the room freezing cold, but it was still comfortable. Breakfast was decent. No eggs, waffles, but they had these delicious scones! The location is as good as it gets! Right near great restaruants, subway, the mag mile, and the Amtrak station. I would give this hotel a 10+/10. LOVED IT and hoped we get to come back real soon. if the rates are decent, this is the only hotel we would ever stay at in Chicago from now oN!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: notkevin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dana as a part of a group. One of the best chic hotels I have stayed at in a long time. The room was a little small but the layout makes up for it. Being a business traveller, I like having desk space and a sitting area and this room had both. the bed was very comfortable and I loved the linens. Made for a good nights sleep. The sirens outside and traffic noise doesn't normally bother me but having walked the downtown areas of Chicago, this would be a problem no matter where you stay. Folks.... check out the shower. I will return just for that. No regular hotel showers here. The pressure was perfect and the rainfall effect was amazing. The bathroom was big and made getting ready in the morning that much easier. The IPOD docking station was great. I have an Ipod touch and I could actually watch my videos on the TV. Easy to use and made my stay even better. Staff were good although some of my group complained that they were a little rude. I didn't experience that at all. The bar on the roof was a little upscale. the servers acted as if you were bothering them but it seemed like this was the atmosphere they want up there. If I go back to Chicago on business, I will go back, that's for sure

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous boutique hotel-perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Klbster
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Dana for the second time this past weekend and again had a wonderful time. The floor to ceiling windows are amazing overlooking the city. The staff is very friendly and very attentive. Had an initial problem with the wireless but they moved me a different (and better!) room and it was fine. Room service is great as are the beds and amenities. Highly recommend if you're planning a trip to the windy city!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Dana Hotel and Spa”
Reviews.Author: Summitpark
Reviews.Content: Last week, I stayed at the Dana Hotel for 5 nights and was absolutely delighted by the hotel, staff and surroundings. Letâ€™s start with the location which is 2-3 blocks from Michigan Ave and the heart of major shopping. On the other side of the spectrum, the hotel also has a Trader Joeâ€™s, Whole Foods and Walgreens within one block of the hotel which is great for snacks, meals on the go and anything else you may have left behind. My room was extremely spacious and had a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was huge with great amenities (larger than usual shampoo, conditioner etc.). Big fluffy towels too. It took me a couple of days to realize that my room was handicapped accessible â€“ which explained why there was no dividing ledge between the bathroom and shower, and a pull down bar next to the toilet. It also explained why the closet armoire was very low to the ground. However the room still appeared cozy and chic which is different from many handicap accessible rooms where Iâ€™ve stayed in the past. The hotel offered nightly turndown service with chocolate covered fortune cookies. The service included pulling down the shades and room darkeners which is key because there is a apartment building directly across with a direct view into your room. Be careful getting dressed because I could see everything that the apartment dwellers were doing, so Iâ€™m guessing that they could see me as well. My only complaint with the hotel is that the walls were extremely thin. I had a toddler and baby in the room next to me for my entire stay and believe me when I say that I heard every cry. Overall, it was a great stay and I would definitely return for a return visit. Free wireless internet and continental breakfast rocked! The staff went out of its way to please. Special kudos to TJ, at the bell desk, who always had a great attitude, even when it was freezing outside.

Reviews.Title: “Early problems resolved”
Reviews.Author: glented
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to the Dana having booked a room in the first few months of its opening. Any new hotel needs a few months to iron out early problems and they seem to have worked hard to achieve this. My room was immaculate, clean and well designed. Service was much better as was the food. The sky bar is very much the 'in' place. This was the first time I have stayed in the same Chicago Hotel and I am glad I did. Would be more than happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Super Cool Boutique”
Reviews.Author: SampleTheCulture
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night and also used the spa services. I got a deep tissue massage which was awesome, my wife got a facial. The place was very clean and the staff was pleasant and accommodating. The hotel itself is very hip, it has a real club feel. The first floor bar and second floor lobby have a good layout, great decoration and in the evening they are comfortably crowded with a nice atmosphere. The rooms are unique but very comfortable. Great view out the floor to ceiling window and you can tell that everything is new. Quick note on the shower â€“ it shares a wall/glass window with the room. The glass is covered with a curtain, but if you want to you can open the curtain from the room to have a full view of the shower in useâ€¦.pretty fun. Overall, this place is awesome and a great place for Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A Diamond in a sea of coal....”
Reviews.Author: TravelMickey
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Dana on the recommendation of a Chicago native and totally enjoyed the location, the staff and the hotel. I travel to Chicago several times a year and been trying to find a place this is not a huge faceless chain but not so small to miss good amenities in the area I need to be. In short, the Dana is the place. The staff is very attentive and pleasant and the modern dÃ©cor is nice to look at without sacrificing the needs of the business traveler. I had great views from the 18th floor with the balcony. A previous reviewer mentioned the small size of the balcony but I thought it was great place to just step outside, get some fresh air, enjoy the view and listen to the sounds of the church bells/song a few blocks away. The wine chiller/mini bar is great! The selection was good and the rates were reasonable for a full bottle of wine in your room. It was nice to be able to open and drink half and save the other half for the next night. As for the shower with the full glass into the bed area, it was a bit unnerving at first but I got over it when I realized there was both a hand-held shower head AND a rain shower above. The effective use of space and dual use of the bathroom/closet door was a great design element. Not to mention the great B&W stereo with the iPod/Phone dock. I did not realize until the second day you can get the television to play through the cool stereo for better sound. I was out of the hotel too early most days to enjoy the breakfast but my travel mate said it was very good and a bit above the usual â€œcontinentalâ€� breakfast fare. The only issue I had was rude and inconsiderate neighbors across the hall. The doors are solid but with a big gap at the bottom of the door that allowed the screaming/laughing/crying of the women across the hall to filter into the room. Understand, they felt the need to shout at each other when one was standing in their doorway on several occasions. I ended up stuffing the big fluffy bath mat into the gap and all was well. Not sure what their deal was but thankfully they left after a day or so and the rest of my stay was quiet. In the area there are plenty of big chain boring assembly line hotels to stay at greater cost than the Dana. If you want to be one of a thousand, by all means stay there. If you want a personal experience that is about more than just your big chain hotel points, then check out the Dana! All in all, the Dana was a great place to stay with dÃ©cor, staff and amenities I would expect at much pricier places without half the style of this great find. I will definitely be making the Dana my new place to stay in Chicago! HINT: The doors to rooms ending in "-08" and "-10" are directly across from the elevators. If absolute quiet is essential to you, might want to request not being right across from elevators.

Reviews.Title: “A great Chicago Choice-Different and Fun”
Reviews.Author: travelinman_CA
Reviews.Content: Just finished 5 days at the Dana Hotel and Spa. It is has the current pseudo-Asian feel that is still popular. Rooms are excellent; lights of view and light with a unique design. The beds were a big rave among everyone; you did not want to get up. The room decor has some fun quirks that make it interesting. Work space and internet were outstanding. Great for business or a romantic city visit. Service was outstanding in many ways. Housekeeping was strong. Maintenace was prompt and friendly and corrected a problem in minutes (Scott?). Extra service from the management was appreciated (James). Concierge was fun and informative and passionate about Chicago (Alexandra). Would work on the brunch and food/beverage service; they looked fantastic but service ws cold and slowish. Not a big problem; there are lots of great restaurants walking distance. It was wierd to stand with my luggage and have the front desk chilling in chairs, but hey.....different is good, too. Wierd reception concept; time will tell. Overall, it was a truly great comfortable experience. I appreciate the risk they are taking in changing set concepts. If you look at the other reviews, it is paying off. Thank you for a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the Chicago megahotels!”
Reviews.Author: talibragg
Reviews.Content: Slightly pretentious, not all reception staff were friendly and outgoing; as I checked out the guy on reception was fingering his finger ring all nonchalant like and uninterested. Our room was very clean, however the heating/ cooling was noisy and sensitive. Set to 21c it was constantly turning on and off nosily through the night. Just a niggle, enough to annoy but not enough to push anyone into one of the older hotels in town! Breakfast a great touch, again some staff were friendly, others looked down their nose at their customers. "Free internet" throughout the hotel shouldn't be exceptional but in Chicago it is and the Dana is to be complimented on this too. Never used the Spa, couldn't be bothered - it's prohibitively expensive compared to other hotel spa facilities and some really good day spas in town. If I had to go back to Chicago I'd stay there but only because I already know how mundane the alternative is...

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very modern design, but I had a dark room with a small balcony”
Reviews.Author: jjkathome
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights for business. I usually stay at a starwood hotel but all the hotels like the westin and the sheraton were booked. As well, this hotel was recommended by a friend in Chicago. The rate was incredible. It was half the cost of a comparable hotel. The good: Location was good as it was near many major restaurant. Off Michigan Ave, but close enough for a short walk. Rooms were comfortable and modern. Bed and bedding was comfortable. I recall free internet, and large LCD TV with sound system. Large modern washroom, but the wall between the shower and room is clear glass. Did not bother me. Service was friendly, and the general crowd was young and hip. The Bad: The room I was given had a small glass patio door. That was the only window so the room felt dark. The rooom was pretty small, but it was the darkness that was a bit of a problem. The floors are concrete, so you have to have slippers, which they provide. If I was given a better room, I would recommend. But that dark room turned me off. I would recommend if you got a different room. Had dinner one night at hotel. Restaurant was quite good. They also had a free continental breakfast which was decent. The rate was incredible. I think I paid less than $100 per night. Which is a steal for Chicago when I was there. I think it was a promotional rate. Anyhow, I have mixed feelings about the hotel. But would probably recommend if you like a trendy, modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place, especially for the cost!”
Reviews.Author: ashnwrig
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice now, and it has become my favorite Chicago hotel over The W and even The Peninsula. Now, if you're looking for true 5-star accomodations like The Peninsula or The Ritz, then don't stay here; it's not that kind of place. It's totally unpretentious, hip, minimalist, modern and definitely a 4-star establishment. The Staff are equally unpretentious and friendly. For Chicago, the room rates, spa prices, and the room's "mini-bar/wines/snacks" prices cannot be beat! If you want the best experience, get a corner room; do not get a Cozy King or any standard room with the balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Sheek romantic boutique hotel with breathtaking loft rooms”
Reviews.Author: crbrown75
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is the room. You walk in and you are immediately met with floor to ceiling window's for all exterior walls - looking out over the city. The room itself is all dark hardwood floors, the shower is fantastic, and the flatscreens are nice too. The rest of the hotel is nice and not too pretentious... there is a steakhouse/sushi-bar in the main level and a club at the top floor with a rooftop deck. My wife loved the spa too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location But Minor Flaws....”
Reviews.Author: BurgerGuy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 days and enjoyed the hotel very much. We had a corner suite which was absolutely awesome. The room had 2 balconies which were small but it was 17 degrees so that didn't bother us much. The bathroom was amazing with a large walk in shower with two rain style shower heads. The bed was also extremely comfortable. The rooms were spotless and room service was spot on. The hotel is in a prime location. It's near everything. All the shopping is in walking distance as well as some great restaurants. The Chicago Art Institute (fantastic) is an $8 cab ride away as well. The Field Museum is also in the same area but we didn't care for it. The one issue with the hotel is the services provided. I don't blame the Dana necessarily as it this problem is fairly common with boutique style hotels. The gym is small however the hotel was fairly empty at the time so this wasn't an issue. Room service is severely limited. Two nights we came back to the hotel late after a few pints and its slim pickins on the menu. After 11 the only options are chips and dip and edaname. We called to see if they could make a burger or something but they couldn't. Not a total loss but a little inconvenient. My wife got a message and I told her to book before we left because of some reviews I read of people not being able to get an appointment. Well she called 3 days prior to the weekend and was only able to get something at 7pm on a Sunday and therapies were limited because the guy who was performing the message wasn't able to do what she wanted. Again...nature of the beast with a boutique hotel. Overall...it's a great hotel and would definitely recommend. These types of hotels are not for everyone though. It's a bit trendy and young.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view, service, and lounge!!!! Read below for realistic hotel review”
Reviews.Author: jwflorida_9
Reviews.Content: The arrival was a bit tricky, its VALET service, and you just need to park in front of the Hotel. BUT both the Bell Man and Concierge came out to greet us. They took our bags and immediately asked both of our names and how long we would be with them. It was very personal and comforting. The Concierge proceeded to take us to the check out on the second floor, which we were again greeted with a warm smile and friendly attitude. As we were leaving the Concierge asked where we were having dinner, and called to be sure we got "primium seating" as we were standing there. He then asked about lunch and again, called and made sure we received first service and premium seating. The room was AMAZING!!!! We had a corner room so that the 2 walls exposed to the City were ALL Glass WINDOWS ! Amazing view of State Street and the wonderful Church, I could even hears the bells ring that evening. As the night fell the views became more breathtaking. The bathroom was fun, and creative. Floors of the room were wood and remarkably warm for a Chicago February. The Lounge on the top floor is something you will never forget, and would have a hard time walking away from after a couple cocktails. The outside patio with exposed air to the City and again, Glass walls was something I have never experienced in Chicago. Breakfast the next morning was either Continental or we could order off a menu. I had an omlet that was to die for! I have stayed all over Chicago; The Drake, The W, The Congress (old Chicago Charm), BUT not ONE of those places could stand next to the Dana Hotel and Spa. I will stay here every single time I go to Chicago. It was amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pay close attention to your bill!”
Reviews.Author: niccig13
Reviews.Content: My sister and I were celebrating our 10th wedding anniversaries. We found the dana hotel. I thought it was a bit pricey, but my sister thought that to stay in a great downtown location we might have to pay to play. So she booked two rooms online, one for her and her hubby and one for my hubby and I. Our stay was on a Friday through Sunday. We also, booked a couples massage. After making the reservation, my sister called the next day to make sure the hotel got the resevation and to see about the spa accomadations. Well, to our surprise, the spa did not have any openings for our stay. Although the computer excepted our reservations for spa services. We asked the staff to try to fix that situation. We told the concierge that we were all celebrating our anniversary and we would like to know if the hotel did anything special for special occasions. The hotel assured us that they would do something special. Well, to make a long story short. The hotel did nothing special. We had to remind the front desk on Saturday evening that whatever the hotel was planning, that our check out was the next day. My sister told the front desk clerk that she did not drink champange and if the hotel was going to give that out, do not send that. An hour later, my sister called me in my room and told me that room service just sent them champagne and strawberries and wanted to know if we got any. Well, we did not. I called the concierge desk, and no one answered. I left a message. In the morning there was a letter along with our bill. In short the hotel appolgized that they forgot about our anniversary and gave us free breakfast in bed. They also comp one nights stay. Wow, was my reaction. I was pretty happy about that. Well, the story is not over. The next day, while I was at work my husband called me and asked what was going on with our money. He wanted me to check our bank account. I checked it and to my surprise, not only was the monies taken out for our stay but an additional $600.00 dollars was taken out. Because of that, it caused my account to be overdrawn. I of course was in shock. I called the hotel and asked to explain the charges. They could not. They said they do not have charges taken out for the $600. Over and over the Dana claimed that there could not be any such charges. I made a copy of my account and faxed it to the hotel. I had to call my bank on Monday and had them to cancel the charges. My bank did, fortunately. However,the Dana still did not own the costly mistake. When I called to talk to managment, no one was hardly ever available to talk to me about what had happened. Moreover, the bed was wonderful, the view was spectacular but the only breakfast they offered was roomservice or continental. The dinner was overpriced and not that great. The housekeeping was also a bit lousy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Highly recommend to all couples!!!”
Reviews.Author: MIKIEFORD
Reviews.Content: We thought it was strange that no one we asked knew the name of the Dana Hotel and Spa-must be b/c it's new but we'd like to start spreading the word about how great it is. It was a fabulous hotel-very romantic and the staff was great & very friendly! We enjoyed every second of our 3 night hotel stay last weekend and highly recommend it to all 30 something couples. It is very modern and trendy. The price, location and views were incredible. We'd recommend staying in the floor to ceiling rooms and ditching the balcony room b/c the panoramic view is breathtaking. The king bed and sheets were extremely comfy along with the nice large open shower. I highly recommend this hotel and will be staying again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth The Hype”
Reviews.Author: Chicago37345
Reviews.Content: We came here for my birthday, and the room was tiny, with no window (just a tiny balcony off to the side) and no amenities or extras to brag about. I know they're going for minimalist design, but the room was depressing and the basics were missing. For example, we called down for aspirin when we had a headache and they "didn't have any". To me that's just unacceptable- I would expect that a Motel 6 would have some aspirin for us! Some of the staff were nice, but some were a little surly. This place is not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Oh so many problems.”
Reviews.Author: EricInTheBurbs
Reviews.Content: First my wife and I booked this room through Expedia for Valentines Day and it will be the last time we use Expedia for future vacation plans. We requested a king bed but apparently our reservation could not be guaranteed and upon arrival found that the only availability were two doubles. The hotel arrangement overall is poorly executed and the elevator situation is awful. The hotel could use another 4-5 elevators. We waited on average of 3 minutes for an elevator and at one point had a 10 minute wait before deciding to take the stairs. And to use the elevator (even going down to the lobby from your room) you had to swipe your key card before pressing the button. I'm all about hotel security, but this is just overkill. At night when the hotel restaurant is in full force there is an unpleasant fish odor throughout the hotel lobby and ground level areas. As for the rooms, they are small even for Chicago standards. The bathrooms offer little in the way of privacy. I will admit having glass walls in the showers provides opportunities for "fun" times, but the sliding door (that never stays closed) and exterior shower curtain don't provide the proper privacy for actually USING the bathroom. To whomever designed the rooms, exposed concrete ceilings and pillars are not attractive especially when there are water/rust stains. Overall I don't recommend this hotel unless you are on a business trip alone and don't plan on staying in your room for very much time. The location is great, the hotel staff is extremely friendly, but the room quality is sub-par.

Reviews.Title: “Good Potential, Poor Execution”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoAdventure
Reviews.Content: We choose to stay at the Dana Hotel because of its fantastic location and my wife wanted to try their spa. First, the Spa was average to slightly above average, however pricing was higher than average. Very friendly staff, however they did not have the appropriate equipment (for example, massage for my wife was pre natal, however they did not have a pre natal table, no massage chair for pedi, etc.) If you are expecting a Canyon Ranch experience, keep looking. Second, the hotel room was OK. Nice furniture (comfortable couch and desk), and good amenities (nice bedding, reasonable wine and snacks). Housekeeping left a lot to be desired (dried toothpaste on vanity top, green mystery substance on mirror, and hair on floor and walls in bathroom). Also, you can hear every step (or other... "movements") your upstairs neighbor takes. A major point of annoyance was the fact that housekeeping came at 9:05 am on the day we were checking out. We were not even awake yet! After almost falling back to sleep, there was another knock at the door, this time to restock the mini bar. Check out time is at noon! We just wanted to sleep in a bit, but it seems that the hotel staff had no intention of granting us this guilty pleasure. With so many other outstanding hotels in Chicago at this price point, we probably would not make Dana our choice again.

Reviews.Title: “New Chicago Find!”
Reviews.Author: daytripper010
Reviews.Content: Great new Boutique Hotel. Even with a couple startup bumps- everything was address in the approrpriate manner and overall experience far exceeded expectations! This was the perfect trip to end all business trips after a full month of traveling; am already planning a pleasure trip back. Location is excellent- great restaurants in walking distance and the concierge is outstanding and exceptionally knowledgable. Room amentities to bring the grumpiest of travelers a very big smile; room was consistently cleaned each and every day! Greeted with and welcomed back with the warmest of welcomes even on the coldest of days!! An absolute pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “One of Chicago's best!”
Reviews.Author: PsuMurph
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Dana on a business trip for a week. I was impressed with the entire experience. The general manager sent me a courtesy email after my stay . Here's exactly what I wrote back to her, which probably makes a good review: **************************** Lisa- I don't often return feedback. But, your staff and the hotel was exceptional last week, far exceeding my expectations for a great experience and value. Especially good were your concierge staff. I really wish I could remember their names, but the gentleman on the AM shift and young woman on the evening shift could not have been better hosts. I've already emphatically recommended your hotel to many colleagues, and I'm looking forward to your hospitality in the future. ***************** The manager sent a wonderful reply (and reminded me that the concierge staff names were Tim and Cameron!). This correspondence is indicative of the personalized service I received and I would recommend this hotel emphatically.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous in every way!”
Reviews.Author: lawgoddess1
Reviews.Content: We celebrated New Year's Eve at the Dana this year and it was fabulous! The suites are well appointed and the floor to ceiling windows have a fabulous view of the city. Each and every detail of the rooms is fantastic, including the shower and bath fixtures, hardwood flooring in the room, and the iPod stereo in each room. Vertigo's party in the evening had a great crowd and the shots of vodka that flowed from the "V" shaped ice sculptures on the heated patio overlooking the city were wonderful. Each and every staff member we came into contact with was friendly and helpful and everyone said hello to us and made us feel welcome. The location of the hotel is within walking distance of many amenities, including shopping, bars and much more. The Dana is highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel exceeded expectations, spa not so much!”
Reviews.Author: libbymiller
Reviews.Content: From the beginning of our stay, the hotel staff was very accomodating. We arrived in the pouring, cold rain and they were quick to help us unload and valet. Most staff would greet us by name when we were leaving/returning to the hotel. We were treated as though we were the only guests at the hotel. The room was very modern and hip and we had a tremendous view from our room (a panoramic view of state street). The bathroom was spa-like and the shower was wonderful (a bit of water did flow out onto the floor, but we just laid out towels). My complaint about the room: I did not find the bed/pillows to be as comfortable as other reviews had claimed. Also, we found it to be a challenge to find a comfortable temperature for the room- because of the floor to ceiling windows, there was a bit of a chill in the room, but when the heat was turned on, it instantly became HOT and very dry. (note- we did not address this with the staff, but we did notice this to be a theme among other reviews). The continental breakfast was average, very typical, which was fine with us. My biggest complaint was with the spa- which I found to be small and not as 'posh' as I had expected. Luckily, my husband and I received massages at another spa (which was terrific- exhale spa on state st). I did have a pedicure at the dana spa-- a $70 pedicure!! The woman doing my pedicure asked if I'd like additional services without telling me that there would be an extra fee, so I did not know that I was being charged an extra $30 until I went to pay. And, the pedicure was mediocre to say the least. I sat on a bench instead of a spa chair, did not receive a leg or foot massage, they do not have a foot spa, etc. We found the hotel location to be very nice- an easy walk to the mag mile and down to the state st/rush st. area.

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: klzfamily
Reviews.Content: We had the absolute pleasure of staying at the Dana Hotel on our way through Chicago. We had actually chosen this hotel based on the reviews and comments on Trip Advisor. We were impressed with every aspect of the hotel, from the booking, through to the conclusion. I had called in a few times with questions before we arrived and the people were most helpful and pleasant. When we arrived, we found it easy to get to the check in floor. The staff were excellent, very accomodating and obviously proud of the hotel. They were friendly and helpful. The room itself was just gorgeous. We have stayed in many four and five star hotels. This ranked up there as one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at. The bed was amazing. The bathroom made us want to redecorate ours. The shower was just fabulous. I think I took two showers the first night just to have showers! The amenties were very well thought out. It was a bit disconcerting to have the floor to ceiling windows at first. We certainly got used to it. I found the view amazing. We could see the "Chicago"sign out the window. I have to mention the food from Aja Steak. Oh My God. The best steak I have ever had! We had room service the first night and just wanted to chill out. The food was just to die for. The continenal breakfast the next morning was very nice. Lots of fresh fruit, bagels or muffins. It was more than just a "throw in" breakfast. I have to mention Tim the main conceierge. He was just so wonderful. So helpful with suggestions. Part of the way through the day after buying out most of Hawkshop (and seeing Bill Murray there) we had too many bags to carry around with us. I called Tim and asked about delivery service. He came over in a cab and collected our bags and took them back to the hotel. As well, unfortunately my 10 year old son lost his camera in the back of a cab. Tim and the front desk staff helped us in trying to locate it. Tim was just fantastic. He was able to get our camera back to us in Canada. The best conceierge we have ever seen. We were just so sad to leave. We cant wait to go back. There is no other place we would consider staying in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: mark_the_chocky_guy
Reviews.Content: I have been to Chicago a few times and new the area i wanted to stay it. I cam across the Dana Hotel on tripadvisor - checked it on a number of other sites and got a GREAT price on in - so i decided to try it. What a fantastic find. the location is fantastic, the staff were very friendly and helpful and the room was great. I had a balcony room - because i am a smoker. It wasnt a large but more than sufficient. The stand out is the shower. the bar on the top floor is great fro late 20's/early 30's. breakfast is continental - which is a bit thin, and i did have some food from the restaurant, which was very good overall - a really great place - definitely somewhere i will return to

Reviews.Title: “Not quite 100% yet”
Reviews.Author: ld18
Reviews.Content: A new hotel, billing itself as "cool, small boutique" which about sums it up. Maybe too cool in terms of the visitors who come for the restaurant and bar, but the staff were incredibly friendly. I was in a corner room - with floor to celing windows on two sides the room tended to be cold (the concrete, noncarpted floor excruciatingly so) and it took some time to close all of the blinds in order to change (to be fair, the staff will do this as part of turn down service at night). Very comfortable bed, reasonable workout facility (1 eliptical, 1 bike, 1 treadmill and one lateral motion trainer) as well as some free weights and a new-ish Italian machine designed for core strength building. Small, but perfectly adequate and not well used when I was there. Plus, having a tv on each piece of cardio is always a nice plus. When i was there, they had not yet sorted out cable service to the rooms - so there were no movies on demand and only a handful of channels. I'm sure by now that's sorted. Nice enough amenities and a full suite of them. Steam room available in the fitness/spa floor locker rooms. Nice complimentary breakfast - more than the usual US contintental scheme. Overall tends to be quite a good value and in a very practical part of town for business as well as vacationing.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Luxury at the Dana”
Reviews.Author: Missy821
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here on a Friday night. We requested an upper level room and were promptly placed in a corner room on the 20th floor. Our room had two walls of windows and a spectacular view. The view alone justifies the price. In addition to the view, however, the Dana room contained the single most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in--imported linens, king-sized bed, fluffy down comforter, a mountain of pillows. It is strange entering the hotel through the bottom floor restaurant, but a friendly host quickly directed us upstairs to the lobby. We also checked out Vertigo, the lounge on the top floor, but it was packed at 11:30 on a Friday night, so we opted for the quiet of our room instead. The shower is big enough for several adults and the water pressure is great. The set-up is a little strange--with just one night there, we weren't able to master showering without soaking the rest of the bathroom, as the shower does not have a door that closes, but it's still quite nice. There is only a curtain over a glass wall blocking the view of the shower/bathroom from the rest of the room, but it wasn't an issue for us. The continental breakfast Saturday morning was impressive, as far as continental breakfasts go. There was a large room service menu available at all times of day, but we did not try it. We took breakfast back to our room and made mimosas. Overall, the staff was friendly and competent, the ambiance was great, the furnishings were modern but comfortable, and all of that, in such a prime location, close to so much activity downtown, simply can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katiebearcat97
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Dana for a Friday and Saturday night in November. We traveled to Chicago for a long weekend get away, and were looking forward to relaxation. We'll start by saying that we enjoyed many aspects of the hotel, though had a few minor issues. We checked in on Friday and requested an upper level room, hoping for nice views. We were placed on the 24th (of 26) floor, in a nicely appointed room. The bed was quite comfortable, had a plush down comforter and down pillows. The i-pod speaker system was very convenient, and definitely was a nice addition. The shower was big enough for two adults, and the bathroom as a whole was very nice. Friday night, both my husband and I were quite tired after a long work week, and wanted to rest and go to bed early. At approximately 9 pm, we began hearing rather loud, thumping bass music. We waited several hours, attempting to determine where the sound was coming from?! At 11 pm, the bass continued to be quite loud and slightly disrupting when attempting to fall asleep. My husband called down to the front desk reporting the noise and was advised they would further investigate. At 11:30, the same music continued, and we called down to the front desk again. Finally, at 12:15, my husband went in search of where the sound was coming from. At that point, he realized there was a night club on the 26th (top) floor, with music that could be heard several floors down. He requested a room transfer, and we moved (at 1 am) to the 12th floor, where it was thankfully quiet. The hotel did give us a complimentary bottle of wine, which was a nice compensation. Saturday night, many night club patrons were also in the hotel elevators, and the music was again noted to be loud on the upper floors. So, a suggestion may be to avoid the upper level rooms if you are a light sleeper, or want a quiet room atmosphere. Overall, we enjoyed the room, but personally felt like old-fogeys (we are in our early 30's?), in the trendy, chic atmosphere of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: winesipper
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at the Dana Hotel. I can't speak to the size of the standard rooms because I received a complimentary upgrade to a suite upon our arrival. However, I think I would have enjoyed the hotel (almost) as much if I hadn't. The location of the hotel was excellent. Additionally, as a wine lover, the selections offered in the mini bar were the best that I have ever experienced. The staff was very nice and friendly and the complementary breakfast was a great extra.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Dana!”
Reviews.Author: PCef
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dana for 3 nights Oct. 24th - 27th and found it to be an excellent location as well as a fun and friendly place to stay. We booked the Fall Dining Package for 1 night and it was a great deal. Dinner in AjaSteak was very good and we enjoyed the atmosphere. It also included "breakfast in bed" which was very enjoyable. We also had the opportunity to see 3 different rooms and must admit - they were all great. The corner room with 2 "walls" of ceiling to floor windows was amazing although we did not stay in it. We had a suite with one of the best showers (for 2) that we have seen in a hotel in this price range. The room was very comfortable and we loved it. The other nice advantage is that the wines (full bottles) and snacks in the room are very reasonably priced which is a nice switch from other hotels. We also loved the contemporary look of the hotel while still having a warm and inviting feel. We had drinks upstairs at Vertigo the rooftop bar. Our experience on a Sat. night was that they had a seperate entrance outside for non-guests and people were lined up to get in but they did not come inside the hotel to get there. When we returned to the hotel in the evening there was someone standing by the elevators checking to make sure we were hotel guests before we could go in so we did not have any issues going back to our room. All the employees were very pleasant and we have already recommended this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise...”
Reviews.Author: PRRecBooks
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a place to do interviews in downtown Chicago and stumbled upon the Dana on the internet. I booked it because of the price, location, and thought that it might be more interesting than the major chains where I usually stay. I was right. My avg. per night price was approx. $210. It's a boutique hotel, very hip, with a friendly staff who was there to help but was not intrusive or overly cheery. My room was on the 22nd floor on the corner, with a great view down State St. and the Chicago theater. The living room part had two walls of floor to ceiling windows, a flat screen tv in the corner, and a fully stocked wine/beverage fridge. As a lover of wine I really appreciated this! They also had teas, coffees and some terrific little snacks, all at reasonable prices. The bedroom was separated from the living space by sliding Japanese type doors. The bed was really comfortable, and the bathroom was wonderful. One wall of the shower is glass so if you are there with your honey you could have some fun :-). The rain shower head was amazing after a long flight to the city, and the toiletries were top notch. If you can, try the restaurant. I had the lettuce wedge salad and sea bass entree. Both were great. And the bistro across the street is handy and has terrific ambiance and food. All in all would recommend to anyone except those turned off by ultra-modern decor. I'll definitely stay again when in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in town”
Reviews.Author: NASHMichigan
Reviews.Content: Excellent hidden hotel especially for couples, best comfortable bedding with lots ofpillows, very modern room, the best shower in the whole world. Very clean room and bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Dana”
Reviews.Author: canesohio1
Reviews.Content: My wife & I recently stayed at the Dana Hotel & Spa on 9-12 thru 9-14 and had a fantastic experience. I was in Chicago for a convention and it was also our anniversary. We were able to check in early on Friday so I could go to the convention and my wife could go shopping. We were upgraded to a Serenity suite and it was fantastic. Corner room with a balcony off the living room and off the bedroom. Beautiful wood floors, 2 37" flat panels t.v's and the biggest 2 person shower I have ever seen. Bed was very comfortable with glass wall separating living room from bedroom. Sleek & modern, but very cozy. Wine cooler, snacks, robes, slippers, etc. Had drinks and sushi at AJASteak. Very cool. Tried other restaurants in Chicago for dinner. Complimentary continental breakfast each morning. Service was impeccable!! Very genuine and caring without "having there palm out" all the time. Can't wait to go back and try the spa and Vertigo lounge when it opens. We have traveled all over the country and it definetly makes our top 5. Go to the Dana.

Reviews.Title: “Shhh! It's still a secret”
Reviews.Author: rudytoottootie
Reviews.Content: Be sure that small and ultra modern is your taste. If it is, go directly here. We stayed in room 1015 which is a called a "cozy king". This was a corner room. It had both windows and a tiny balcony, king bed, desk area, two low stools and a table, mini bar, closet and bath. Yes, the drapes to the waterfall shower are controlled on the room side...didn't bother me. Nice TV, phones and sound system. Very clean and tranquil. No noise at all when we stayed. The staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful. The Dana it is located in a nice and convenient area. I booked directly with the hotel because they had the best deals about 6 days before our stay. I would absolutely stay here again and recommend it to anyone visiting Chicago. We didn't have our kids (8 and 9) with us, but they would have been comfortable here in a larger room. One of the few criticisms I have is that you must walk into the restaurant on the ground floor to get to your room. Though there is an elevator behind the restaurant reception area and stairs directly inside from the street entrace, there should be a separate entrance to the second floor hotel lobby. I really liked this hotel and wish I could have stayed longer than two days.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: lorriepatterson1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here after reading some positive reivews online and we were not disappointed. The staff without exception was fabulous-- friendly and helpful. The room from the bedding to the view to the beverages and snacks offered were unusally good. Wonderful comfy robes were in the room with slippers and the bottles of wine offered in the room (for a reasonable price!) were really good--and we are fairly fussy too. The room was quiet and decorated like the W Hotel and our view was great. It did remind me of the W Hotel, but more of a smaller boutique hotel. The location can't be beat either. we will definitely go back!
