Reviews.Title: “loved the dana”
Reviews.Author: Java028
Reviews.Content: o.k, where do i start?? This hotel is grand. I am a world traveller-mostly for work. and i have to say, that this hotel surpasses my expectation. i had a great stay. The staff was amaaaziiing.You have to see for yourself. You have to ask to meet Kennedy. The most profesional and charming guy, i have ever met. The dana definitely made the best choice hiring that guy.His just simply 5 star. did i also mention, his style! My family cant stop talking about their experience there. Try the spa.its luxury. I promised my family we could stay there every year. Great Job guys.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Dana”
Reviews.Author: kokopolo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Dana for four nights. We loved our time in Chicago and most of the things about our stay at the Dana. The location is AWESOME. You are 3 blocks from the Mag Mile, 3 blocks from the North River gallery district, 20 minute walk to Milennium Park and the Art Institute, 10 minutes from the Merchandise Mart, 1 minute from Whole Foods, lots of public transit options. The rooms are modern and nicely furnished, though on the small side. The beds are fantastic - large and comfortable with great linens. The shower is also amazing with great showerheads (i want to get one for my house!) but it is also VERY close to the bed, with a glass wall and a curtain controlled by the person outside of the bathroom. I found this strange, particulary since you can see the whole bathroom through that wall. (I dont know about you, but I like to do my business in private) The staff is very friendly, and if we needed anything they were very accomodating. However, I like to go in and out kinda quietly and I found their inquires a tad much - I think we got asked how our stay was going at least 7 times the first day. Which isnt a bad thing necessarily, just depends on your preference. One last complaint - the hotel was noisy. I dont mind the city noise or the traffic, but the noise inside the hotel was grating. Perhaps it was poor luck that we stayed next to a couple of yahoos who loved to play their loud bass music at 1am and go in and out of their rooms 18 times an hour, but something about the hotel doesnt seem to cushion the noise well. You can hear a door closing from down the hall (those doors are [--] loud!). I dont want to end on a bad note because I really did have a good time. They leave you cookies each night. The bathrobes and slippers are very nice. The coffee (Green Mountain) is free and good quality and is ready in about 3 minutes. It's a good place to stay, but I wouldnt spend $300 a night to stay there. (Here is a tip: I found a good rate on travelocity but then called the hotel and they gave me their best rate guarantee discount of 10%, so we ended up staying for $170 a night which was well worth it).

Reviews.Title: “5 stars for the Dana Hotel & Spa!”
Reviews.Author: efrieds
Reviews.Content: I spent last weekend at the Dana Hotel & Spa with my mom and sisters for a glorious birthday weekend. The rooms were immaculate and the staff was impeccable. Being that it was a new hotel, I wasn't sure if they would have everything in tip top shape but I have to say, I was incredibly impressed. We used many amenities at the hotel including the work out room, spa and restaurant. The spa was a last minute decision because it was raining out and we opted to stay in. We had facials and massages and all were absolutely luxurious. We felt like we were staying at a five star hotel. If you stay there, make sure to try the Mr. Kites candy that they keep in the room in case you are hungry. MMMMM delicious and NOT overpriced for minibar food! Oh and the pillows were so soft and fluffy!! Look out, you may not want to leave your bed!! We can't wait to come back for birthday weekend again next year!

Reviews.Title: “New Chicago Hot Spot”
Reviews.Author: heysetty
Reviews.Content: We live in Chicago, but wanted to stay downtown for our 5-year anniversary. My wife found this hotel while searching online. I walked over at lunch and received a full tour of the rooms and spa from the Sales Manager. This is a brand new hotel that opened a month ago, and is still in the midst of being finished. It is very modern and has some neat amenities in the room. It is a great location for the out of towners who are looking to shop and do the touristy activities. From the moment we arrived through the time we left, we were treated like king and queen. Patrick the bellhop took care of us the second we walked out of the car. We needed to leave the car downstairs as we checked in (no problem). We were give a corner room, number 812 that had a balcony facing north and ceiling to floor windows. The rooms have a modern feel and from what I understand our built form recycled material, including wood floors etc... There is a shower that get this, actually has great water pressure and a window that allows you to watch TV :). The bed was super comfy and the blackout shades allowed us to sleep in! We did not have a chance to visit the bar or restaurant as we had other plans, but it was hopping when we came back at midnight. My guess is that the locals are going to start making this a hot spot. We also did not go to the spa, although it looked pretty nice when I toured it (a lot of tile and things made form recycled materials). For $250, the value was supreme and the service was impeccable. I would highly recommend this to anyone coming to town, even for business!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms - but paint fumes a dealbreaker”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_D_Silver
Reviews.Content: 3.0 rating reflects very mixed experience - some aspects qualify for a 5.0, but paint fumes in fact made it a 1.0. Pros: Great location; extremely helpful and friendly staff; free wi-fi; rooms beautifully appointed with exciting design details and amazing picture window views (some with balconies); good coffee maker in room with complimentary coffee and tea; great bath products. Cons: Some of the exciting design details tried too hard and didn't work that well in practice; poor sound-proofing both to hallway and street. Biggest problem at the time of our visit was that the hotel is so spanking new (about 1 month old) that the chemical fumes from paint, carpets, furniture etc. were overwhelming and caused us to check out prematurely after just the first night. Expect the fumes problem will be solved in time, although with A/C as only source of air circulation, it may take a while. Once the air clears, this hotel should be a great choice if you're looking for modern, chic cool.
